I thought it was because they didn't speak English (which is terrible thing to assume, sorry) but a simple Thank you every time they refilled our waters, brought out food, sat us, anything they did we said Thank you twice to not be greeted with any type of response besides a blank stare...

Anyways onto the food, the duck fried rice was pretty tasty, but I felt like I could have made this myself if I just went to the Chinese BBQ store and got some Chinese duck and added some rice. So verdict is that the duck was tasty but you could also cook this at home. Their green curry was too spicy and wasn't good, the best part of it was the corn. Their sticky rice was undercooked and too hard and not what I wanted to pay 2 dollars for.

Anyways, sad and disappointed from this experience. I'd try out Marnee thai next door if you get a chance.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Chabaa Thai has a problem with their chicken.  I've ordered chicken dishes more than once there, and each time the chicken tasted TERRIBLE.  It tasted really old, dry, and chewy, and also perhaps slightly spoiled, as if it had been cooked elsewhere, sliced up, and then refrigerated for a week before being added to my eggplant dish.  Thing is, EVERYTHING ELSE was great -- I like the people there, and the service, atmosphere, prices, and the other ingredients in my dinner, which aside from the sketchy chicken, tasted great.

Chabaa, can I make a serious suggestion, please?

Every day, all you have to do is walk one block down the street and pick up a fresh roasted whole chicken from any of the nearby Chinese restaurants, you know, the ones with whole chickens and ducks hanging in the window.  Use that chicken instead of whatever it is you currently use, and your chicken dishes will instantly go from 2-star to 4 or even 5-star quality.

The people at Chabaa are really nice, and I believe many of their other dishes are tasty and well-prepared.  I waited 3 or 4 months, and ordered the same dish at least three times, before writing this review.  If you go here, I'd recommend ordering something else besides chicken, and dressing warmly (it's often FREEZING inside on a cold day!).
author: Richard A.

description:
Good price for good food and the best part is that its close to home. I came here a few times and got to go a few times. It is your typical Thai food. Its everything you would expect from a Thai meal. 2 Entrees and an appetizer with tax came out to be ~32ish. 
Only complaint is that it's a bit too oily. I had leftover padthai and puddle of orange oil for my next meal. I reheated the padthai in another plate to remove some of the oil. I can just imagine the amount of oil I consumed. =(
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This place is fantastic! The staff is great and you could get two dishes, some rice and a couple of drinks for under $25. 

The place is fairly small which can lead to loud ambiance but the decor is sleek and nice. 

As for the food they have a couple of different menus depending on the time of day and all the fun of is great. Everyone seems to rave about Marnee Thai bit I actually believe this restaurant to have better quality ingredients and better tasting dishes. The only drawback is not all the dishes are terribly consistent due to different cooks at different times. 

I recommend going in the afternoon and being adventurous and trying dishes off the beaten path.
author: Jack S.

description: We love this place! We get it to go often but also like to stop in and eat sometimes. They have an amazing lunch special. We usually get the tofu pad see ew, yellow curry chicken or tofu, and coconut rice. The food is delicious! It's the best pad see ew I've had. I will say that their pad thai is a bit flavorless so we do not order that.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Overall decent Thai place but nothing too special. 

The servers here are very patient and attentive. I got a bit annoyed because of the language barrier (very limited English) and they didn't understand my questions about the menu, but they kept calm and carried on (the best they could). Still a frustrating experience as a customer. If it's on the menu, then please know what that food item is! For example, the "Special Menu" had fermented crab, and when I asked them what fermented crab was...nobody in the restaurant knew! 

I ordered papaya salad with shrimp. Literally got 4 pieces of shrimp for an extra $2.. oh well. The salad itself was good. The bf ordered this rice dish with ground pork. It was a bit small and I'm pretty sure he wasn't full after LOL. We also shared the crispy tofu appetizer, which was actually my favorite part of the meal. Nicely crisp and not swimming in oil.

Not the best dining experience I've had.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Delivery is so so fast even on the weekend. I got my online order within 30 mins on Sunday. I am very happy.

Food is OK. Enough amount of beef and noodle.

They forget to put peanut powder and chilli powder for my combination beef soup.

I will order again.
author: Ryan S.

description:
I've only ever been here late at night -- good, reliable and relatively cheap late night eats, but I don't think I'd go out of my way to come here during normal lunch or dinner hours. There's just something not efficient to me about eating at restaurants during the day, when you can count on them at odd hours instead. Plus, parking can be horrible around Irving when all the other businesses are open.

Waitresses are very attentive and you get your food right away. I'm not a big fan of Pad Thai because I feel like it always has a weird after taste, but I've tried and actually liked the Pad Thai here. Angel wings and duck dishes are reliable go-to dishes as well. Dishes are good portions and when coming here with friends, we've usually done family style so everyone gets a taste of everything.
author: Ghia G.

description: Hair in my green curry. I Ordered the papaya salad, green curry, fried chicken over fried rice and the salmon. All the food was amazing aside from the hair. The service was terrible, no smiles, no ice in our water. They took the green curry off our bill while giving us dirty looks the whole time like we did it on purpose.
author: Amy T.

description: I always enjoy ordering food from this restaurant on EAT24. The reason I don't give five stars is because I've never actually been down to the restaurant. The food is spectacular, and I absolutely love to order a Thai tea and pineapple fried rice.
author: Maria L.

description: I would give this place 3.5 stars. There wasn't many food places open in this area at the time we were going (11:30pm). My friend found this place and I was glad she did. The food was good but not spectacular. Some dishes were unique. I been to a lot of Thai restaurants in Southern California and I haven't seen some of the dishes they offered. We ordered the roasted duck fried rice and the duck red curry. (I don't remember seeing duck offered in any Thai place I have been to before...unique). I enjoyed both dishes. The duck in the fried rice tasted like the Peking duck. The skin wasn't crisp but it was still good nonetheless. The fried rice tasted like the rice you would get at Asian weddings. The curry tasted really good and the didn't skimp on the meat. This spot will probably be the to go late spot if I'm ever in the area again. Gotta try those other unique dishes!
author: Jimmy P.

description: This place was so good! The service is okay but the food was really great. I would come back here again.
author: Aubreyana P.

description:
If there is one restaurant I'm obsessed with, this is it. Combo beef noodle soup... YES. Mango sticky rice... YES. Every time. Occasionally get a pad thai or pad see ew which are good too. Larb is good. I would say pretty much anything I order is good. lol. The tea, if you order it hot, actually is the thai iced tea without the condensed milk, so it smells as delicious as it tastes. Prices are goooooood. Never feel guilty about eating out here. =)

Parking is street - metered along Irving, free in the residential areas. Just beware of street cleaning signs & meter maids.
author: Jenn D.

description:
Why do I like Chabaa?  Because it's cheaper and more authentic than Marnee Thai, there is hardly a wait, and the service here is good.  I've been a fan of Chabaa for many years now, and I've always been impressed with the quality and freshness of their food.  The only sad thing was when they raised the prices (50 cents), but hey--you can't stop that from happening with inflation in our economy!  Businesses need to make money after all.

My fave dishes here:
-papaya salad - crisp and tart
-hoi jor - delicious crispiness fused with chewy-inside
-corn cakes (my friend Natasha H. loves these!)
-green curry (in my opinion, best green curry in SF, much better than King of Thai's)
-pad thai/see ew/kee mao -- all good

Just a few tips on ordering at the restaurant:
* If you want to get curry, get it at lunch because it comes with rice for free.  If you get curry for dinner, you have to pay extra for rice.
* If you want starch for dinner, get noodles.  Noodles are the same price for lunch and dinner, so you might as well get the noodles for dinner--and the curry (with rice) for lunch.  

This place opens late--later than most restaurants in the general area (I think like 1-2am on some days?) so it's really great for a late night bite...kind of like back in Asia.  The food has been reliably good at all the different times I've went (lunch, late lunch, dinner, late dinner), so I highly recommend this place to anyone.  This place is a much better "substitute" for Marnee Thai, and deserves much more recognition for its fine Thai cooking!
author: Matthew L.

description: Loved the food! We ordered Pad ke mao (w/ Tofu) and Thai Style salted fish fried rice- both were yummy even though the portion size was small. Affordable place to stop by when you crave for Thai in the city!
author: Madhuri V.

description: Open late which is ALWAYS a plus in my books since I am a night owl... it helps an ordeal. Came here after work with a few co workers. Had the duck noodle soup and it was tasty and actually came with a good amount of duck meat... not all fat and bones like most other Asian places. I also tasted my co workers tom yum noodle soup and it was good as well. Everything seems pretty good here and is an alternative to always going to King of Thai, which I can smell some rivalry going on since they both are open late!
author: Tiff C.

description: Ordered yellow beef curry, pad kee mao, pad thai, side of rice and silver noodles, mango sweet rice for desert. Very good food and big portions. With beverages all for 45 bucks. Hella leftovers.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I just moved into the neighborhood and this is the impression of my first time eating here:

Pro: Thai tea ice cream = wow
I have never had thai tea ice cream before, I want to buy a jug of it and I don't even do that.

Con: My veggie pad Thai was very bland, couldn't even finish it, felt like they forgot to put on the sauce or something but we took it to go so I couldn't ask. 

Not going to eat anything other than their ice cream in the future.
author: Marley W.

description:
Parking: Easy!
Hours: OPEN LATE!
Authentic: Not bad
Food quality: Really good
Service: Food came out really fast
Price: $ under $10 for entrees

I had researched this place on yelp and it was a really good find. We were out late in San Francisco and decided to try this place for a late night snack. Though we weren't too hungry, we both ordered entrees. The boyfriend ordered pad see ew with chicken and I ordered the duck fried rice. The duck fried rice had more duck than I expected because usually places are very skimpy on that. But I really liked the fattiness and flavor of the duck. The pad see ew was nothing to die for, but for the fact that the dishes came out in less than 10 minutes, it was really good. The entire meal plus tip was around $20 and high quality food. I definitely recommend this place for the next time you're craving thai late at night.
author: Anh Thu P.

description: I love their chicken pad thai! Luckily I live only a few blocks away from chabaa and every time I'm in the mood for thai food I just walk here. It's usually not crowded in there so you can just sit at a table and they'll hand you menus and water. The service is good, there's one guy who works there who is the sweetest and he's so kind. Overall a good price for what you get and good service.
author: Celine C.

description:
So many good choices here. The top three dishes you must try are the Seafood Red Curry, the crab fried rice, and the pad si yu with roasted duck. 

The new lunch special is awesome! Affordable and filling.
author: Tammy K.

description: Tasty and very reasonably priced. Our server, Olivia, was awesome!
author: Rudy R.

description: Ordered the only won ton soup item on the menu for take out. It said it came with won tons, barbecue pork and bok choy. Even the picture showed all the ingredients. Got home and there was no barbecue pork. You people failed, but you won this review. Congratulations.
author: Opal L.

description: I rarely give one star. I rarely do this But this place made me deeply angry. I ordered crab meat fried rice and asked for extra white onions . She says she has to charge me an extra dollar for onion. Seriously? Then she couldn't get the credit card machine to work and told me she is sorry about that. So I had to go to the bank and get cash and come back. And when I opened my crab meat fried rice, there are only eggs and rice and a few pieces of crab meat. And there were only 10 slices of thin onion. They charged me $11.46 for rice and eggs. She charged me an extra dollar for nothing! I gave her $11.50 cents for my $11.46 meal. And even though it is 4 cents, you are suppose to give the customer back her change you know? But no, she decided to keep it.
author: Irene C.

description:
This place is great.  It's not my favorite Thai restaurant, but I think it's above average. This is the first place I had larb, and it was pretty good. I've had better larb since then, but I still find this place to still be pretty yummy. The word "larb" sounds gross to some, but the dish itself is not! It's a minced meat salad consisting of lettuce, mint, chili, onion, and maybe a few other vegetables  with fish sauce, lime, and other herbs. 

Other dishes I like here are: pad see ew, tom yum noodle soup, and roti with the small curry (new lunch special).
author: April D.

description: Chabaa: came here a couple of times, ordered pad kee mao and got the fried catfish with house special sauce. Thai ice tea is also delicious of course. The dishes are delicious and they even got 5-star rewards going now.
author: Hao B.

description: Open later, and more importantly, the food is fantastic!  Top notch review from a real foodie. Period.
author: J F.

description:
They use canned crab!!! 

We ordered tom yum noodle soup, crab fried rice and Thai tea. The Tom yum noodle soup was the first to arrive. I was about to serve the soup for me and my boyfriend when I found a little bug in the soup. I wasn't that surprised honestly because the restaurant had flies everywhere. So the server came over and took our soup and asked if we wanted a new one. Of course we did! After she left, another server asked us if we wanted a brand new order of the soup. I said yes because isn't that what they're supposed to do? 

The tom yum noodle soup wasn't the worst part. The crab fried rice was served and I could already tell that it wasn't going to be good. The rice was made with jasmine rice but it was cooked with so much water that the fried rice looked more like dried out porridge than fried. I tasted it and automatically knew something was wrong. I called one of the three servers that night and told her that the crab tasted like it was frozen and left out for a couple days. (It smelled and tested spoiled) she looked at me like I didn't know what I was talking about and asked me if I wanted to change my order. I said no and we'll just eat the tom yum noodle soup. She didn't like that so she said she'll replace it and asked demanding us what we wanted. We decided on shrimp pad Thai because it's something that Thai restaurants shouldn't be able to mess up. But that was a mistake. 

After the pad Thai was served, our original server came by the table and said "we tasted the crab and it tasted normal. It only tastes like that because we used canned crab". This made me so angry. Why in the world would you use canned crab when Thai food is always represented to be made with fresh ingredients? Why???!!! I've had fresh crab before because I've lived in the Philippines for ten years where the wet markets have seafood caught the morning of so I know what fresh crab tastes like. 

Note to restaurant: if you run out of fresh crab that night just take it off the menu. Wouldn't you want the customer to leave satisfied and happy because you offered the best?
author: Eka A.

description: The food has an ok flavor, but My Pad Thai was full of eggshells. I couldn't even eat it. So disgusting. I will NEVER order from here again. If there's eggshells in the food, who even knows what else is in there.
author: Melissa S.

description: friendly service, lots of option on menu. Their corn cakes were good. sweet and not oily fried. the seafood noodle soup I got with flat rice noodle, the noodles were a little broken and not soft enough for me. shrimp and calamari was cooked just right, the fish cakes and fish balls were good too. lots of positive in that dish, might have been better if I went with a different noodle option. will be back for sure!
author: Jules L.

description: Awesome little place. Was in the area and spoke with a passer by and they recommended this place. I am glad I came. Food was awesome and very tasty. The curry is full of flavors and each one tastes they way it should. Portion in appropriate. The chargrilled pork neck is insanely good! Service was attentive and price is reasonable. Ordered 2 curry, 2 appy (Hoi jor & pork neck) & papaya salad. $57.25. Great meal
author: Stan C.

description: Best Thai place thatch open late at night. Beleive me i ahave tried all the thai places in and around the Sf area. Usually Thai food is only good when you're drunk but id go here when sober. BONUS points for being open late at night. I have tried multiple dishes but i usually go for their Pad Thai, Papya Salad & Chicken.
author: Danny F.

description: I came here several times and really liked there food- Tom Ka and Pad See Ew were delish. Unfortunately my most recent visit left me with a bad taste in my mouth. I found a bug (like a small beetle) in my Tom Ka soup. They comped the soup but I won't be coming back. Completely disgusted :/
author: Angela D.

description:
Service was great. 

Plenty of tables, hours are great (I think that's what definitely made me like them) and good Thai food even when it's late! 

I got the pad see ew, basil fried rice and yellow curry. Basil fried rice was a little spicy so be careful! But overall it was all good. Definitely wasn't drunk or anything. Lol. 

Try them.
author: Michelle N.

description:
MMM! Chabaa! I came here multiple times with my friends.

I always come here when I'm craving Thai food or more specifically the pad thai noodles. The chicken wing appetizers are sooo delicious that you must try! They are a sweet tangy taste that make your fingers all sticky.

Pad thai, I don't have a comment because all pad thai tastes the same to me, however, my boyfriend always get the yellow curry which I think is really good.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Seriously disappointed with the food I got here. 

My boyfriend and I decided to give Chabaa a try after Marnee Thai was too packed. Why not? How bad can you mess up Pad Thai? Oh boy. It was pretty bad. 

We first got the spring rolls as an appetizer and they were typical spring rolls. I was happy with them - that's the only reason they deserve even one star. I guess the waiters are pretty good with filling up your water because they had two guys just designated for that... though the water is not cold. So. Hope you like lukewarm water with your bad Thai food. 

My boyfriend's pork shoulder fried rice came way before my pad thai so he had to just sit there and look at it for quite a while. Waiters even came by to see if everything was OK, and I had to tell them, OH I didn't even get anything to eat yet... WHOOPS!

The pad thai noodles were pretty much mush they were so overcooked. The flavor was OK but the texture was just so awful. I had to really dig for a piece of chicken and when I found one it was so dry! I didn't try the fried rice but I was told it was super greasy and just didn't have good flavor. The BF is an expert on pork shoulder fried rice - he gets it everywhere and I've never seen him so disappointed. Most Thai places put the sliced pork shoulder over top of the rice but they mixed it throughout. Didn't work well for them. 

I spent 30 dollars on the meal and man do I wish I could have that money back. Pretty much ANYTHING I could buy with that cash would be better than this awful food. We didn't even want to eat our hefty amount of leftovers. Sigh. Won't be back!

PS - Can someone please explain how a menu is "secret" if it's given to you with the regular menu? Maybe they should hide it a little better. (head scratch)
author: Dana J.

description:
Half of my good friends are from city, and they know all of the delicious little joints. We wanted to grab a quick dinner and one of our friends suggested this place. I love thai food in general, but for the first time, I did not order my usual (pad kee mao). I wanted a noodle soup, so I ordered the combo beef noodle soup with the flat rice noodles. I did not regret it at all. The broth is perfect! My friend ordered a pad kee mao, and it looked pretty tasty as well. The price  here is also really fair! Such big portions for a cheap price. Definitely would come here again to try the other dishes they have. 

The only things about this area is the parking. It can be pretty ridiculous, but this place is definitely worth it. Tpumps and other dessert/tea places are all around the area as well.
author: Gina N.

description: Delicious!  I ordered the Pad Si Yu for a second time, and I was not disappointed.  Tried the Yellow Curry but I asked for it medium spicy (still not too hot but it had good flavor to balance the sweetness)... And it was fantastic!  I have ordered the mango sticky rice before and it was honestly subpar; mostly because the mango wasn't ripe.  Today I gave it a second try and I almost died.  It was AMAZING.  I still think the amount of mango/sticky rice you get for the price is small, but this could just be based on the portion sizes I have found elsewhere.  Either way, I'm looking forward to leftovers.
author: Tara C.

description: Great food and great portion size! I prefer this to Marnee Thai and King of Thai. Also going here I actually get good service.
author: Kaycie N.

description:
After a very long day it was time to grab some grub before settling down for the day.  We initially dropped into a Vietnamese restaurant but quickly left after we realized that nothing on the menu was vegetarian and two members of our group were unable to order.  Fortunately Chabaa was just another block or so down the street and had plenty of vegetarian and vegan options, along with meat of course, to whet all of our palettes.

I ordered the green curry with chicken with brown rice as my comparison benchmark this evening.  Despite growing up with Thai food, this was some exceptional stuff.  I was impressed with the great flavor and spice of the curry and the chicken was nice and tender.  If I had any complaint, it would be that there wasn't nearly enough of the delicious eggplant, but that's minor against the backdrop of the great overall meal.

I was really impressed with Chabaa's authentic offerings.  They had tons of vegetarian options for our friends, and I think everybody thoroughly enjoyed their dinners.  The price was right and the service was very good and well and I would definitely come back to try some of their other great eats!

Food: 8/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Overall Impression: Average food at average prices. Don't expect something spectacular, but you will get something that gets the job done.

Cost: Decent prices. Every dish is around 8-10 dollars.

Taste: Mediocre food with plain ingredients. We got a curry, a rice dish, and a dry noodle dish. All of the dishes were missing that extra spice/herb that would've taken it to the next level. As it stands, everything was forgettable.

Customer Service: Nothing special. Just the classic water refills from time to time.

Ambience/Atmosphere: Pretty plain and simple. You would sit there to eat and hang out somewhere else afterwards.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I think I sounded like a total bitch today. My excuse is the party next to us was super loud and obnoxious. Every time I said something, the server didn't hear, so I practically had to yell it. It happened every time I asked for something. So either that party was obnoxious or the servers are deaf (I pick the former).

Anyways, besides them. I called ahead of time for a party of three in 10-15 minutes. They said there will be a table for us. Awesome! We get there, I tell the server we're a party of three and I called ahead of time. She didn't hear me, sat us at another table, that's cool, doesn't bother me. In fact, now that I think back to it, that would've probably been a better table. We order, food comes out fairly quickly. Asked for napkins and they gave us peppers/etc. (fault = obnoxious party... maybe). The server packed my to-go food for me, that was nice.

Food was pretty good, the chicken was not dry at all, unlike most places, and it had an equal balance of spice. Although the dish was supposed to be spicy, it wasn't overpowering.

But seriously, large parties should not come here. Or if you do, be respectful of other patrons. Don't walk around like you own the place and scream like nobody's around. This place is like a hallway, it's tiny and there's a f-ing echo! No amount of death glares made them shut up.

Restaurant = 4 stars
Obnoxious part next to us = 0 stars
author: Stacy C.

description: I've been to Chabaa twice now and both times I left extremely satisfied.  I got the Pad See Yew twice.  I love chow fun/ wide flat rice noodles in general but Chabaa has to be my favorite.  It is very flavorful and the portion size is just right.  I love my food spicy so I always add the pepper sauce they have on the table.
author: Sam L.

description: We had a friend stay over for the weekend and we shared a love for Thai mango sticky rice. I would have made it myself but I didn't have the rice, so I ordered 2 mango sticky rice orders and 2 Thai iced teas for delivery, to meet the $15 minimum order. I got 2 miniature mango sticky rices and 2 Thai coffee teas. Secondly the rice was stuck together that it was hard to pull apart, too chewy. This will be the first and last time I ordered food from here. Waste of $19 with tax and tip.
author: Crys L.

description:
We have started going to Chabaa couple months ago and now we go there almost every week. 
They have very authentic thai food. I personally like the yellow curry and thai style fried rice the best.
author: June F.

description:
We went here last Saturday (2/11) after the Chinese New Year's Parade, based on a quick Yelp search and it's 4 star rating.
The place was tiny, but packed, so we decided to give it a try.
I give it a (1) star, due to the larvae i found at the bottom of my wonton soup, after almost finishing it ... YUCK!
author: N B.

description:
Had Tom yum noodle soup & pad thai. Both were ayte, had better though.

Nothing super special and the service was decent as well. 

At least I didn't get diarrhea, so that's a win right?
author: Ivan K.

description:
There need to be more non-fast food restaurants that open late like Chabaa. And on a Sunday night.

I am uberly happy that this place opened til 1am since my friends and I stopped by after a long drive from Los Angeles back to San Francisco. We ordered phad thai, pineapple fried rice, and tom yum soup, which all were delicious! Just enough noodles. Just enough pineapples. Just enough spice and sour. And they have Sprite! That's important to note in my dinning experience here because I get easily motion-sickness and being in a car for 6-7 hours didn't help with my tummy. Sprite really helps minimize the nausea. Also, a neat surprise with the Sprite was the rose made out of the straw paper at the end of my straw. (Go see the picture!). 

As for the service, it was great. Especially for a restaurant that's not a bar and opens til 1am, everyone was friendly and not grumpy. They also have take-out if you have a sudden craving for Thai food at midnight.

Unfortunately, I live in Seattle. Time to scout out for something similar.
author: Vicky L.

description:
This place was suggested to me by a coworker. Thankfully it was 10x better than his other Thai suggestion! http://www.yelp.com/biz/king-of-thai-noodle-house-no-2-san-francisco#hrid:EaDi_psSAWfOatBSF0eL-A He was almost relieved of his restaurant picking privileges for that one...

Based on my usual order of green curry with tofu, this is one of the best I've had. 5 stars with plenty of spice. I get it every time I go there since there's not much else on the menu that looks tempting to me as a vegan. Although it does say on the menu that they will make most items without eggs and meat/fish sauce. The price isn't too bad. Could be a bit less.  

Usually when we eat in for lunch, it's just us and maybe one or two other tables full. The several times I've been there, the waitresses have all been different, yet all of 'em easy on the eyes and nice. The short spinner chick is especially attractive. It's a good enough place to occasionally stretch our "45 min" lunch break a bit with a trip out to The Sunset for the food and views.
author: John B.

description:
No.

Don't do it. Seriously... I don't know HOW this place has such good reviews! 

Went here with my partner and we were both SO sad! We live right up the street and this place looked alright  from the outside and the reviews were great but it was TOTALLY lacking!

The curry I got was mostly water and seriously lacking in the flavor department. But the WORST part, the bell peppers in the dish were bad! All of them! Which means that most-likely the entire dish was bad. Not to mention they were not even fully cooked... they were still pretty crunchy but sour! Ewww! I actually spit them out and stopped eating. 

I really wanted to love this place, but I can't. Hopefully this place will change but with so many options and everything so close by, I can't imagine I will come here again anytime ........ ever. I would have to be pretty desperate to come here...
author: L. J.

description: This place is usually less crowded than Marnee - but for good reason. Chabaa has been on Irving for a long time, and by no means is a "hole in the wall"; it's just an average Thai restaurant (that may have some questionable cleanliness practices). In terms of food, I had the duck larb, pumpkin red curry, and Pad Thai (the first two were on the "Secret" menu). The larb was strange - I understand that it's supposed to be like a duck meat/skin, Thai basil, and lime sour salad, but the flavors were just off and overpowering, to the extent that it felt like eating food doused in vinegar and Thai chili. The duck was also quite chewy - the skin wasn't crisp and the meat was rather stringy. The pumpkin curry was alright - while the pumpkin was cooked down quite well (rather soft), the curry itself was watery and thin - very little coconut milk or richness or flavor. The pad thai was okay; small shrimp portions as well as tofu; there were lots of sprouts (the ratio is nearly 1:1 in terms of sprouts to noodles) and the flavor was far too sweet. Overall, a disappointing meal - while everything looked appetizing, the flavors just did not gel really well at all.
author: Bobby W.

description: I would give a 0 star if I could for two reasons.  The delivery driver was rude.  He said he's already outside of my house and I said I'm standing outside of my gate and standing on the curb of the street but he yelled back at me and kept saying that's he's outside, like what did he want me to do? Go look for him?! I even walked on the other side of the street but didn't see him there and he still kept insisting that he's outside of my house and later realized he's at the wrong address. And 30 mins later, he finally found my place and I signed the check.  Second reason, he had the guts to call me back to tell me that I forgot to tip.  Are you kidding me?! Tip is earned based on your service, and your yelling towards a customer doesn't earn you a tip.  Extremely rude!!!
author: Argie L.

description:
After coming to you for years, I am sad to say we are breaking up. This place has gone downhill and is no longer what it used to be. I will not be back (for a very loooong time at least).

Chabaa used to be reliable for good, hot, yummy Thai food, without a long wait and open even in the late hours. 

I gave you three chances. This past Friday was the last strike - we are done.

STRIKE ONE:
I ordered the Silver Noodle Salad. It was so salty! I think the sauce was straight up fish sauce and lime. It was like biting into pure salt. The waitress delivered the other dishes we ordered and offered to remake my salad. Ok, it comes back just slightly less salty. I'm in a hurry, its still salty but I can deal with it. The shrimp was slightly 'weird' I can't name it, but I'm in a hurry to leave, took a couple bites, whatever. I ate at most half a plate and ended up having to go to the bathroom every hour of the night after - 2am, 3am, 4am, 5am, etc. 

STRIKE TWO:
Roast Duck Noodle Soup. There's bugs swimming in my soup. Probably from the veggies, I guess stuff like this can happen.. I let the waiter know and he took it back to remake it. Round Two: The noodles come back and there are STILL bugs in my soup! Really? I let the waiter know again and he takes it back. A waitress comes to me and asks if I want another one remade. No, I don't! Two times is enough. She takes it item off my tab..

STRIKE THREE:
I used to love their Beef Noodle Soup. Did you get a new cook or something? My noodles sucked. Not even half way through my meal my rice noodles were breaking into little bits as I'm trying to pick them up with my fork and spoon. I can easily go to any other Thai place and my noodles will not do that. Ridiculous. Perhaps there were bugs in this broth too, just that I can't see it since the broth is not clear..

I like that Chabaa is close to my house, but this is unacceptable. There are plenty of other Thai restaurants nearby. Marnee Thai is one block away. There's King of Thai, Amphawa, Osha Thai..
author: Mimi L.

description:
I used to come here with my coworker when we worked nearby. Now I only come here when I planned on eating on Irving but that restaurant is already closed (Sawaii!). First things first, I love that they don't close from 3-5 like a lot of restaurants do. I practically only get to eat out when I'm not working. And when I'm not working, I tend to sleep in a little! By the time I get dressed and made-up, it's too late to eat at so many places!!
Well, Chabaa to the rescue. There's always hardly anyone here. Which is nice, because it gives me a nice environment to relax and/or cure that hangover.
I've always gotten their fried rices. Either crab or duck fried rice--both delicious! And I've tried their fried chicken fried rice, tom yum noodle and seafood fried noodle which are all pretty good also.
The service is always great! But parking not so much. So when I am lucky to find a nice spot, (not metered) I can also stop by T-pumps for dessert!
author: Athena L.

description:
This place never disappoints!!!! The hubby always gets soup soupy dish and I go for some mean carbs with a rice plate! 

Just one less star though cause of lighting, a girl's gotta see her man during their date!!!
author: Laverne A.

description: One of my favorite go to thai place! Really good papaya salad and you can order the stinky version which the Som Tum Pu Kem. I usually like ordering off their "secret" menu, which is the menu that comes separate from the larger menu. The secret menu offers more authentic thai dishes and it reminds me kind of home made food.
author: Jasmine K.

description:
Consistent and a great go-to restaurant. We'll be back for sure as we have been for the past decade.

Tonight was:
Pad thai, pad see ew, pineapple fried rice, corn cakes, fried bean curd thing, eggplant. Always pleasant service as well :)
author: Con L.

description:
We were seated right away. Small space but great food. Ordered the Pork Pad See Ew (I always get this at any Thai restaurant), Egg Rolls, and Duck Fried Rice. The Pad See Ew had that awesome smoked flavor but still can't compare to Krua Thai's in West Covina. The Duck Fried Rice was very tasty and could feed three people. Egg Rolls came with a sweet and sour sauce. 

If I lived in San Francisco, I'd be a regular here due to my frequent Thai food cravings.
author: Laine C.

description:
I like everything about this place. From the late hours to the red duck curry, broken English and origami straw covers...

When you're hungry in the Outer Sunset at 11:30 p.m. there's no better place to look.
author: Allen T.

description: I ordered take out Saturday night (pad thai, pad see ew, pad kee mao) and 2 of the orders had pieces of a metal scrub in the food! The food was average but it was hard to keep eating after finding bits of metal in it. I will definitely stick to Marnee Thai next time.
author: Rhonda T.

description: Chabaa is my go-to place to grab a satisfying meal late night in the Sunset. One of the things I like most about this place is how friendly and welcoming the staff treats the customers. I like that the portion sizes are generous and although I've had a few things from the menu that I felt were "hit or miss" the value, hours, and service have always compensated. My current obsession is the Pineapple Fried Rice! I would also recommend the Pumpkin Curry.
author: Jedd B.

description:
My girlfriend and I had lunch here and it was after we ate that she spotted something moving on the wall onto the table behind me...

A COCKROACH.  

Didn't want to embarrass the workers in front of other customers and hate to be the bearer of bad news, but that will be our last time there.
author: Jessica B.

description: One of my fave Thai restaurants in the city. Crab fried rice is the best here. Chill service. Parking isn't so bad in this area too.
author: Jamie B.

description:
Yummy, Fast and worth it - I work in Union Square and decided to try Chabaa out - I love Pad Thai with Shrimp and Chicken - I was a little worried as the place was small and and older - The owners keep the place very tidy and clean and the Chef was so good getting around the tiny kitchen and she was fast!

My take-out was done in no time and I brought back to the office - Everyone who saw my Pad Thai were OOOO'ing and AWWW'ing it - It was delicious! Hands down one of the better Pad Thai's I have had in a long time - Fresh ingredients, Chicken was tasty with a slight smoky taste to it, large shrimps and seasoned to perfection (not too much fish sauce) - Yummy!

I will definitely return and tell my friends!
author: Gigi N.

description: Great selection  of Thai food. Got the red curry with chicken and it was delicious! Quick service as well.
author: Linda V.

description: Great little restaurant! The food here is so delicious! My favorite is the papaya salad, so good! Have tried all there current Curry's and mmm are they good also! If your in the area from 11-4 monday-friday, they have an awesome lunch special! Around 9 dollars for a well rounded meal, salad,soup,rice,and your choice of curry, thai styled fried rice, and I believe pad Thai? Would recommend to anyone have a few friends whom tried it once and are now regulars.
author: Joey H.

description:
Good food. Decent service. Okay ambiance.

I've only been here a handful of times but I usually get the Pad See-Ew which is up to par with my Pad See-Ew standards. Hubby usually gets a fried rice of sorts. Sometimes we get the prawns in a blanket appetizer. Everything is always hot, fresh and delicious when it comes to the table.

Good restaurant overall :)
author: Lauren L.

description:
solid thai at great prices and veg friendly. Since it's lent and I gave up land meat for 40 days & nights (more exciting that movie from the 90's) 

Veggie egg roll - oh how I crave deep fried anything didn't feel as guilty since it was packed with veggies

Green curry with prawns - total of 4 prawns (hey what do you expect?) and brown rice. The green curry was good I would like a bit more heat and the Haricot Vert threw me off - I mean we're in the Outer Sunset how about soem Chinese long beans or even some eggplant 

Pad Thai with tofu - I usually find pad Thai to be heavy of the fish sauce so I order the pad see ew but I enjoyed Chabaa's. Not overall fishy. Noodles were a bit clumpy but still solid.
author: Jade W.

description: Tastes pretty good.  Portions are a bit small for the price.  Tip: For noodle dishes, add extra noodles.  For non-noodle dishes, order a la carte and add rice on the side.
author: Javier G.

description: I come here often. Service is always on par and the food is always top notch. My favorite is the Tom Yum with their coconut rice. I could eat this daily.
author: Lauren R.

description:
This is my go to Thai place!

I come here all the time when I want my Thai food fix. It's a cute, clean and good environment. When it's cold, you will usually see a heater by the door to keep guests warm. 

I love their Tom Yum soup with chicken ($7.95) and I usually add rice stick noodle (extra $1) so it's more of an entree rather than just a soup. I've had this at many other restaurants, but none that taste as good as chabaa's. It's the perfect sweet, sour and a kick of spiciness for my taste buds. 

I've also tried their pad Thai, which is also delicious. Definitely beats king of thais dishes. 

Service is always friendly and very welcoming. Since it's on Irving, parking can be challenging if you go at the peak times, but I've never seen chabaa so packed that they can't seat you, which is always a good thing.
author: Valerie T.

description:
A good sushi bar is near impossible to find in the Sunset district, especially on a Monday and furthermore, during the hours of 2-5PM -- so a couple of friends and I gave up ended at Chabaa's. 

Fried Chicken Wings - 
Decent wings. There wasn't too much meat on each wing and was more on the dry side. It resembled the Angel Wings from Marnee Thai, but just didn't compare..

Papaya Salad - 
Chabaa's papaya salad comes mildly spicy, so for you fire eaters out there, request for more chilies! Besides that, the papaya salad tastes like any other papaya salad out there.

Roasted Duck - [http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/tbONuhpjj_ZI2Y5Tx6EeWg/l.jpg] 
We got the "A La Carte" style roast duck which was an additional $4 up-charge. Instead of an individual dish that comes with rice, the rice was just substitute with a bed of bok choy.. No actually extra "A La Carte" portions.. It was very disappointing, despite the delicious roast duck and especially since they charge you for rice!

Tom Ka Shrimp Coconut Soup - [http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/qWc86WTITqhd9uT-84tjRw/l.jpg]
I love Thai food but this dish wasn't for me. Sliced up (raw) button mushrooms and peeled shrimp in a tangy sweet soup. It just didn't blend well with me. Smelt like coconut, looked like coconut, but just didn't taste at all like coconut..

Roti with Coconut Ice Cream - [http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/l58VcBHQ-tfSGdFUuORPLg/l.jpg]
The dessert was spot on! It's always great to end a Thai meal with some warm Roti and a big scoop of coconut ice cream. Just don't forget to ask for condensed milk!

I'm a huge fan of Thai food so my expectations might have been a little high. Each dish was really either a hit or a miss. What was really interesting was how their tea had a hint of coconut flavor. My friend hated it because it was literally coconut overkill but I didn't think it was that bad, probably due to my poor sense of smell. 

I would come back for seconds but probably just to check out their curry dishes.
author: Albert L.

description:
THE ABSOLUTE BEST LATE AT NIGHT. 

The food is fantastic (combination beef noodle soup, any fried rice, wings, curry... literally anything on the menu) but what puts this place over the top is the service! 

The girl and guy combo that seem to usually work late at night are literally the nicest people alive, so nice that I almost feel bad asking them to do anything for me. They are always on point with water refilling and just have the best attitudes ever with any requests you may have -- really hard at 1am if you ask me. 

other bonus: the straw wrapper rose is adorable and makes me so happy every time i order thai iced tea :3
author: Debra L.

description: Mediocre Thai food. It's edible but just not great. We ordered the pad kee mao which I've had many times at other Thai joints and this was underwhelming. And we also had the duck noodle soup which I've also had at another Thai restaurant. It was "blah" as well. Service was ok.
author: Ali F.

description:
I've passed by this place about a million times on the way to Marne Thai and to the hundreds of tapioca places on Irving. I always noticed a lot of people inside eating so I decided try it. 

I got the yellow curry and pad kee mao. I was not impressed by the yellow curry at all. It was very watered down with little to no flavor at all. It had the consistency of water and got everywhere on my plate. Yes, the portion was big...but it was basically just water! There was very little meat and veggies. The pad kee moa was much better, but it was still not as good as any other place I have tried in the city. 

I don't see why people come here when there are other, much more worthy Thai places nearby (even if it is a bit more expensive)...
author: Kevin H.

description:
We had just arrived in San Francisco and needed to eat dinner, this was right around the corner from our hotel near Union Square, and was full of people. 

We waited briefly for a table in this small space. We ordered Hol Jor - really tasty and good, a bit bland.

I ordered Guay Tiew Nua Sub Noodles - basically Pad Se-Yu with ground beef, and a fried egg, and it was over-the-top good. I loved it and would order it again. and again.

My friend had fried chicken breast over fried rice, which he said was the best he ever had. The fried rice was good. I thought the fried chicken was ok.

All in all, very good.
author: Joe S.

description:
The food's gone downhill.  I didn't have time to make dinner after work so I asked Hubby, Thai from Marnee Thai or Chabaa?  He says, "Chabaa" because he likes their fried chicken breast over rice.  I got the roast duck over fried rice and crab fried rice.  For $30 worth of food, I was pretty disappointed.

The rice were soggy and the crab fried rice was canned crab, chopped into chunks and was tasteless and bland. Out of all 3 dishes, the duck fried rice had more flavor but there was barely 1/4 lb of meat (duck in it).  I could've gone down the street and bought roasted duck from one of the Chinese deli/BBQ places and made the dish myself!  And it would've tasted better too.

Hubby even said the rice in his fried chicken dish was horrible.  He admitted it was better to go back to Marnee Thai but they don't have the fried chicken breasts.  
The ladies they have answering the phones to take your orders for takeout have trouble understanding English on the phone. She didn't know what I meant when I told her I wanted to place 3 orders of food.  At the end of the call, she asked if I wanted a "box" for 10 cents.  I think she wanted to know if I wanted a plastic bag (which are banned in SF restaurants now) to carry my takeout food home.  

Not planning on going back here for food, even the fried rice dishes are almost $1 less at Marnee Thai.
author: Ry T.

description: Probably the best thai food I've had in a while. The chicken satay was amazing as well as the peanut sauce, the flavors were on point. The curry was amazing too from what my girlfriend had but mine wasn't that tasty. It was orange curry which was a special and It was just too much for my girl and I, not what we expected and it must be one of those exotic things only the locals like, I did not care for it. I'll just stick with what I know which is yellow curry.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Servers here are so rude. I don't recall ever receiving such flat out rude service it was shocking. Made reservations for a party of 7 on a Friday night. Since it was a full house you can tell right away by the look of their faces that they were overwhelmed. And they won't seat us unless everyone was there.  Normally I don't mind as much but we had elderly ppl with us - show some respect and at least let them sit first.  Besides the table we reserved was ready for us but for whatever reason they refused to seat us. 

We started off with appetizers and when it arrived we realized that they did not give us any utensils to eat with. We asked one of the waitresses that happened to walk by our table...she paused for a few seconds and then straight walked away w/out saying anything. I'm not sure if she even heard me but obviously she did cuz shortly after a diff waiter dropped off the utensils. 

Service throughout the night remained bad. They messed up on our order, we asked for more napkins but never received it, asked for refill of water but it took forever etc...

The one and only dish I would recommend is their Penang curry with pumpkin.  It's yummy but I wouldn't step foot in there again.
author: Cathy M.

description:
After hiking at Land's End, we were starving for some good thai food.  We remember getting take-out from Chabaa thai a long time ago and liked the food.  So we decided to pick up food here again since it was nearby.  We ordered duck fried rice, pad thai with chicken, and green curry with pork.  The lady who answered the phone did not ask us about the spicy level we wanted, so make sure to mention it if you want your food spicy (otherwise, according to her, everything would be non-spicy by default).   The food smelled great in the car, making us even more hungry!

We got home and couldn't wait to start eating.  I noticed though the portion of green curry was much less than last time.    The duck fried rice was really delicious!  Every single grain of rice was separate and coated with great flavors!   The flavor of the green curry was also very good, however, pork was quite dry.   Pad thai was a bit disappointing, a lot of noodles, but not much flavor.  And the noodles were all stuck together; chicken was a bit dry too.  

Overall, they were not bad for the price.  If you plan to pick it up, do a phone order instead of online order.  I think some dishes have a higher price online.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Chicken wings screaming good but not enough food -leaves you wanting more 
Pumpkin yellow curry delicious but not enough pumpkin - it is called pumpkin curry hello
The orange curry so darn hot you can't taste it - avoid avoid avoid - and I like hot
author: sherri s.

description: I went here for dinner. We got Chicken Pad Thai and some meat dish with soy sauce and flat rice noodle. The food was okay. Not bad but not something to rave about. As usual, there was more of the noodles than the actual meat. Just tasted like another King of Thai to me. The service was great though, so for that I would come back.
author: Pam Y.

description:
Pros: Accepts CC, nice customer service
Cons: Dark restaurant, unusual curry-to-rice proportion (or at least to me)

Came for dinner with some friends around 5 pm. No wait, almost empty other than one other party. Was given our menus, and glasses of water when first being serviced. After a good amount of time with the menu, the waiter took our orders, and answered my question regarding the spice level of the green curry. I asked if it was very spicy, according to the two chili marks compared to the red and yellow curry, and he said that it was. Hearing that it was very spicy, I ordered it because I love spicy food and green curry, and so together, it should have been a great meal. Because it was after lunch, the green curry was a la carte, and so I had to order a side order of rice to go along with it.

Our food came out very quickly. My curry was first to come out and I was also given a nice large scoop of rice. My first sip of the curry, I was seeing how spicy "very spicy" was. I was actually disappointed. There was some heat, but not enough to be considered very spicy. I added a good amount of dried red pepper flakes into the curry to up the spicy level. The curry had a lot of bamboo, a good amount of green beans, and two medium slices of maybe a quarter of a Japanese eggplant (roughly 1 1/2 inches of eggplant that was cut into quarters and you're only given a half of the eggplant, if that makes any sense). I ordered the chicken, which looking back I regret now. The chicken was a little rough, a little too overcooked and it was not tasty, very tasteless actually. Toward the bottom, the curry became saltier and greasier. I am not sure how much oil and coconut milk is used here but it was a very heavy curry. 

If I come back, it will probably be to eat lunch so I don't have to worry about the rice charge. I want to try the Pad Thai and by tasting that, I think I will have a better idea of Chabaa. Until then, I am going to rate Chabaa a 3 stars.
author: Alex T.

description:
Got a hot tip from SF Weekly about some stuff on their thai menu that isn't translated and I was fairly pleased. Here's the 3 dishes we got:

Waterfall Salad with Beef - Basically beef in fish sauce and other stuff. Not bad but nothing special.

Grilled Pork Neck with Jaew sauce - pretty damn good. pork neck has this particular texture to it that when grilled curls in to delectable bits. The sauce is pretty intense but since you're dipping you can have as much or little as you can handle.

Issan Norther Style sausage - pork sausage with sticky rice fermented. It's really unique tasting and though I don't think I could eat it everyday, I could totally eat it on the regular. For sure get this.
author: Misha T.

description:
Been going here for a long time now.  I especially like the roast duck fried rice and the pad see ewe.  Those are my two favorite dish there.  The service is always very quick and they will get you in there and eating in no time.  

This place opens extremely late too so if you're in the mood for food you can get it late night!  Pad Thai is also really good here if you're interested,  there is an alternative place called marnee Thai around but I wasn't very interested after the incident that happened in the other marnees.
author: Danny C.

description:
I came to this place 6 years ago when it first opened and it was pretty good. However, I came here to meet someone for dinner the other day and HOLY SH*T WHAT HAPPENED?!

Food: Overcooked and cooks didn't pay attention to our food allergy needs. FAIL.

Service: Though the servers were nice, it seemed like they wanted us to pay asap and eat quick.

Overall Satisfaction: NOT IMPRESSED. Chabaa just got black listed from my Thai Restaurant list.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
SO much better than Marnee (jerks..) and at better prices (ranging from $7-10).
Their pad thai? You can't lose.
Their pad si yu? You'll always win.
Their pineapple fried rice? Amazeballs

AND they're open late til 1am!
author: Andrew T.

description: No lunch special here. But lots of options. The combo appetizer platter is pretty decent. Pad thai is solid and large, even though I would've liked more shrimp in mine.
author: Sherry L.

description:
With so many awesome Thai places in the city, it is hard to distinguish one from another. This place have a 'secret Thai menu', which isn't really a secret considering they give it to you along with the regular menu. 
Their food is consistently good and well executed. The prices are very reasonable, and they have a lot of varieties too.
author: Nancy Z.

description:
We were just walking around for a good place to eat, without yelping(for a change) and came accross Chabaa. It was relatively crowded but we got seated in 5 mins.

The foood was just amazin! 

The hot and sour soup is to die for. i was there with my family and we were all vegetarians. They made all the dishes vegetarian for us.

Service and food was great. Ambience aint that good so it loses points there!
author: Supriya M.

description:
After my two previous visits at this wonderful CHABAA Thai Restaurant... I couldnt resist on coming back here for the third time... So far so good this CHABAA Thai Restaurant is really good and not that bad at all!!!

On my third visit to CHABAA for lunch, once I got seated by my hostess which was also my waitress was very very friendly with me and really knows me really well by my name... I now have to say CHABAA is now my favorite Thai Restaurant to go to for lunch!!!!!

~~~~THIS IS WHAT I ATE SO FAR AT CHABAA THAI RESTAURANT~~~~

           ~~~~FRIED CHICKEN OVER FRIED RICE TWO TIMES~~~~
               ~~~~CRAB MEAT OVER FRIED RICE ONE TIME~~~~

~~~~~I WILL DEFINITELY WILL BE BACK AGAIN AT CHABAA THAI RESTAURANT TO TRY ANOTHER DIFFERENT ITEM FOR LUNCH~~~~~
author: William B.

description:
Pra ram pork
Pineapple fried rice
Pan fried noodles with egg on top
Yellow chicken curry
Corn cakes
Thai iced tea

All surprisingly good.  We enjoyed every single thing we ordered.  

The only thing that I wasn't crazy about was the iced tea.  I can't quite put my finger on it.  Maybe there was more tea than cream in it, and I'm not used to that?  I don't know.  But aside from that, all the food was delicious.

About $50 for all the dishes - but we came away with enough for another full meal.  Not too bad.
author: Denise M.

description:
I tried this yesterday, at 10 PM. I don't know if they were off their game but I had the Tom yum with seafood and it was just not up to par. Not to mention that I had to dig a HAIR out of my mouth and when I brought it to their attention they removed the food, argued about it in the back and I waited 30 min for a new one. 

The food was OKAY, nothing impressive. The soup tasted nothing like seafood. It was as is someone had dumped lemon to pass for broth and called it a day. 

When they brought me the check they didn't even apologize or give me a discount for me finding foreign objects in my food! 

The customer service was decent, hence the 2 stars, but for the food they get none. 

I recommend not coming here unless it's late and you are DESPERATELY craving Thai food.
author: Carolyn M.

description:
Wonderful restaurant =)

The atmosphere is good, service is friendly and quick, the food is authentic. Giving it a 5 star rating for having a clean bathroom as well!
author: Esther K.

description: This review is purely for the catering they occasionally do at our company. The usual fare consists of their papaya salad, several of their curries (yellow chicken, green pork, penang chicken), pad thai, and a few other dishes. While nothing has ever been terrible or inedible, not a single dish has ever particularly piqued my interest: certainly not enough to go all the way out to their actual restaurant, when my favorite Thai spot in the city is much, much closer to home.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Yikes, not sure what happened. 
Chabaa used to be the place I would go to for Thai frequently when I lived in the city. I returned here last week for a late dinner and was not satisfied.
I ordered the chicken pad kee mao and had to send the dish back (since i requested for mild and the chef made it obviously NOT mild). The 2nd dish that came out was not any better-sure it was not spicy but it tasted like pad sew eww with a sweet soy sauce flavor. I was disappointed that instead of trying to modify my original dish slightly, the chef just made me something completely else. The veggies in my dish also tasted uncooked.
I didn't find service here that friendly either- the staff was all new and just didn't seem as warm and the environment as inviting as before. 
I've been to the downtown Geary location recently and was much more satisfied with the taste and service. Wouldn't return to the Irving location again unfortunately.
author: Miss H K.

description:
Okay. I've been late night ordering from Chabaa since I moved to the sunset and they have never disappointed me. For real, their Pad am Kuer is the only things that fills my drunken belly on a cold San Francisco night. 

They are consistently good and one of the only good places on irving for GOOD late night delivery.
author: Laura M.

description:
I think I'm going to become a regular here.

I came here lastnight, feeling sick, and since I used to work at a Thai restaurant before in Florida, I know Thai people can make some badass noodle soup that can compete with Pho.
And I was quite tired of  eating Pho, so I looked through yelp, found Chabaa, saw a bunch of pictures of soup and good reviews, so I decided to try it.

I ordered the chicken noodle soup with the flat wide rice noodles.
When it first came out, I was a little skeptical because the broth was so clear, it looked like water.
But as soon as I stirred the soup around (to mix in the fried garlic that was in the middle of the bowl) and then tasted it, it was delicious.
If you're a garlic lover like me, you'll probably love this soup too. Plus cilantro and green onions are my fave so altogether I totally loved it.
They also brought me water and hot tea without asking or an extra charge.

AND they have space heaters around the restaurant to keep you warm :)
Friendly service, good food, good prices, plus it's a nice quiet restaurant (I don't like eating at really noisy places) with some faint thai music in the background.

I'm eating here again tonight :)
author: Hilarie L.

description:
Was craving thai and didn't quite want to venture to my usual place, so we decided to get food here.

The Food: We ordered two entrees and shared them family-style!
-Thai fried rice: I was surprised because usually I never order fried rice, but my friend insisted and it was actually really good.
-Pad Kee Mao: I ordered this extra spicy and it was "okay", the soy sauce taste was a little overpowering so that is one turn off. But with the help of the peanuts they bring on the side it was fixed!

The Service:
The service was really good, which was the only reason I am giving them 4 stars! They refilled my water every few minutes which was nice because I drink lots of water when eating by habit. They were quick with everything so overall it was a good experience.
author: Amy S.

description: I love thai food, and I've gone to a lot of great thai places and usually order the same thing: a vegetable green curry with brown rice. I am rarely disappointed with thai food, and this place is one of few that did not meet the bill. The good thing is that it is open fairly late, and service is quite fast. However, the flavors of the food are not what you would typically get from a thai restaurant. My green curry was purely spicy with no sweet flavor, and the vegetables weren't cooked thoroughly. They gave me a big plate of rather soggy brown rice. My friend's pad see ew was also very bland. If you're looking for a quick late-night meal, this place will suffice, but if you're looking for quality thai food, look elsewhere.
author: Leslie C.

description:
I tried seafood pad thai and it was the best pad thai I ever had, I used to come to King of Thai (no offense) and compared with them, this is the One that really.. really good. Good size portion. I came here 3 times already and will keep coming back again in the future. 
My husband tried fried rice with fried chicken. The chicken is sliced kinda thin but it was crispy, my husband expected that the chicken wasn't too thin. Oh well..but it was good, esp. The fried rice was tasty. Overall we love this place. Even my mother in law    loves their pad thai. And my favorite is also sticky rice mango, perfect combination,  sweet, lil bit salty and yummy mango. The service was good too. They open until late night. Perfect for us. The ambiance was good too. What a perfect night at that time (:
author: Marcella L.

description:
Great food and great service! If you like authentic Thai food this is the place! 
CRAB FRIED RICE is the bomb! And I'm allergic to crab...lol
author: Mark B.

description:
The decor was minimal along with the customers. My friend recommended it, so I decided to give it a try. I had the pad thai and it was mediocre at best. It was drowned in what tasted like sweet and sour sauce. The best part about the dish was the side of unlimited crushed peanuts you get along with it. 

I thought it was pretty unprofessional that the restaurant cooks were sitting in plain view of the customers cutting green beans and putting them into plastic garbage bags. It's unappetizing and makes the restaurant seem a little dirty.

Maybe in a desperate need for pad thai I will return, but until that actually happens, see you never.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Very good restaurant overall. Very quick and friendly service and nice lighting/ambiance for a restaurant that can be both casual and intimate.

The prawn pad thai was phenomenal, easily the best pad thai I've had; well seasoned and great balance between the sweet and savory aspects. The chicken panaeng curry was good, but not great, it lacked a little flavour, however it had the exact right amount of heat.

Sticky rice dessert was great and the mango was very fresh, so a very pleasant end to the meal.
author: Landon E.

description: The pad si yu was amazing. The flavor was perfect and the chicken was not too dry. I also love how they bring out the crushed peanut toppings and chilli powder on the side.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I decided to come here with my family for a late night craving for thai food. We heard this restaurant was really good so we gave it a try.

We ordered Pad thai, some noodle dish, Red curry and papaya salad. First came the papaya salad and it was delicious. We finished it in less than 10 seconds. Then the red curry and the noodle dish. Both was good. The red curry was really hot and spicy. The waitress then brought out a soup dish and asked us how many bowls we wanted. We old her we didn't order soup and the waitress gave us hella attitude. She said "this is pad tuk! I ASKED YOU IF YOU WANTED PAD TUK AND YOU SAID YES!" Not only did she not ask us but how are you going to snap at your customers for being wrong. It was a simple misunderstanding but the waitress glared at us the entire time we were at the restaurant. 

She finally brought out the pad thai and we were scared to eat it fearing she did something to it. We eventually ate it and it tasted good. 

Overall, the food is really good (4 stars), ambiance (4 stars) but terrible service (1 star). Granted another waitress working there was really nice and I think she noticed the tension between us and the other waitress and she basically took over. I would try this place again ONLY if that mean waitress had the day off.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Always get the eggrolls! Great place, always try to stop by when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Jack J.

description:
Great place, I feel at odds when it comes to choosing this place or Marnee Thai when it comes to Thai food. Their dishes do have an authentic taste and their appetizers are quite satisfying. I would recommend skipping the appetizers and going straight to the main dishes because it will be filling and their portions are rather large. 
Me and my friend ordered Thai teas here as well. It didn't have that authentic Thai herb taste I was looking for, but it was definitely satisfying and refreshing. 
The service is fantastic and you barely have to wait. 
The ambiance is very nice and comfortable. Not great for large groups but more groups 2-4 given the limited seating. 
Definitely recommend trying this place out!
author: Veronica L.

description:
There was a fly in my noodle soup, and the waitress tried to deny it.

Now, I've been here more than a few times, and I used to like it a lot. The food's pretty tasty and I liked that it was open til 1 am. I was debating whether or not to even tell them about the fly, since I didn't want to make a big deal out of it and there were other customers in there. After checking and re-checking that it was, in fact, an insect (I could see the little legs pretty clearly), I quietly called the waitress over to let her know.

Why did I even bother?

She picked up my bowl and starts stirring it like a mad woman. Was probably trying to hide the evidence and then asks me "Where?". After I point it out to her again, she says that it was the "top of a garlic" or something. Look, lady, I know what garlic looks like, and it sure as hell doesn't have little legs and wings.

No apology, no discount, no shame as she hands me the bill. Never coming back here again.
author: Ed M.

description: This place is not as good as I expected  despite the highly positive reviews. The food looked good, but chicken in the green curry was so dry that I hated the dish. The duck fried rice was good, but it had few pieces of duck and it was oily.. service was good and the place was a bit dark.
author: Mav M.

description:
I tried several dishes here (noodles, curry) and the duck fried rice was by far the best. Everything else deserves 2 or 3 stars. But the duck fried rice deserves 4.5.

Quite flavorful, just the right texture. I savored every grain!

Oh, and did I mention the duck fried rice is delicious?
author: Michael W.

description: Shady portions. Food is good if you have not eaten all day. Good news is that the guy at the register very nice. The owners wife or daughter has terrible customer service over the phone. I will not return or tell any of my friends. Treat people right and you may make up for the so so food.
author: Tony P.

description:
Been here twice and both times were wonderful. The first time I came here last year with couple of my SF friends who recommended it since we were on Irving Street for some Teaway and I was craving some curry. Came here again yesterday with my date for lunch since he wanted to walk around Irving Street and wanted to try this Thai place.

Recommendations:
- Yellow Curry
- Eggplant over rice dish (Forgot the name of it...)
- Crab Fried Rice
- Chicken Satay w/ Peanut Sauce (Sauce is amazingly creamy!)
*There's a few others but I had forgotten the name of the dishes...

Huge portions for a pretty decent price. Service was well, too. Though...when I came here with my date yesterday, I had no idea why one of the lady servers was in a rush to take away our plates. She kept walking by our table to see if we were done. There was only one other table filled aside from us since it wasn't quite "lunch time" yet and the place had just opened for the day. Just please let us chill and take our time!

Atmosphere was nice in this small restaurant. They were playing Korean songs like from Super Junior. Haha.

I'd come back here again if I'm (1) in SF, (2) and craving curry, and (3) here for Teaway. This place is better than most Thai places back home where I live, which makes me wish that I was a SF native instead.
author: Josephine C.

description:
They're accommodating. I really have to say that this restaurant dealt with a group of 10 rowdy young'uns when they didn't have to whatsoever. Arrived here with 9 other people for a belated surprise party for a friend. We had a couple arrive late, but it wasn't a big deal because our reservation for 10 at 7pm on a Saturday (!) was honored. The hostesses and waitresses ensured our cups were always filled with water, and they did pretty much anything we asked them to, including bringing out a cake and starting to sing happy birthday.

We ordered sooo many dishes - appetizer combo (not the best thing I've ever had because it was just an assorted platter of fried (not very well) amuse buches, tom ka with shrimp (which none of us liked too much because we're not Thai, but it tasted authentically sour and heavy on coconut), yellow curry (really, really creamy and not too spicy at all), cashew nut chicken and roast duck over chicken (I'm a vegetarian, but I have to say that the rice was really well seasoned and fried on the duck dish; it wasn't heavy on oil or salt at all), pad thai and an assortment of different dishes with fried flat noodles. This place tasted very legitimate, and they were  more than generous with their services. I would come back any time for just a bite. 

Oh, and everything at this restaurant is ridiculously cheap. We ordered 10 or 11 dishes for the 12 of us, and the bill with gratuity and tax came out to $120.
author: Danny C.

description:
I love Chabaa! I've been here a couple of times, and finally got to try this place out for a friend's birthday dinner. This place is pretty good!

I ordered the pad thai here, and it's one of the best pad thai's I've ever tasted here. I also tried the pineapple fried rice here, and I think it's better than the one at King of Thai, although King of Thai's portion is bigger than Chabaa's. The prices are decent and service is fast. 

This is one of the most authentic Thai restaurants around SF so try this place out!
author: Vivian L.

description: i have been here several times, great food, get the pork neck.  they can do large parties, and reasonably priced.
author: Hiki L.

description:
This place served me my first Thai meal. Green tea and water served with constant refills. Nice. Appetizer was tasty, chicken on skewers with peanut sauce.

I ordered the duck fried rice. Tasted great. They have a spice condiment tray which I used to sprinkle chili sauce and jalapeños. 

I tasted my friends pork shoulder. I want to try that next time even though mine was good. 

The bill was written in Thai which was hard to understand but we figured it out. Paid cash and she gave us too much change. My friends a regular there so he gave the extra 10 back to them. Good karma. 

This place satisfied our intense hunger after biking around the fog of the city. It was around 11:30 and they're open until 1. Good stuff.
author: Marty J.

description:
Great food, a secret Thai menu, very pleasant and attentive service, and the price is right.
The decor is minimalist, but that's not what I'm after.

If you want spicy Thai food, like Thailand spicy, lean on them a little. They soften up unless directed not to. But when specified, it was fantastic!

Nice, casual place with really good food.
author: Fnur S.

description: I got pad si-yu for takeout and everything was perfect. My noodles were delicious and they were ready almost instantly.
author: Seth F.

description:
This is a pretty decent thai place. The prices are average. We tried this place many times and usually end up pretty satisfied. 

I am allergic to pineapple and peanuts so that limits what I can get. But the last time I was here, someone recommend me to try the fried chicken rice. I usually wouldn't get something like that, but ordered anyways. It ended up being pretty good. Just a tad dry. I also love the fact that whenever you order thai iced tea, the straw will be topped with an origami rose. I thought that was cute.
author: emily y.

description:
Very speedy delivery!! And at a good temperature too! It's almost like they take your order, send it to the kitchen, put it in to-go containers, and deliver it to you in some hot-bag. I love the quick service, even when you dine in. Large portions for a good deal. Service is very attentive. Interior of restaurant is really nice. Rough, wooden chairs and tables. Dim lighting at night though. Lovely table decor, usually flowers.

My opinions on the dishes I've tried: 
Egg Rolls - Generous filling with a crispy, flaky outer shell. Delicious, especially with the dipping sauce, I was a little disappointed with only 3 small pieces for $5.25.

Appetizer Combo - Great if you want a variety. You get about 2-4 pieces of each (tofu, prawns in a blanket, egg rolls, fish cakes), which is perfect to split among a small group.

Som Tum (Papaya Salad) - Very tangy and a little spicy, interesting combination of flavors.

Pad Thai - Honestly, it didn't blow me away as it has at other Thai restaurants. I found it quite bland.

Pad Kee Mao - VERY VERY VERY SPICY! They're heavy handed with the Thai chili. I ask them to not make it milder, but still, it's sooo spicy. Order this dish with caution!

Crab Meat Fried Rice - Good, but very simple with only a few ingredients: crab meat, onion, and egg. I recommend sharing this because it gets boring quickly.

Pineapple Fried Rice - Yummm... One of my favorites here! Only four pieces of shrimp is a little stingy though. Very interesting how they put fruit in it, such as pineapples and raisins.

Vegetable Fried Rice - Has a good variety of vegetables. I appreciate how they're concerned with customers' restrictions, for example, (if you're a vegetarian) they'll ask you if egg or fish sauce if alright. 

I've also tried some of their entrees and curries over rice. Overall, they're really good. Curries are can be a tad runny at times, but definitely have some heat. AND of course, what's a meal at a Thai restaurant without Thai Iced Tea?! Yummy! (But ask for light ice, because they fill the glass to the top with ice.)
author: Priscilla W.

description:
We came here on a Sunday night around 5PM, so we had beat the dinner crowds. When we got here, there were only two other groups so we were seated quickly.

The waitresses were nice and always came by to give us more water.

I shared a soup and a rice plate:
-Tom Yum Soup with Chicken: I got this because I wanted soup and spicy. The spiciness was okay. Wasn't too spicy but still had a little kick to it. The chicken were at the bottom and there were a lot of mushrooms (I think) floating on the top. It was just okay. It didn't really fill me up but then again, I shared the soup with someone else. Next time I would probably get a noodle soup.

-Duck Fried Rice: After seeing a lot of reviews about this on Yelp, I knew I had to try it. And it didn't disappoint! The duck was pretty tasty. I split this with someone else with the soup but I wish I just got a plate of this to myself! This is totally worth getting. 

You can split the bill with credit cards but there's still a $15 minimum per card. Our meals ended up being $10 each and I had cash. My two roommates ended up splitting the bill between themselves and I just gave them $5 cash each.

Overall, this is a nice Thai place with tasty duck dishes. 

Pros:
-Great Duck Fried Rice!
-Friendly service

Cons:
-Some soups don't fill you up enough
-$15 minimum per credit card
author: Paul U.

description:
Torn between a three and four star rating. The meat-based dishes we had-- pork shoulder with string beans and asparagus, plus eggplant with pork --were really good.
