The pork shoulder in particular was juicy with the perfect amount of fat. However, the noodle-based dishes (pad kee mow and pad thai) were really underwhelming. Both way too sweet for my tastes, the pad thai especially; the pad kee mow was better, but still not impressive.

I'd go back, but probably wouldn't get noodle dishes again.
author: David C.

description: Great food; quick service. Both my son and I enjoyed.  It looks like they aren't paying yelp so yelp doesn't promote them. My good review was added as a "tip" bc it is short. Now it is long and no excuse. Reviews should be added irrespective of whether they pay.
author: T. S.

description:
Had this place bookmarked since April. My to-try was the mango with sticky rice dessert. IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT. 

Was here with a friend for lunch. Walked in, maybe 8-10 tables; relatively small place. I assume it gets packed during peak hours. I ordered a green curry while my friend ordered the yellow curry. Whenever I go to Thai restaurants, my to-go dishes tend to be a curry (Pumpkin curry for the win! They didn't have pumpkin curry.), pad thai, or something with eggplant in it. So, green curry it was. $7.95, which includes rice during lunch hours until 3pm. Relatively large meal. I couldn't finish. Curry wasn't disappointing but the rice was. Not the best rice I've had at a restaurant. Who rates the rice?!! Clearly, I do.

Saved my stomach for mango with sticky rice ($4.50), and as mentioned above, it was yum! Sticky rice was sweet, warm, with sesame scattered atop. Not mushy. Mango has always been a great addition. 

Good meal.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Whoa- what happened to this place?! Chabaa use to be a reliable, delicious, neighborhood thai restaurant but my last few visits have been terribly disappointing! I use to order dine-in and take-out from this restaurant at least twice a month, and then I had a temporary leave of absence for a school-friendlier budget of not eating out (as much) but as much as I hate to say it,  the past three visits have landed chabaa with only two stars in my book.

one star- bc it's LESS msg than marnee thai down the street
two star- some of the friendly staff ( .... there was this one girl who I've never seen before tonight that was just too pushy despite the lack of customers around..... she tried to collect my plate while my fork was still in my hand?!)

What I ordered:

pad thai with shrimp attempt #1- TOO salty. I think i had to wave down my waiter at least 10x to refill my water and gulp down all that sodium

pad thai with chicken attempt #2 (on a DIFFERENT visit)- waaaaaaaaay too salty! i had to task my waiter to bring me a bowl of rice so I could make it less salty. He simply glanced at me and said ok, brought out a bowl of white rice, and charged me for it. I guess I was just trying to be polite to not ask for a new plate but really, you're gonna charge me for a bowl of rice so I could drown out the sodium and not even offer to take it back? i guess it's my fault for not learning my lesson in attempt #1

fried chicken over fried rice- still delicious but the quantity has definitely been down-sized.

tom yun soup- I use to LOVE the tom yun soup here but last night was a total disappointment. MOSTLY clear broth with 8 mushrooms and even fewer pieces of chicken. Where's my lemongrass and onion? OR FLAVOR? :( overall, I feel like my tom-yun craving was not satisfied at all. 

brown rice- $2/bowl which is average

I wonder if the quality and quantity of food has decreased since they exploded around the city.... oh well... looks like I wont be returning anytime soon.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Amidst the freezing cold San Francisco winter evening--a bowl of soup here is heavenly.

Now, I'm a pho guy (being Vietnamese and all), but Chabaa comes close for yummy, belly-warming soups. My go-to is the Spicy Beef Stew with flat noodles. The broth is delicious, and the meats are tender.

I've had other dishes here, and they're all pretty solid, too.

Service here is generally good and friendly.
author: Thuan N.

description:
I am kind of sick of Pad Thai, but my bf always orders it and I always just have a bite. But their Pad Thai is DELISH! Very flavorful and the noodles were cooked well. I would just say that it is a bit salty after a few bites.

I had this pink noodle soup. It was good at first but way too salty when the noodles just soaked up all the soup after a while. 

service is nice. Will be back. :D
author: Erica L.

description:
On my first night in San Francisco I was on the hunt for something quick and thai. Chabaa seemed to be busy so we stopped in. Quick service and the food is served in the blink of an eye. We started by splitting the Tom Yum soup. The bowl was huge and provided tons for us to split!

I had the pad thai with tofu. The serving size was HUGE. Definitely enough to split or take home for lunch the next day. My bf had the lamb special. Unfortunately there was more potatoes than lamb. Not quite what he was expecting.

This wasn't the best thai food I've had, but it worked for the night. I would give it a try again if I was a permanent in the area.
author: Erin C.

description: I've ordered from here a couple times while living out in the sunset area for delivery only and I have to say I just wan't too impressed. I tend to judge a place by how they make thier Pad Thai and the one here is rather on the bland side. I still prefer Marnee Thai but Chabaa isn't the worst place to eat either and they do delivery.
author: Petra S.

description:
I came here with a bunch of friends after Bay 2 Breakers to grab lunch. I was a little hungry, but not starving. I ordered #19 (I forgot what it was called) and it was perfect! You have the option between various proteins, but I ordered the chicken (I think it was chicken breast) sauteed with green beans in a chili sauce and rice. It had just the right amount of heat (I like spicy things) so that I didn't have to add anything to it. The sauce was also good, so even though I like to avoid or minimize the amount of carbs I eat, I just had to use some of the rice to soak up the sauce. Also, I like that they offer you the choice between white and brown rice.

Service-wise, it took them awhile to get all of our dishes out. There were seven of us, but my food was luke warm by the time the final dish came out and mine wasn't even the first to arrive at the table!

Anyways, since my dish was seasoned so perfectly, I was quite satisfied. Will I return? Possibly, if I'm in the area!
author: Leana L.

description:
Came at 12AM last night with my starving friend who had just finished up in the emergency room at General Hospital. We couldn't find any open places to satisfy her hunger except for this one! Thank goodness there was at least this place on Irving. 

Food came quickly and service was nice. I ordered Corn Cakes in the appetizer section and it was yummy! Plus, I love corn. There's a side of sauce to dip the cakes in which makes it even better. I'll have to try the other dishes next time. 4 stars for corn cakes :)
author: Reanna T.

description:
The service here is absolutely wonderful.  I love going into restaurants and having friendly staff greet you, happy to bring you whatever you ask and refill your water without you asking! That's exactly what Chabaa servers do!!

Now on to the food: I always get pad thai or pad see ew
1. Pad thai:  noodles + eggs+ meat + tofu.,..it was just okay tasting because i know different places makes it slightly different.  This pad thai is less sweet than at other places. Also I like raisins on my pad thai!!
2.  Pad see ew: I liked this better but hated the beef because it was dry and hard.  Wished there were more veggies on it.

Plus side is the portions are filling so you won't leave hungry!

Random: It's almost halloween and i love how they decorate the place.  Yay for the holidays!!
author: Roxana L.

description:
No-frills Thai that's better for takeout than dine-in. It's a long, rectangular space with regulars who are either in one obnoxious group or lots of small, really quiet ones. I like the high ceilings.

What kicks this place up above average is its consistency. Servers are almost always prompt and have a robotic pleasantness to them. The dishes are always good but not great, and I've never had something I did not enjoy. I recommend the Thai ice tea, papaya salad, egg plant stir fry, and any of the soups.

Pretty cheap and there's never a wait for a table.
author: David S.

description: A great surprise! Outstanding food, price and taste and rarely as much of a line as other places down the street. A definate try. the wait staff was friendly and seemed to enjoy talking about all the options for those of you with a more adventureous nature
author: Frank S.

description:
LOVE that they are open late!

Walking into Chabaa - I was surprised by how nice and clean the interior was, lots of seating: tables against the wall and benches on the right wall. The high ceilings and pretty lanterns made the place very serene and non-clastrophobic; you can have a nice conversation with your table and have no need to yell.

Service was great, our good came out quickly. They have two menus: their main menu which has tons of choices from appetizers, vegetarian, noodles, soups, desserts; and they have a "Thai Special" menu with entrees you can't even pronounce. 

We ordered the appetizer platter to try a little of everything: egg rolls, fried tofu, etc. It was a bit disappointing for the price- mostly cheap ingredients: tofu and fish cake to fill up the plate, wish they had some chicken skewers included!! 

Also ordered the pineapple fried rice, which was delicious! Very generous portions and they did not skimp on the large juicy prawns. The pineapples were juicy and provided the right amount of sweetness, which the fried rice was not mushy nor clumpy- fluffy flavorful fried rice! 

While I'm sure Marnee Thai down the street tends to steal the attention, Chabaa should not be underestimated, give it a try!
author: Eva H.

description:
Let me tell you how I was stuck with cold thai food one thursday night.

So... the other day I'm craving thai food. Where can I order a pick up? I thought of my usual thai spots, hmm, but parking is impossible in those areas! Grr.

I thought, maybe its easier to find parking here compared to my other places. 

I was about to pick up my phone and call for the a pick-up order. But I look up on yelp that they have a website. I look through there and it says I can order online! Hmm, sure! There was a part that said 0% tip, 10%tip, etc. I didn't want my food to be spit on or something, so I put 10% tip. 

I put in my order, and I included that I wanted it to be ready by 6pm (I get off of work at 5:15, but driving all the way there, and finding parking, 6pm was best). I placed this order around 3:30pm. At 4:15ish, I get a call from them. 

"Your order is now ready" 
- "Um... I put there I wanted it at 6"
"Oh, I didn't see that when we made your order..."
- "I can't get there till 6, can you guys please put it somewhere where it can stay warm?"
"...okay"

Hang up.

I mean, I put 10% tip for a reason, so shit like this won't happen.

When I get to the restaurant, there is my order, sitting there waiting for me. 

- "So it's been here for two hours..."
"Mmhmm"
- "Man, I bet its cold"
"Mmhmm, sign here please"
*shows credit card and signs*

I'm just PISSED OFF that there was no, "I'm very sorry!" or maybe even a discount or free drink to make up for it. When I got home, it was semi warm, and all the noodles STICKED to each other like a huge noodle monster. Nasty. The beef was good, but thats it.

Sorry chabaa, I won't be coming back for a while.
author: Sophia G.

description: This thai restaurant is good but not the best one. We have been there several times and every time we were disappointed by something new: either it is the small portion of duck meat in comparison to the amount of rice, or the flavorless Pad Thai there is always something going on. On the bright side, some food are good, such as chicken satay and Papaya salad. We will still keep on going there because it is a decent place, but it will not be our first choice.
author: Ashish N.

description: Good food but very very unfriendly staff. They even laughed and gossiped about their guests. Wouldnt go back there.
author: Paul C.

description: Tried their noodle soup and fried rice. Both were too oily for me. As I live nearby, I might wanna come back later to try their curry and other entrees. Might adjust rating.
author: Shia L.

description:
So I'm walking down Irving with a friend and I notice that I'm not feeling so great (thank you to either the heat, low blood sugar, or the headache I had) so when we passed this restaurant, we decided to make a beeline for it and give up the search (or trek, whatever).

The service is super nice and the menu is lengthy -- but when we finally made our decisions, it was definitely worth it. We split an appetizer of the corn cakes (which are massive and quite a lot) and they were so good. I'm not sure what I expected but the hefty amount of corn in there was awesome. I had the pumpkin red curry with veggies and tofu which was delicious. I seriously kept trying to eat more when I was full because the curry itself was so tasty. 

Overall, good experience! I'll definitely be back.
author: Shauna S.

description: Spiciness is low so feel free to order up. Fried rice, curry, and papaya salad was alright. The beef larb was super disappointing, nothing like Ive had before. For some reason it was really dry, no lime, or flavor. We asked the chef to help us add something so it wouldn't be as plain but it could not be helped.
author: Jaclyn N.

description: My go-to for pad thai and roast duck noodle soup! Absolutely the best noodle dishes and superb service. Also love that they are open late and do delivery as well.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
I'm boderline between 3 and 4 stars.. 3.5 if I can but I'll just tip them to 4 stars because it's a mom and pop and their rice is cute haha.

Duck Fried Rice: 
I remember loving my bf's duck fried rice dish. You can tell they drizzled some duck oil over the rice to really give it flavor.  It was delicious until you eat more.. then it just gets really salty and oily. It was delicious.. then it wasn't, I don't know how to rate it -____-. Maybe eat in small quantities next time?

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VpwhOU-zfA_0xv8E1SpvNw?select=QpgpaS2od88iyRD9g0PGFw


Curry (I forget which kind):
I think this curry was something my mom can and would make, which is why I didn't like it. I like to go to restaurants and eat things that I've never tried or cannot make myself (or in my case, what my mother cannot make). Nonetheless, the curry was quite creamy and was seasoned correctly.. just.. too close to home x(. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VpwhOU-zfA_0xv8E1SpvNw?select=6jn2XDGxSjdu8xIDdqQH-g

I think the total ended up being 22 - 25ish.

Note: Rice is a dollar a bowl for dinner. THE END.
author: Theresa N.

description:
Tried the pad si ew and the pad si ew in gravy sauce. The only difference was the egg in the pad si ew and the gravy sauce on the other one. Im a fan of the flat rice noodle and both were pretty good but I had better elsewhere.

Place is small, ok service.
author: Linda L.

description:
Maybe eating there instead of having take out is better? 

This is one of my favorite Thai places. I usually always finish my meals. But today I ordered take out. It wasn't as good and my friend kept saying the place 1-2 blocks down tasted better. Maybe this is the reason my taste buds turned on me today. 

I ordered the chicken fried rice and the pad si-yu (#31). The chicken was a tad bit dry, but I didn't mind too much. The food tasted decent, but not great. Actually, come to think about it, I think I would rather eat the Chinese version of this.

I need to come back again without a critic who talks about some place else being better throughout my meal. Boo.
author: Jess W.

description:
I subscribe to the old train of thought that you if you don't have something nice to say, don't say anything at all.  And, up until now my limited Yelp reviews have only been positive.   But, I think the Yelp system is broken and I must take a stand, man!

How Chabaa received four stars is beyond me.  Yelp, for me, is becoming useless and an enabler of poor food choices!  (Can I Yelp, Yelp??)

My husband and I ventured out from our normal Thai delivery because they only accept cash and last night we had no bills!  So, I yelped a few placed that delivered and had good reviews.  After reviewing a few, Chabaa had what we wanted (panang) and the best prices.  Sidebar:  Not sure what the complaints below are about the prices--they are cheap!  Anywhoot!  We placed our order of Tom Ka, Panang Curry with Pork, Egg Rolls and a side of Coconut Rice.  Bonus point:  you can order online.  The food arrived pretty quickly and was hot.

However.

The panang curry was BLAND.  I have had curries that are too hot or too oily...but NO flavor?  It was not bad tasting...it was NO tasting.  The pork in the curry did have flavor and was a good texture, but overall very disappointing. 

The Tom Ka was also lacking in the flavor department and was also super oily.  The mushrooms in the soup were oddly spongy and borderline inedible.  There were two sliced tomato pieces sadly bobbing in the broth like lost buoys, but no other veggies were found.   I feel like Tom Ka is a pretty common Thai staple and to get that wrong...is blasphemy!  

Positives:  The coconut rice & egg rolls were very tasty.  The side dishes definitely out-flavored the main dishes.  Chabaa is like the Will & Grace of Thai Restaurants...you know...because Jack & Karen are really the best part of the show?   Anyone?  Anyone?

In summary:  If mediocrity is your bag...this is the place for you.  But if you demand more from your Thai food, go elsewhere.  In a city FILLED with so many amazing Thai choices DO NOT. I repeat DO NOT waste your money at Chabaa.  Even if it is fun to say...."Chaaaabaaaaa"

Thank you.
author: Sarah F.

description: My girlfriend has celiac disease, which means we need our food *very* gluten-free. We've ordered delivery here many times, and they've never made her sick. I love the duck fried rice (it is greasy, which I prefer, but it's duck, you can't really avoid grease when duck is involved anyway).  She loves the pad pra ram. Everybody likes the pad Thai.
author: Robin P.

description: Decided to come here right after a appointment waiting around from a previous restaurant because of the long wait of waiting list. The food here is similar to king of noodle thai restaurant or like many thai restaurant that contain soup noodle, pan fried noodle, fried rice, salad, curry, and soon. I order beef combination noodle soup while my mom and brother order duck noodle soup.  I thought the food was very average. Nothing special. But it was a cold night, the soup was good for that particular weather.
author: Julie N.

description:
There hasnt been a time where I've gone here and have had a bad experience. The service is always on point and the food is awesome. The flavors in their dishes always hit the spot for me, and they're usually open pretty late. They're pretty on point when I let them know to not have any peanuts on my food since I'm allergic. 

I would recommend the po tak (sweet and sour seafood soup) and the chicken skewers! I always order these when I come in.
author: Julie T.

description: Chabaa is one of those neighborhood dive joint I just love! The place is worn in, the staff is friendly-enough, the food is really good, very reasonably priced, and there are a few unexpected surprises. The pleasant surprises were green papaya salad (large portion), rarely do I find good fish cakes, and excellent sticky rice with mango. This place is tiny and seats about 24 people. It is open until 1:00 AM every night and is a great spot for a second dinner/snack after late-night and long walk around the city.
author: Mark M.

description:
This place was pretty decent. It didn't blow me away or anything. I guess I don't have a strict tongue for Thai food, because unless it's something extremely mind blowing, then it all tastes the same to me. 

It's very clean though and the service is very friendly. From the outside you wouldn't think that it's nice inside, but trust me, it's a lot cleaner than other restaurants you would find in the city. 

My girlfriend had the Pad Thai, and I had the beef noodle soup, which I must say was really good. The Pad Thai was only okay in my opinion. However, for the price you pay, it's a decent bargain. 

Overall, I would recommend coming here.
author: Andy V.

description:
Only 3 egg rolls, only 2 stars.

I may be spoiled in my Thai food - but $8 for 3 egg rolls - c'mon.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
Pumpkin curry, duck larb, Mango sticky rice are all solid.

Avoid beef Basil fried rice
author: Ellen H.

description:
Turned up to an empty restaurant at 3.30 with 2 hungry kids - lovely menu including a secret menu that I will defo be back for.

Anyway long short - quick fire ordering of classic starters - fish cakes egg rolls and Tom yum - all delicious soup had great poke.

Chicken and duck fried rice was brilliant and red curry v comforting.

All loved it - kids happy 

Staff were beatiful
author: Max A.

description:
Just finished eating here

I'm four staring this place, only because the gentleman that waited on us was SUCH a SWEETHEART... People here are SO nice... a million times better than the king of thai on tarval... this place is open til 1 am ... 

Okay, I really would like to give the food a three... Our first dish (noodle j) was amazing... this tarty soup with shrimp, fish meat balls, fishcake. this spongey fungus that is my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE .. its found in many chinese dishes, ... and you get to pick your choice of noodles food... its just really good... like reeeaaaallly good... then ... because of all the reviews on yelp...I got the duck fried rice... man ... it was yucky... and 180 degrees from the direction I was hoping for. Everyone raved about it on yelp, AND I did see that people have noted 'whats happened to this place?!?!' maybe a little warning to how it used to be... but the picture in the menu had duck sitting on a bed of rice... when we got our dish... it was maybe one small piece of duck that was chopped up into a million pieces and stirred into the rice... you couldnt find a piece if your life depended on it... yes, that bad. but the other dish was SO good ... and the service and ambiance was great.. so ... you get four stars... 

definitely go trip this place if you like thai food, just make sure you order the right things. no duck fried rice! (ps... I really hope this review doesn't add to the 'duck fried rice' was mentioned in "this many" reviews... lol I should've used an acronym ... dfr :P
author: Mish L.

description: Chabaa Thai is great, because the food is delicious, they're open late, they deliver great customer service, the takeout is super fast and they deliver. The Thai Iced Tea, Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, Yellow Curry, brown rice are my favorites. When I was there to sit down and eat, the waitress even showed me and my mom how to make paper flowers out of the straw papers!
author: Gina R.

description:
What happened to this place!? This used to be my go to Thai spot in the sunset.   The food USED to be good, the service USED to be fantastic, and the experience USED to be awesome.  But my recent experience at Chabaa has been horrid, disappointing, but definitely eye opening.

Food:
Let me start by saying that their portion size has decreased significantly since I was here last (i.e., 3 mos. ago).  We had the salmon pumpkin curry, shrimp pra ga tiem, and duck pad see ew, and.  The curry was definitely over seasoned and the salmon was fishy, I don't think its fresh.  The shrimp pra ga tiem (garlic black bean sauce with shrimp) was very salty and it comprise of five shrimp that I have no reason to doubt its not the frozen variety.  Last but not least, the duck pad see ew.  The dish was very oily and salty, the duck was very chewy, and the entire plate dish itself seems extremely black.  As far as I can tell, they're either reusing old cooking oil and/or too much sauce. Neither would surprise me.  At any rate, we took a few bites and found the pad see ew to be inedible and told the waiter to send it back to the kitchen for the above reasons.  After everyone is almost done with their food, we had to check with them again to see if they're bringing the pad see ew back. To which they asked if we still want it.  We said nah because everyone is already done.

And so the eye opening dining experience begins.

Service:
The wait staff was good, but I cannot say the same about the management.  When we got our bill, we saw the pad see ew still on our bill.  We kindly asked if it was a mistake.  We were quickly confronted by what seems to be either the daughter and/or wife of the owner.  I was immediately told that 
1) She tasted the dish and found nothing wrong with it.  (wtf?)
2) Additionally, they do not refund dishes in which all the ducks were eaten and if a sizable portion of the dish has been eaten. (I suppose eating one out of the three pieces duck they gave us exceeded their "refund" threshold.  And I guess accusing your customers are trying to screw you out of $10s is a valid reason)
3) I should have instructed the waiter to bring it back. (I'd assume its common sense for the waiter to confirm a credit and/or a new dish, guess I've been eating at places that are doing it wrong?)

After a short 4 minutes of scenic exchange, I was promptly "checked" and I quote "you better check your attitude" by what seems to be a friend and/or employee of the restaurant, neither would surprise me.  

To conclude, I have no intentions of returning to this chain in the foreseeable future because the food quality, quantity, and overall service has fallen significantly and definitely do not justify the price they're asking.  Wait staff is attentive but could use training.  Management/old lady running the show will need to re-evaluate her approach to customer service and the service industry in general.  

The only question is, are you really going to threaten your already slightly unsatisfied customer to take it outside over a $10 duck pad see ew?

I tipped 20% because the wait staff was attentive.
author: Sai Kiu H.

description:
Yummo. Came here around 10pm in search of late night food. BF used the Yelp app on his iPhone and poof! Chabaa! The restaurant was lit and nicely decorated. Good to keep you awake if you are eating here late at night. 

We ordered the larb and the pad sew ew w/ tofu. Both were excellent. Moderately priced and tasty food. Will come again!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Im quite picky with my thai food, especially having a thai girlfriend whose father cooks the most amazing home cooked thai food! So, after a nice cocktail before dinner on a cold misty evening in the Sunset, we were deciding between pho, tacos or thai. I'm SO happy we chose Chabaa! We checked out the pictures and reviews on Yelp and decided to go for it. Our experience was awesome! The customer service was excellent, the servers were all very attentive. They do these beautifully twisted straw wraps that are a special touch. I've never seen anything like it. One of the servers was sweet to show us exactly how it's done. It's definitely time taken to make the small things count. A plus in my book.  

We ordered the chicken red curry with brown rice & beef pad si ew, both extra spicy and DELISH!!! 

We'll definitely be back and can't wait to explore the menu. Also, I noticed on their website that they have a "secret thai menu" that has some inviting dishes to try out.
author: Christina A.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3.5 Stars
Average: 3.5 Stars

+ Good Green Curry
+ Open Late

- Small portions 

[M] The food here is pretty good! I've been here several times before and left satisfied every time. My little sister recommended me this place for the Green Curry since she knows it's my absolute favorite. She couldn't be more right! The green curry is super creamy here and has tons of coconut flavor (my fave on the menu!)

Wayne and I shared the Green Curry, Spicy Angel Wings, and something that could have been the Guay Tiew Nua Sub. We forgot the name of it...

The Spicy Angel Wings came in tiny portions. For the price of $7.75 for 5/6 wings, that was totally not worth paying for. Marnee Thai makes much better tasting ones imo...

The dish that Wayne ordered had Ground beef served on top of stir fried rice noodles and also topped with a fried egg. The beef looked a bit on the dry side but it wasn't. Everything was hot and steamy! Very good!

Overall, I would come back again. I liked the Green Curry very much. Just wish everything came in bigger portions.
author: Mona C.

description:
This place rules!!  I have spent about 5 months in South East Asia and when I eat here it makes me feel like I am back.

They offer all the typical dishes but do them really well and put all the extra effort into making it special.

The pad thai is awesome.  Papaya salad is amazing with the little dried shrimpies but be careful if you ask for it "spicy" because it was exactly like it is in Thailand...  If you request it spicy they will give it to you like the locals eat it and it will burn your mouth off...   Kind of a great feeling though.

The iced coffee is a steal and they make pretty art out of your straw paper and is freaking adorable.

I didn't care for the seafood combo in the curry we got as I didn't feel like it was the best seafood but it didn't stop me from eating a lot of the curry and rice...  I would just keep it veggie or maybe try the chicken.

Anyway, I highly recommend this joint...
author: William G.

description: I would give this place a 3.5 stars if Yelp made it possible. One of the best perks about this place is that it's open until late (1 a.m.) and the variety of dishes! I've gotten the rad nah, which is my go-to favorite chow fun noodles with the gravy sauce, and I recently tried the roast duck noodle soup, which is so comforting. Their service is friendly, efficient, and they always refill our waters when it's running low (I know it isn't that hard, but it's well appreciated).
author: Tina F.

description: This place was completely incompetent. They messed up our order and delivered the wrong thing and then waited over an hour to bring us the correct order. And then charged us for it. And the soup is greasy. Fuckin sucks. Go elsewhere.
author: Katie S.

description:
too expensive and too small of portion size.
OK. I know this description applies to many restaurants. But here is the deal: the size is like sushi dish yet the materials are bean sprouts, tofu and noodle. 
These are cheap food materials. In fact, doubling the portion size or cut 50% of current price will be a good choice.
After I finished my meal there I went to the sushi place next block for a nice plate of sashimi. At lease that's money well spent.
To be fair,the taste is good. But again, not worth it.
author: andy s.

description: I've recently become obsessed with Pad Thai and have been trying it at a lot of places. This had a weird sour taste that I didn't like. It wasn't terrible but there are so many places in the area with better food.
author: Amy G.

description:
Yellow curry dish + grilled salmon dish = happy fat boy!!! 

Check out the secret menu.
author: David W.

description:
I've been getting Chabaa for three years now - both here in the Sunset and in Union Square. It's definitely my go-to take out or quick dine-in dinner spot. 

Eat in: Yes, they deliver, but when you're ordering noodles like pad thai or pad si yu, you need to eat in - otherwise the sauce will likely be all absorbed and the noodles a little dry by the time you get them. Completely forget fried foods for delivery - soggy. Not their fault, it's delivery.

That said, these time-sensitive noodle dishes are delicious fresh out of the kitchen, piping hot, flavorful, and exactly-what-you-want-right-now. Add some crispy appetizer, and a thai iced tea with a little wrapper sculpture on top of the straw, and you've got a casual "this is how we Wednesday night" date spot.

Take out: Now's the time for thai curries! My favorite is always Panang curry, my boyfriend's is yellow curry chicken. Couple orders of rice and you're good to go. New favorite: Pad ma kuer also travels well.

They only deliver to certain areas of the city, and depending on who answers the phone, sometimes they come to the Inner Richmond for free, for $3, or flat out will not. It's worth the gamble, and it's easy enough to scooter across the park myself if I strike out.

Vegan Note** They do say they can make some dishes vegan by excluding fish and oyster sauce. Did this once, and I don't recommend it unless you NEED to, or have a magical flavor sauce you plan on adding yourself. Turns out fish and oyster sauce is pretty important for the nostalgic Thai flavor I'm craving. But it is an option, and may work with some dishes better than others.

Thanks Chabaa!
author: Stephanie R.

description: This place is good for late night delivery. I get the fried chicken over fried rice. The food comes within an hour. Either this place or king of Thai is where I call for late night food. Portion sizes are perfect and the price isn't too much. Free delivery for orders more than $15 I believe. Love it
author: Rob T.

description:
I've been coming to this place for years and feel it's one of the most underrated Thai restaurants in the city.  Everything here is superb, such as the Pad Se Ew and Beef Noodle Soup, to name a few.

If there was one thing I could fix it would be their chicken wings.  The dish is amazing, but I feel like they could buy better quality wings.
author: B J.

description:
My go to place late at night when nothing else is open. Their service is fast.  Price is decent. Good customer service and clean. 

Pad Thai
Chicken Fried Rice
Yellow Curry

-1 star because when you ask them to add an ingredient, they don't give you that much and charge you extra, not worth it. 

Other than that, love this place (:
author: Quyen T.

description: I like this place because of the friendly service, good food, relaxed atmosphere, price and portions. My favorite entrees are roast duck fried rice and country style roast pork!
author: Kay D.

description: Do not eat here. Ever. Service is terrible, food is worse than terrible. I'd rather eat the almonds from the bottom of my purse next time I'm hungry & near the Outer Sunset. This is the first bad review I've ever written.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Bad experience?

I've been on the hunt for great tom kha soup since I've returned from San Diego and this place definitely did not take the win. It was quite bland to be honest. Tom kha that I order at other places are always popping with flavor, but the tom kha here pales in comparison! Guess I have to look else where. 

Next up, green curry with chicken. I have never had such a small cup of green curry before! Seriously, the amount of rice they gave us was much more than the amount of green curry in that little bowl. In addition to the small portion, the green curry was BLAHH as well. All I could taste was spicy coconut milk....

Lastly, pad thai! Thank goodness there was one good dish to save this place. It was really good and tasted like it should have! 

However, service was great! Never had an empty glass of water and the food came out promptly.
author: Maggie C.

description: Props for delivery, and staying open late.  Sometimes I have had 4 star meals here and other times just a more avg 3 star experience.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I can NOT tell you any more simple than I LOVE THIS PLACE! 

1. They are open late! 
2. They serve amazing food! Try the Spicy Catfish or Chicken Pad Gra Pow (w/ fried egg) Hoi Jor is a great appetizer! 
3. Their house hot tea is SOOO yummy! I don't know what the add to (as they won't tell me) but it's GREAT! 
4. They are SUPER accommodating to big parties and even decorate w/ ballons! :)
5. The staff is VERY nice, unlike their rude competition down the way. 
6. Reasonably priced. 
7. It's pretty on the inside! Bright, fresh flowers, and funky cool serving ware! 

I LOVE this place!
author: Andrea A.

description: Really cheap late-night food and the service (only the male server; everyone else looks at me like this :/ ) is always attentive and super nice. My gf and I usually get the pad Thai, coconut shrimp soup with mushrooms, and duck noodle soup. No complaints here! Oh, and don't forget the Thai tea ice cream.
author: James M.

description: I took the Mormon missionaries here for dinner, one from Tonga had never had Thai food. Our meal did not disappoint. They loved it and so did I. The food preparation was fast and the service was great. I'm glad because my husband and I keep eating at bad Thai restaurants, so this was a welcomed surprise.
author: Lauren N.

description:
Had another fantastic dinner here with 8 of my besties, we had 13 dishes total! They were able to accommodate a couple in our party by making some super delicious vegan dishes. Again, ask for the not-so "secret" Thai menu and get a good feeling for what regional Thai food is like. 

Service was quick and efficient, our beverages never went empty or unchecked. 

GO, NOW! 

It's guaranteed aroy mak mak!
author: R. C.

description:
It was a Saturday night and we had just come out of a movie. The time was around 10:30. Most restaurants were closed, so we were unsure of what to do. We drove onto Irving, contemplating whether to get a drink or perhaps side of popcorn chicken at Tea Way. However, we noticed Chabaa was open and had to give it a try!

Bunny and I were happy that we found something that was open at that hour. We parked and head over. As we entered, a server greeted us and asked us to take a seat anywhere. She was friendly and polite. There was a good variety of food. As we looked through the menu, we decided on the Yellow Curry Chicken, Omelet with Minced Pork and Pad Kee Mao.

The Yellow Curry Chicken arrived first, which came with a bowl of steamed rice. The curry flavor wasn't extremely spicy,but it was a bit mild. There was also onions and potatoes (my favorite). It was a good portion and we enjoyed it. Next that came out was the omelet. The size was larger than expected and we were unable to finish. However, it had a lot of flavor and I liked it. Last was the stir fried flat rice noodles that came with green beans, bell peppers, Thai chili and sweet basil. Our choise of meat was beef. The noodles were very tasty.


The next time it is after dinner hours, and I am in the area, I will keep this place in mind.
author: Doris W.

description: Nice, clean, good variety, and the pad thai is really good. By that I mean flavor, of course, but harder to come by, the texture was just right and not soggy.
author: Kris F.

description: Best Thai food in town with the customer service to match!  Great value and they cater too.
author: Aaron N.

description:
Good food, reasonable and good service.
Tea was yummy, too.
author: Yoko S.

description: The food is above average here, but everything you can get here you can get at almost any other Thai Place. I really wish they would step it up a bit. Chabaa has a friendly staff with good intentions, but they just don't stand out. The interior of the restaurant is beyond boring. It makes me feel dirty and uncomfortable being inside. I just never want to go and that's a big reason why. There's nothing fun or truly special about this place. I think if they add some fresh new dishes that can separate themselves from other places and just redo their entire image they could be a force to be reckoned with. Until then well... 2 starz.
author: Dexter H.

description:
How the hell do u order curry and it doesnt come with rice?  I don't know if you can ever eat curry without rice, but to charge $9-13 for a bowl of curry without rice (rice additional is about $2-3? I think) well anyways dont think the curry is worth it.  But the curry does taste good and bold, so its good if you pair and mix it w/ some veggies or fried rice.

Pad Thai was delicious and so was the pineapple fried. And the price for those were reasonable.  Decent place, but small.  Will give this place another try.
author: Willis L.

description: Hands down the best Thai food in sunset. Maybe even SF. It's not too traditional (although there is a secret menu), and it's not too modern. The staff is friendly. I used to go here few times a week when I lived in Irving. Now I go less, but it's basically the only place I go to for Thai. Their pad kee Mao is my go to dish.
author: Cëma M.

description:
When I want Thai style noodle soups, this is where I come, because what other Thai restaurant has an actual page on their menu dedicated to noodle soups? I think some dishes are a bit overpriced, like six pieces of chicken wings for $8, but overall, the food here is solid.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Pretty good place for Thai food in SF and conveniently located near a lot of other shops, etc. on Irving. Their food selection is pretty standard, nothing out of the ordinary. If you go to their online menu they have a "secret thai menu." Not so sure how secret it is if you post it online but some of the items there are pretty tasty. I like to stick with my standard green curry, panang curry, or pad si-yu. Slightly overpriced but it is consistent, good food and I come back every so often. Their thai ice tea also comes with cool little origami flowers/things on the straw wrapping, very cute touch! Good atmosphere and attentive service.
author: Sannie L.

description: There's few things a thai restaurant should mess up on and that's pad thai and chicken basil rice. The flavors were just off putting. I remembered this restaurant used to serve pretty good food. Wonder what had happened over the years.
author: Peachie Y.

description:
Great food, nice people, moderate prices.  Quick too!  

Huge fan of the Pad Pra Ram, albeit not the healthiest thing on the menu.  Their grilled tofu is a little chewey but as far as I've been told that's tradition!
author: Courtney D.

description: So after practice, we were all hungry (we practice at Sunset Rec), and we decided on Chabaa after 15 minutes of debate. We were a party of nine and I've never had Thai food before so I chose something safe. The chicken noodle soup was pretty good. My friend's fried chicken over fried rice was delicious. My other friend got chicken pad suey (sp?) and it was delicious. Wonderful experience. Although, splitting the bill up was a bit hectic since they didn't separate it, and three of us (including me) had only 20s.
author: Millissa T.

description: U guys have ruined my night......we ordered 35 and K.....the crispy noodle smelled hella disgusting like the oil have been used for a year and havent changed and sat on a poddle of gravy.....wtf gravy not broth alrite make it straight dude.......doesnt have to give that much gravy otherwise just call it Crispy Noodle soup then. Move on to my K aka roasted duck noodle soup but instead of  stupid noodle i want WONTON n the stupid waiter fucking get no glue. He got my roasted duck soup w/ 3 Wonton wtf  r u serious???? I dun fucking care how much u gnna charge me more but c'on dude only 3 I aint baby stupid asshole n moreover the roasted duck fucking old......cant sell it.....dun serve it.
author: Allision W.

description: A decent restaurant with decent food. Everything was the right amount of spicy for me. Pad thai was flavorful, tom yum was decent (props for the fresh tasting shrimps), the roti with curry was pretty good, good mango & sticky rice. Would come back to try the variety of dishes, would recommend.
author: Jenny N.

description:
BAD. I've been to Thailand and I LOVE Thai food more than most others and this place is no bueno.
The Tom Kha was OK - but too creamy for sure.
We didn't feel like rice tonight so we ordered Pad Thai and Pad See Ew - both were lumpy, one was super greasy - the other very dry and all around gross.
I'm feeling ill as I type this.
author: Lindsey G.

description: Came here a while ago. I love their secret thai menu. Some special dishes that you don't usually find in other Thai restaurant. Will come back again!
author: Eleanor C.

description: Fried chicken over fried rice all day everyday!! I've tried other dishes in the past but always come back to what I know will hit the spot every time.
author: Marvin R.

description: I went to Chabba before, and I was always happy with their food, but last time I went, I was not satisfied at all! After my husband and I sat down, the waitress did not even offer us some water, she did not even sit us down! I just thought that was so rude, All these other places on Irving everyone always gets good satisfaction. I finally requested water, and when I was going to drink it there was lipstick stains on the cup, how gross is that! I always like to eat so I requested some more meat with my food, so I requested for some extra meat but it looked like there was not even extra meat, and I got charged more. I am not satisfied with this place at all. That service, dirty dishes, and being charged for food that was not even put on my plate. It is up to you to go back to this place! As for me, I will not be going there anytime soon!
author: Poison I.

description:
C an't miss the lime green awning as you stroll along Irving
H ead inside and you'll be treated with some tasty Thai dishes
A  lot to rave about this place:
B oat loads of menu items to fulfill every Thai cuisine craving
A sk for the secret Thai menu to explore, if you're bored with the usual
A nd the friendly, attentive service make dining here a fine experience

T he Duck Fried Rice is wonderful -- lots of great flavor
H ard to pronounce its Thai name, but #36 is awesome
A n egg topping Ground Beef Noodles -- the taste is very nice
I 'd skip the Salted Cod Fried Rice off of the Thai menu -- a bit too salty
author: Anthony N.

description:
Just had dinner here and unfortunately it didn't work out well. Been here before but my last visit was horrible. I ordered the crab fried rice and asked if I can have a side of green curry. They gave me a small cup of just the curry sauce and charged me $3 bucks for it! Way expensive for a cup of sauce. Then my friend ordered the tom yum soup and there was a misunderstanding. They thought she wanted only the soup, but my friend wanted the noodle soup. We were still polite since it was a misunderstanding but it went DOWNHILL from there. The two servers completely ignored us. IT TOOK TEN MINUTES TO GET OUR CHECK even though there were only a handful of tables occupied and it was not busy. We knew the servers choose to ignore us and just look at us when we ask for things and definitely made us wait. Of course, when americans came in they were all cheers and high-toned hello.

Guess what. I'm a server and I know your game. Your service shouldn't be dependent on whether you think your customer's gonna tip you or not. Just coz we're the only non white in the restaurant doesn't mean we don't tip as much, or more, than they do.

For a small misunderstanding you ladies took it to the extreme. Never coming back.
author: Andre J.

description:
Cheapish Thai food in the Sunset district.
Plenty of restaurants to choose from in this locale.

It's very simple inside - pretty much 2 walls an entrance and the back door.

Food......good.

I had the sliced boar (basically streaky pork) - pad ped moo pa - which was saucy and tasty. Wolfed that down no problems.

Wife had the duck noodle soup and she loved it too. Nice pieces of duck with hor fun as she likes it.

Friends had the basil chicken and curry and those were also dispatched.
Nice, simple, tasty and quick. Can't ask for more than that.
author: Nick L.

description:
I think last week was my 3rd or 4th time coming here. That day was the busiest I've ever seen it, 4 groups of people. I normally see only one other group. I never come for dinner, it may be more crowded then.

I ordered K, which is the Roast Duck Noodle Soup with Rice Stick Noodles, I don't think I've ever ordered anything else. BF had...#38 roast duck fried rice. His fried rice looked a lot smaller than I imagined, but he didn't finish it so it was a good amount. My noodles were so good, I think I even finished the broth. The broth reminded me of Kome Sushi Buffet's herbal soup. I felt like throwing up after, because I was too full.
author: Kylie L.

description: On the positive side, the service was good.  The appetizer combo was also good.  We ordered basil chicken mild and red curry beef extra spicy.  The basil chicken came out extra spicy so we had it returned to make it mild.  When it returned,  it was mild but the flavor wasnt there.  I have had basil chicken tons of times and this one sucked.  The chicken pieces were tough and the flavor was not good. The red curry beef was edible but very lacking in taste.  Very bland.  Probably wont b back.
author: Bram S.

description: Pad si-yu and yellow curry with chicken were good, but pretty standard. Generous portions. Walked in to order take-out, shortly after they had our food bagged and ready to go.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Pretty solid late night Thai out on this side of the city. The menu is pretty big and the service is fairly quick. You can tell this place is full of nocturnal SFSU students and young people, escaping the cold midnight fog of the Outer Sunset.

The soups are HUGE and come out piping hot. I had one with roast duck and thin rice noodles accompanied with veggies. It was great and very filling. We also had crispy spring rolls that were hot and delicious and they came out very quickly.

Also, a dessert favorite, Tuttimelon, is right across the street, so Chabaa is a top Thai choice for me.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
I got some take-out from here last night and holy crap!

The chicken pad si-yu was good, but i've had better. The beef larb salad could have used more lime dressing. The roasted duck noodle soup though? I would slaughter a million ducks for more of that. My friend and i thoroughly enjoyed the broth rich with duck fat--pretty much the essence of flavor, period--and everything about the soup was good. Egg noodles, baby bok choy, and rich pieces of roast duck swam in it.

AAAAAAAAA+++++++++ WILL DO BUSINESS AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Phuong M.

description: Ordered online for pickup at 7:15. I got there a few minutes after 7:15 in hopes that I wouldn't have to wait, since I was meeting friends at 7:30. When I got there, the hostess looked totally bewildered, like she wasn't expecting a pickup. Go figure, they hadn't even started cooking my food. I watched them put my order together in the kitchen for 25 minutes, without any apology or explanation. Although the food was good, it didn't make up for the fact that I was left waiting for nearly half an hour.
author: Kelsey H.

description:
This place is great.  Their Tom-Yum is perfect.  My wife and I come here at least once a month, usually late at night (open till 1) and always have a great time.  It's always super mellow.

Try the Thai Tea ice cream -- sooo good.
author: Jon M.

description:
Came to lunch with Julie F. and finally decided to try something different.  Its a cold, rainy day, so of course I wanted some noodle soup.  I opted for the Yen Ta Fo Noodle Soup this time( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/ekplyIlbZoKssV-OkThpwg/l ).  Its noodles with shrimp, calamari, sliced fish cake, fish balls, white mushrooms and spinach in chicken broth with red bean sauce.  Its a dish that I grew up with as a kid, and I was very pleased that it tastes just like it does back home.  

Julie F. got her usual....Combination Beef Noodle Soup( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/DeLfKRr-6ARytHCzN99cXw/l ).  And we even got some egg rolls( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/hoAFtGj8ObuDshSHV2lAPw/l ).  They give you 3, but we were a bit hungry, so 1 disappeared before I could snap the pic.

The service is very quick, so we were able to get out of there before the 1 hour ran out on our meter.  =)
author: Patra I.

description: This is an awesome restaurant.  Very authentic! Service was good!!!! Cheap prices :)))) everything was well done! It an was amazing!!
author: Xenia D.

description:
Walked by and had a craving for Thai - Marnee was crowded for lunch.

This place is okay and friendly.  They have attentive, fast, and nice staff.

Their tom kha was creamy, sour, and savory.  the chicken didn't take in much flavor - could probably be better if it were shrimp.

Was happy that they were able to accommodate my request to add egg noodles to my soup.

I also had their corn fritters that were portioned much better than other places...it was light, not too dough-y, and came with a wonderful cucumber relish/sauce.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
Pretty good, but nothing special.

Came here looking for lunch specials, which they lacked. They had "lunch" portions...which was curry that came with a serving of rice, but no soup or small appetizer. Had the spicy basil wings, green chicken curry, and pad see ew with beef. All were decent and would come back again, but it was really just average. Food wasn't that salty, which is a good thing! But lacking in some kind of "wow" or flavor...IDK. This place is really crowded during dinner.
author: Stine H.

description:
Delivery. Yellow curry was a little bland and runny, and came with more curry sauce than chick and potatoes. Also ordered Tom Ka but got Tom Yum.

I'm going to try noodles next time.
author: Ang F.

description:
Chabaa was highly recommended by family and friends... I guess it's a decent place for thai food in the sunset district, but I've had better. Every time I come I swear the portions get smaller and smaller. If you have a group of 6 or more, be prepared to wait, because the restaurant is tiny.

First time I came here, I ate dinner with my boyfriend. we were seated right next to the door. The waitresses actually forgot about us, until we had to flag them down for water, napkins, silverware, and the bill.

SIDE NOTE: if you sit near the door (on the side the door opens) a gust of wind WILL blow in, and your food will be cold before you finish half the dish. 

The last time I came here was with family. The waitress recommended us to get the Al La Carte portions making us believe that the dishes would be bigger because we won't have the rice with the meal, but boy were we wrong. She basically had us pay for everything on the lunch portions individually.

SIDE NOTE: if you order anything, choose the chicken! the beef is so tough, my mouth was sore for chewing. 

I do NOT recommend Chabaa because the food isn't memorable....
author: Jessica T.

description: This place is super cheap and the food is always amazing! The portions are quite generous too. I always split my food before I start eating and then I take the rest home for leftovers. I am so glad this place is so close to my home!
author: Diego L.

description:
We wanted to like it - we really did.  We read the rave reviews and we were excited for some quality Thai.

It was not good quality Thai though.  Despite ordering medium spiciness, we received the most bland Pad Thai Chicken we've ever had.  It was inedible.  No flavor, musty bean sprouts, and missing all of the accoutrements advertised for the other Pad Thai on the menu - for swapping shrimp for chicken, you lose all of the extras.

Heartbreaking.

Pad Woonsen with chicken was okay, but really just okay.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
By far, my favorite Thai place in the Sunset.

I usually order delivery and have enjoyed everything I tried on the menu. The coconut rice and red curry is amazing, I wish I could make something that tasty. The Pad Thai is also delicious and my favorite noodle dish. The Chicken Satay was tasty with just the right amount of peanut sauce. 

Also, if you order delivery, they are incredibly fast. I don't think I've ever waited more than 30 minutes, which for deliver is amazing.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Food wise, this is a 3 star place but because they are open until 1 AM and the staff was awesome I rounded up some.

Me and my guy came here late one night, starving, desperate for food since my flight into SFO was late and everything was closed.  We found this place and ran in, ready to eat anything.  It was almost 1 but they let us in anyways.  They seated us but we decided it was best to take it to go as it was late and we were tired.  While we waited for our food the server brought us some tea to keep us warm.

The food itself was ok.  My guy got pad thai, which was just mediocre.  He didn't eat much of it.  However, my pad see ew was pretty good, in fact the boy kept eating mine instead of his, LOL!

There are def better Thai joints in the Sunset (inner and outer) but it's not bad and if you need a place open past 10 or 11, this is def the best place to go!
author: Jen K.

description: YUM YUM! Best Thai in SF. I love this place. I have been to Thailand and this is by far the closet to being in Bangkok!
author: E L.

description:
Worst Thai food ever! I stopped in for a quick take out order for my wife and I, we were both starving and wanted Thai. I ordered the Red Curry with Duck and the wife wanted the Garlic and Basil Beef. My curry was spicy, but lacked any kind of flavor and the duck may well have been rubber for all the flavor it had. My wife's dish was simply appalling, the meat had simply been boiled and had no flavor at all. How do you cook something with garlic and basil and have it taste like nothing? If I could give a place 0 stars, this would be the place that got it. For 8 bucks a dish, I expect the food to be at the very least "okay", this place wasn't even close.

Never again.
author: Michael S.

description:
Very friendly waiters. 
Ordered pad kee mao, hoi-jor, and basil fried rice. 
Food is quite spicy and tasty.
Relatively cheaper compared to other thai places
I will be back!

Food 9/10
Service 10/10
Atmosphere 9/10
author: James T.

description:
YUM! I love this place. One of my go to places when I'm in the mood for Thai. While Marnee Thai may be the better known Thai establishment on Irving, Chabaa takes the cake for me! 

Regardless of who I come here with, we seem to always end up splitting the same three dishes. Namely, the corn cakes, pad thai, and chicken yellow curry w/brown rice. MmmMmm!

Corn cakes - Corn fried in batter and shaped into imperfect little circles. Served with a sweet and spicy chili dipping sauce and pickled cucumbers. It's delicious! 

Pad Thai - It's  pad thai! Don't know what else I can say except that Chabaa sure cooks up a tasty one! I always like to add extra peanuts to mine. Yummy :)

Chicken yellow curry - Creamy, yellow curry with chicken & potatoes. The coconut milk makes everything taste so buttery and rich. Love it! Rice is included at lunch time; however, during dinner hours it is a $1 extra. So, I usually try to only order this during lunch hours. 

Other dishes I like here are the pad see ew (it's not eww...promise!) and the pad pra ram. Pad see ew is a lot like chow fun, but it's just a little sweeter in my opinion. Gotta try this one! The pad pra ram is meat and veggies covered in a delicious peanut sauce. I love all things peanut, so no surprise that I'm a fan of this. 

As for service, it has always been fast and friendly. Restaurant is nicely decorated too. And this place opens pretty late!  Later than all the other places on Irving. A plus for a night owl like me.

Chabba, we will surely be meeting again. 5 stars!
author: Natasha H.

description: We use to come here all the time. Unfortunately the good has gone down hill. We order a few noodle dishes n when it came out one barely had noodles. Just a huge glob of sauce. The other dish was a disappoint as well. Shrimp tasted really old and kinda rotten.  I use to love this place :(
author: Jangalina J.

description:
Oh damn, I wish I knew earlier they were open late. My last stop here for some take out involved some Pad Kee Mao Tse Tung. No? I guess he wasn't Thai was he. Maybe  aka Drunken Noodles! I shall be back.
Kuhn Krap.
author: Ken L.

description: My fiancé and I love this place. The staff is so nice, they pay attention to you. The food is so delicious and worth trying. Whenever we feel like just dropping by for a to-go, we are still treated nicely.
author: Mary Grace C.

description: Great for a quick late night meal. Standard Thai restaurant - very busy even at 10pm! Ambiance is better than a hole in the wall and servers are nice. Random note, 1 serving of jasmine rice is huge! Definitely large enough for 2 people to eat with a curry dish.
author: Lisa H.

description: I had the vegetarian yellow curry, fried phyllo dough stuffed w/ pumpkin seasoning and singha.   My wife enjoyed the curry dish so much, she dumped hers and began sharing with me.  It's located righ across from the Curran Theatre and the ACT Theater so the location is great for a before play or after play meal.
author: Seqan D.

description:
I live within a few blocks, and this is my favourite Thai place. 

I like this place because the food is great, they are always nice and fast and if I want to eat in, I really like the ambiance much better than Marnee. PLUS THEY DELIVER! YAY!

Also, on several occasions, Marnee staff have been unfriendly and even flat out rude to me, and they don't deliver or give drink holders when I'm getting take out... so for me... it's a no brainer... Chaaba wins my business!

edited to add: you have to try the Yum Woonsen noodle salad! it is amaaaaaaaaazing!!! possibly one of my favourite thai dishes ever. also... low carbers & seafood lovers... the Po Tak soup! It's a delcious lemongrassy, gingery basil soup, with no noodles, just seafood. It's amazing. I love this place. I am so glad it is just a few blocks away :)
author: Zvezdana O.

description:
Chabaa, Thai for Hibiscus, is a lovely new restaurant that opened in the Outer Sunset on Valentine's Day and is already making waves with the locals. We went on a rainy Sunday night and the place began to fill up fast by seven o'clock. 

Some might say, Who needs another Thai restaurant in San Francisco? But one visit to Chabaa will have you rethinking that sentiment. In a neighborhood know for its cuisine but certainly not for its atmosphere or attention to detail in design, Chabaa stands out prominently. Look for the restaurant's cheerful lime-colored sign- it's hard to miss.

Inside, the walls are painted in sumptuous, warm colors. Everything from the plates to the wall decorations has thought put into it. The stellar branding job at Chabaa is evident throughout- from the sign to the menus and all points in between. This is uncommon, and I think it works for this restaurant. 

You will likely be greeted by friendly manager and partner Pawaree Sriprasom, for whom this restaurant is clearly a labor of love. She'll guide you toward a cold Thai beer to start your meal off right.

But make no mistake about it, for all its prettiness, the charm of Chabaa most certainly lies with the food. Start with the delicious corn cakes. Dish the sweet and spicy cucumber salad atop the cakes for maximum enjoyment. The tom ka is an excellent balance between the lime and coconut milk flavors that make this soup  a Thai staple. If its on special, the pumpkin curry made with kabocha squash is definitely worth ordering. 

And what's more, Chabaa is open until one in the morning!
author: Miriam W.

description: There weren't that many people there when we got there so we get to choose where we wanted to sit.  We ordered shrimp pad thai and green chicken curry.  The pad thai was really good.  The green chicken curry was alright, need a bit more favor but it was still good.  The best part was the dessert.  The waitress recommended pancake with condense milk top with coconut ice cream!  it was soooo good!!  Must have!
author: Len L.

description: Awesome delivery Thai, everything was excellent and they took 35 minutes for an order for 6 people. Mango Sticky Rice and spicy garlic chicken were delicious
author: Charlie R.

description:
CHABAA THAI CUISINE
Came her for a friend's birthday party, and it was amazing that we actually took over more than half of the restaurant. We had about 25+ people for the dinner group; we ordered ahead of time, and the food arrived in record time. The duck curry was quite good, although nothing spectacular. The curry was sweet and mildly spicy, and the duck was a refreshing change amid the regular chicken, pork, or beef toppings. The pad thai, on the other hand, was simply spectacular! It was so tasty, I was screaming for more!!! Staff was friendly and very accommodating. The prices are fairly cheap for Thai restaurants, and this makes it a winner for large groups. Give Chabaa a try!
author: Stanley C.

description:
If I had to choose a default restaurant in the Sunset, it would be this place... or Park Chow's, duh.

I usually just get a rice place with an egg on top,  and pigs in a blanket to start. Fried rice is excellent, although, I haven't come across an Asian restaurant that has failed their fried rice. Their food isn't oily, and always sits well with me after. The restaurant itself feels very well kept, and is welcoming. The waitresses and hosts are always nice, and they make little roses out of your straw wrappers! Ain't that neat. :)
author: Jennifer A.

description: Great that they are open late, quick service, decent thai food at a good price. A solid choice, just not amazing...
author: Misha Z.

description: The food is solid and reliable. Not the fanciest in terms of Thai food, but that's not what it's trying to be either. They make some great dishes that are consistently delicious and very reasonably priced. I'd highly recommend their pad kee ma or their beef noodle soup. My roommate always goes for their fried chicken over duck fried rice (special request). Nom.
author: Devin K.

description:
I don't understand why they don't hand out the Thai secret menu out to everyone. It's got the more interesting dishes and it has the english translation, so people shouldn't have a problem with it. 

There's a certain serenity to this restaurant. Maybe it's the high ceilings, the warm color of the walls, the red lighting near the windows, or the pretty hanging lamps, but the interior of the restaurant comes together to create a nice ambiance. The service was also exceptional. Genuinely friendly and efficient, they're good at what they do. 

The food is better than most other Thai places we've been to in the city. With the added allure of the Thai menu, we chose to bypass the standard pad thai and curries to try some different things.

First up: papaya salad, spicy wings. The papaya salad was very refreshing with its julienned papaya strips mixed with fresh vegetables and tossed in a slightly acidic/slightly sweet fish sauce-accented dressing. Very good, but might have preferred a slightly more flavorful dressing, and  on the menu it says it's prepared with crab, but I didn't really see any crab it it. The spicy wings were covered in a delicious sauce and were very juicy yet crispy on the outside. I really liked them with the fried basil leaves. 

Entrees: Pineapple fried rice, BBQ beef. Pineapple fried rice was good, and surprisingly not oily like most other fried rice dishes you get at other Thai/Chinese restaurants. Big chunks of pineapple, succulent shrimp, cashews, a hint of curry. I sometimes like a little more curry flavor, but I was ok with this one. BBQ beef was off the Thai menu. Can't remember what it's called, but it's basically bbq beef strips with a spicy tamarind sauce. It was delicious. The beef was so tender but well grilled. Simple, but something that really hit the spot. The spicy tamarind sauce was a good accompaniment, but I thought the menu said it came with rice, but it came with something like a salad with some iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Kind of strange since there's really nothing to eat it with. Still, the beef was really good. 

Dessert: I don't often get dessert at asian restaurants, but when I see sticky rice and mango, it's hard to resist. We got it and i love the sticky rice, but the mango wasn't that good. Not really ripe enough. But love that sticky rice with coconut milk. 

Overall a great choice for Thai food in this area of the outer Sunset. I also saw larb on the menu, which I've only had at more authentic Thai restaurants. I will definitely be back to try some of the other Isaan dishes that are supposed to be their specialty.
author: Saunders C.

description:
Stopped in a for a quick bite on the way to SFO to pick up my folks. It's a classic "avenues" Asian restaurant with minimal decor, good service and really good food.

The menu is diverse with lots of choice and two us filled up for less than $20.

Can't argue with that.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I was rather disappointed with my meal from Chabaa Thai, especially after noting it had high reviews on yelp. 

I ordered the Yellow Curry with chicken & tofu & veggies. The curry flavour itself was good; creamy texture with just the right amount of coconut milk. The chicken was tender but there were barely any pieces. It's hard to go wrong with cubes of tofu. However that's were the good stuff stopped. The veggies were nearly raw.. eww eating crunchy green beans and half cooked potatoes were definitely a no-go. I will probably not order curry from here again. 

However they did nicely accommodate my bf's order of Pad Si-Yu w/seafood (which was not on their online menu). We ordered for pick up so didn't get the in-door eating experience but I found their restaurant to be a little chilly. 

Oh they also have brown rice which is a plus. Unfortunately getting half cooked curry was really the deal-breaker for me. Sorry!
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
I love the place.. since I always coming here and they want I want.

but still I'm looking for something different.
Any specialties by a chance?
author: Calvin Nicholei L.

description: My friends and I have been coming to this place for some time. Its cheap and open late into the night. Always a plus for us! Pad Thai, Pad Kee Mao, and the chicken wings with basil and garlic are great. But we recently ordered to-go and it was just HORRIBLE! The noodles were dry and the wings had no sauce. We were seriously disappointed to say the least that our go to spot has fallen from grace. Hopefully the in service is still the same. Update to come at that time- but trust me do not order delivery.
author: Michelle I.

description:
Great quality Thai restaurant. The taste is a little bit Americanize but still in a good tasty range (I'm Thai).
There is a separate Thai menu that are given to Thai people. the dish on there is very good. 
Great service and good atmosphere.
author: Scott B.

description:
This place is sooo much better than King of Thai.

That's all I have to say.
author: Susy C.

description:
Lizzy's review reminded me that I had not reviewed this place myself.

Open until 11PM daily, and later on weekends, the food is consistently good, and they have some interesting menu items.

It's not as good as Marnee Thai which is just a few doors over, but Marnee closes a lot earlier than this place.  Service is friendly and prompt.

If you're jonesing for some late night Thai and you're in the area, it's a pretty good choice, and the food seems lighter than the other ubiquitous late-night Thai staple, King of Thai.
author: dan s.

description: Tried the Roast Duck Fried Rice the other day and it was really good. I ordered to-go so I can't comment on the service, but the interior of the restaurant looked pretty nice. I'll definitely be back to try their other Roast Duck dishes.
author: J. D.

description:
Tried this place the other night for its late hours and four-star average review. Truthfully, it was not very good, and I was unimpressed with everything that we ordered, except for maybe the thai iced tea. What really irked me was that instead of using beef slices in the pad kee mao, the restaurant uses ground beef, which brings down the taste and quality several notches.

Look, the food here's not terrible, just mediocre and very forgettable. Two stars for the food, with an extra star for staying open so late.
author: Suany W.

description:
Superb food, excellent service. A great surprise on New Year's Eve.
I went to the location by Union Square. Apparently there's one on Irving as well.

My family and I were in SF to ring in the new year. We were looking for a place to have dinner that didn't have a multi-hour waiting list (hard to find on New Years). When I first saw this place on Yelp (4 stars, one $) I thought it was a mistake. I called and found out that they only had a 15-30 minute wait, so I told my group of 8 that we were going to walk over and have Thai tonight. 

This place is small and a little out of the way, but there were people standing outside which is a good sign. I put my name on the list and we stood outside. The hostess seemed a bit grumpy and I was worried, but I worried for nothing. It only took 10 minutes and they were able to set up a table for us. The entire time we were there, there was a line and people waiting outside. 

We are a family of foodies and without exception, everyone loved the food here. Each dish was very well done and brought to the table very fast. We couldn't believe the tiny kitchen (up front by the window where you can see the cooks) were turning out the dishes so fast! We ordered a lot and also had 2 desserts!

1. Thai iced tea - as good as expected and a nice touch was the flower they made out of the paper wrapping for the straw. 
2. Papaya salad - very fresh ingredients and excellent dressing. 
3. Calamari salad - calamari was cooked and seasoned perfectly.
4. Tom Yum Soup - great broth with rich flavor. One of the best I've had.
5. Roast duck appetizer - wife said it was one of the best she's had and she's SUPER critical and a gourmet chef.
6. Green curry - Lots of ingredients (Chicken, bamboo, green and red peppers and onions. Just the right mix of sweet and spicy. It's great on top of white rice.
7. Pad Thai - the old standby, done extremely well with lots of sprouts.
8. Crab fried rice  - OMG! Never had this before and everyone wanted more!
9. Beef flat noodles - Had a great smokey flavor to it. Never had it done this way before but it was really tasty. We wanted to lick the plate.
10. Fried bananas with Pineapple ice cream - once again, we devoured it. The ice cream had chunks of pineapple in it and was not too sweet.
11. Sweet crispy pancake with pineapple ice cream - this didn't last 2 minutes after it arrived. Everyone took a bit and we almost ordered more!

All during the meal, we had 3 people wait on us. All were super pleasant and very helpful when we asked questions or needed more napkins or water, etc.

After all this food, we walked out of there with a bill of only $116 including the gratuity! This is dinner for eight (8) people!  It was a really good value. I'd come back here in a second. We had lunch by the wharf earlier that afternoon and spent almost $170. Getting a meal like this for 8 people near Union Square for this price was amazing.

OK, if you can't tell we really liked this place. It's small and cozy, family run with excellent food at a value that can't be beat. I recommend this place highly. Thanks to all the other Yelpers out there.
author: Song H.

description: I had roast duck over rice. Unfortunately the duck was not freshly cooked, and was therefore not very appetizing. I have had the duck several times at the Geary location and found it to be very good.
author: S T.

description: The Pad Thai and Papaya Salad is my favorite here. It taste pretty good. Parking here is street parking and is usually good at nights.
author: Kevin H.

description: This small hole in the wall place provides good quality Thai food, i'm always ordering pad kee mao or pad see ew, and over here it's amazing. Staff is friendly and portion sizes are appropriate to the cost.
author: Phill E.

description:
A recommended 18% gratuity for six people or more.

We came in with 7 people, darnnit all. but we didn't pay 18%, muahaha.

Anyways, my group and I had sweet tooths this afternoon, and we all ordered fried banana and ice cream (green tea ice cream and thai ice tea ice cream, though it also came in coconut) Someone else ordered mango sticky rice.

There was just a little too much honey on the fried banana, which was super fresh and crisp, and that extra sugar overwhelmed my taste buds! I couldn't savor my green tea ice cream at ALL, which, just by the way, tasted tacky. Overall OH-kay for $4.75

The mango sticky rice was pretty good (stole bites from a friend), but the portion was, in my opinion, teeny tiny for the price.

They have this strange "add .50 cents to everything on the menu" thing.

On another note, the servers are pretty nice! Friendly and helpful, though they seem to take their sweet time. The ambiance of this place is pretty nice too; cool lighting.

Dessert place? NOT really.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I was reading Yelp reviews and was recommended to eat the "DUCK FRIED RICE".

It's super good and tasty (must be the duck fat!) at around $8-9/dish. 

You can ask for 1/2 portion of the Tom Yum soup too.

Papaya salad I would skip. The carrots were notably dry/wrinkled and I didn't like the tiny shrimp in the salad.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
+++++++ - location and hours. It's right by the hotel we stayed at for a conference and it was so nice to find a reasonably priced meal at the end of a long day.

Unfortunately, I got the pad thai and it was only so-so. My partner in crime got some yellow curry, though, and it was the bomb. Jealous!
author: Grace L.

description:
I don't have anything bad to say about this place. I came here about 12:15am and me and my cuzn n sister were the only ones there. I was hesitant at first to go in because I know alot of restuaurants hate it when customers come in last minute but fuck.. I was HUNGRY. And plus everything else was pretty much closed less I drove all the way to civic center/tenderloin area but EFF that, no parking plus alot of crazy people, happy ending ladies, and crack heads. (no offense)

The waiters were really nice and pleasant. The girl was cute too. I ordered a thai tea, shrimp pad thai, and crispy chicken over fried rice. My little big sis ordered pad see ewe while my cuzn got the yellow tofu curry. I've had alot of thai food around my area but I've got to say Chabaa wins hands down. The flavors were not overpowering or bland. It was just right and they give a generous amount of food. We all shared and STILL had leftovers. I really wish there was a Chabaa around my area. I hate driving all the way to the city to get authentic food but aye, Ill do it if I have to.
author: Fran N.

description:
Happy information:  they take reservations! 

Also, parking is pretty easy. 

Our party of four enjoyed every dish that we ordered. We got the appetizer sampler (4 pieces each of fish cakes, eggrolls, and fried tofu. 2 pieces of fried shrimp), young papaya salad, morning glory (ong choy), basil chicken, and my favorite - penaeng curry.
