I thought the appetizer sampler could have been stronger, but it's a nice thing to start with. The veggie dishes were both good and it was nice to have both a raw veggie dish and a cooked one. The basil chicken was delicious and I loved the eggplant in the dish, but I couldn't focus too much on it because the curry was so darn good! I love the heavily infused coconut flavor with the curry spices. YUM.

Wish I did more research about the secret menu before coming here!
author: Lydia W.

description: This place is opened til 1am. You can't beat that and the food is good too!
author: Anni Y.

description:
I took my family here after reading such great reviews on yelp and about the secret menu on sfweekly. (How can I not be attracted to a secret menu?!?!) The service was pretty awesome and i liked how the waitress was kind enough to explain the "thai" menu. 

Ordered:
(-) the tom ka soup: it was overly SOUR! what the heck!?! completely killed the coconut flavor! it was NOT a good way to start off the meal.
(-) the pork neck: it sounded pretty good from sfweekly but dont be fooled. its the "pig cheek" that you can buy as bbq pork from chinese "siew lap" stores...except grilled and that dipping sauce was hella SOUR as well!!!
(-) the isaan sausage:  it lacked flavor and was pretty ordinary for its price (close to 9 bucks for 2 tiny 2 inch sausages.) 
(-/+) green curry with beef: I was neutral about this dish. it tasted just alright. im not a fan of green curry but my brother seemed to like it.
(-/+) beef fried rice: neutral
(+) chicken pad thai: this was surprisingly above average. it was moist and thank god not too sour. 
(+) roti dessert: it was pretty good. sweet and a lil chewy.

it may seem like we ordered a lot of food for 4 people, but the serving sizes were pretty small. the total including tip came out to be $65.
author: Stacy L.

description:
Seriously, this is as good as it gets!!

The atmosphere is warm and trendy, the servers are fast and friendly, but most importantly, the food here is fantastic - dependably :)

I recommend the yellow curry chicken (boring anywhere else, deliciously full of onion, cinnamon, and spice here) and the salmon red curry (I like to add pineapple, personally) and the panaeng beef curry.  As you can see, I'm a curry girl.

My bf has ordered several delicious dishes, none of which were curry, and so together we have been thoroughly impressed by at least 1/3 of their menu.  I'm sure we'll keep going back until we've tried everything!!

I am happily eating their yellow curry chicken with steamed rice as we speak - never before have I called to order pick-up and been told I could pick it up in 5 minutes.  And yes, 5 minutes later, I got to Chabaa and my food was ready and waiting for me.  Love you Chabaa!!! xoxox
author: Laura W.

description: family-style, a la carte dishes here are OK. street food however is very good. service is always on point. if you're looking for something fancier and more expensive, you can find that next door at Marnee Thai. friends and I would rather come here because it's quick and low-key. their noodle soup dishes always hit the spot. there's a combination beef noodle soup that i usually get with rice noodles but it's just good with egg noodles. items on their secret Thai menu are also decent. some things though, you just shouldn't order because it's cooked better elsewhere.
author: Thao T.

description: So excited that I found a late-night spot open in my neighborhood!! They're open until 1am every night (Score!) and the staff is so friendly! Upon walking in, you'll notice the restaurant is pretty casual. We ordered fried rice, chicken satay, and thai iced tea to-go and all of it was good! Now that I've picked up a menu, I'll definitely be ordering varied things. The staff were so cute and folded paper flowers in our straws and even asked if we wanted a half carton to carry out to the car. The service here is absolutely wonderful. I look forward to continuing to explore their menu!
author: Lissette L.

description:
I have been here a few times and have gotten good service and good food at all of the few times I have eaten here. I always order the 'pad si-yu' (may be spelled differently at other thai restaurants). The last time I came here my friend convinced me to order fried corn cakes. At first I was like, what is a corn cake? And  eventually I caved and tried it. It was actually really good, so if you are looking for a good appetizer and like corn this would be a great pick!

The only reason I took a star away is because the last time I came here one of the waitresses was skyping on her mac telling whovever she was skyping with that her phone was out of service because she dropped it in the toilet. I felt bad for her but i know that there's a chat box on skype so use that rather than telling the whole restaurant your business. I wouldn't have even noticed she was on her computer had she just been chatting and would then have given this restaurant 5 stars instead of 4. I felt that she was very unprofessional and could have been handeled in a better way.
author: Mandi S.

description: Food is delicious, Pad Thai is the best.  Staff is really nice, friendly, helpful.  Restaurant is clean and we'll maintained.
author: Ingrid B.

description: I tried this place first at there downtown location and wow, was it amazing! I live in Pacifica and realized they have this location (much closer drive). I brought my partner here to eat and being a chef, he was event impressed by there food. I have been searching for an amazing Thai place and I am so happy I found this one. I will be back for sure. Amazing soup, atmosphere and location!
author: J T.

description: Came for dinner with my girls over MLK weekend to finally do our Secret Santa exchange because we were all in town at the same time. We had made reservations for 6pm but half our group was stuck in traffic and didn't make it until 6.30. The restaurant was very accommodating and seated the group anyways and even let some of us order first. They didn't even complain when we started unwrapping our gifts (we brought bags to put the wrapping paper in of course). We were there until 8pm and they didn't once rush us. Quality girl time + decent food + decent service = nothing to complain about!
author: Sarah L.

description:
There's a secret menu for Thai people!  The food on there was definitely better than what was offered on the regular menu.  They really should just include it on the regular menu so other people (non-Thais) can sample other dishes that Thai people crave and eat more often besides Pad Thai.  The dishes were also a lot more flavorful.  I feel like many Thai restaurants tone the flavors down to accommodate to the taste buds of those that are not used to complex dishes, jammed packed with flavors.  I really like the Koh Moo Yang (grilled pork shoulders) here, their sauce was very tasty.  

You can also place an order online.  I haven't taken advantage of this yet, but I thought that was nifty and I just wanted to put it out there.  They are also open late.  Yay for us night owls!
author: Sandy J.

description: For a little hole-in-the-wall Thai restaurant, they have some really good food.  And you can watch them make it in front of you, which isn't so bad compared to the conditions of some restaurants.
author: Reid F.

description: That is the best Thai I've had in SF, maybe ever! Corn cakes, combination beef soup, cashew chicken & mango sticky rice = YUM! And the ladies working there are super sweet. We will be back often! I wish they delivered to our hood, but I'd eat it every day!
author: Gwen V.

description:
Ive been to upscale Thai restaurants and then the fast food take out kind like King of Thai and I have to say, this place wasn't bad nor good. Was it Thai food? Yeah. Did it taste good? Sure it did. Was it spectacular? No, not really. But it was on the pricey side for the quality and portion. 

Chicken Satay: 3 stars
It was a bit dry. The peanut sauce for dipping was a bit too bland for my taste buds. The pickled vegetables were kind of nice but a bit too much for me.

Roast duck fried rice: 3 stars
Yes there bits and pieces of duck in the fried rice... It was just a bit awkward because I'd get a random chunk of skin here and then no meat else where and then a large piece of meet here. I felt like for a fried rice they were didn't stir it enough to mix it up. Kind of oily as well but the flavors were there but once again nothing too special. 

The place is kind of small and dirty. Our tables were sticky and my side of the table was sweating while the other side was freezing their butts off. I have no idea why.

Service was okay. They weren't the friendliest but they weren't mean. Our waitress just seemed impatient because we were being indecisive. However she could've just suggested dishes or gave her opinions instead of looking like she didn't want to stand there. =/ 

So 3 stars it is.
author: Terinna R.

description:
This place is still my favorite Thai restaurant. The waitresses are attentive, and they take reservations for large parties.

My favorite dishes are Duck fried rice, Duck Pad Thai, the chicken wings with basil, and sticky rice with mango. YUM. I wish I had some sticky rice w/ mango right now.  *drool

Check this place out if u haven't already.
author: sophia l.

description:
Why oh why chabaa did I not think to come to you sooner?!? I've heard a little bit of hype from a few friends who raved about Chabaa and the good food here. Seeing as these were the same friends that enjoy King of Thai I figured the standards weren't so high and never got around to eating here.

Finally, my boyfriend and I, out of ideas of a place to go stopped here. I was surprised at the classiness of the place for a restaurant on Irving. It seemed so clean and quiet and almost romantic inside. We ordered the pad see ew and a panang curry with a thai iced tea to drink. Everything had such great flavors and really impressed me. I am such a sucker for good Thai food. 

One of the highlights of the night for me was the complimentary hot tea. It was the hot version of any thai iced tea that you normally get instead of the usual jasmine or green tea. It was just so tasty and warmed me up on that cold, rainy night. 

The ladies that worked there were super nice. I almost felt bad because they were eating their dinner and would stop to serve us. This might have bothered me on another night or in another place. At Chabaa, however, I didn't mind at all because they were still perfectly attentive and quick. 

I would come back here, for sure.
author: Danielle G.

description:
Solid Thai food, at a good price. Service is OK, even late at night. 

Never lets me down.
author: Jane N.

description:
Attention all Thai food lovers: this place rocks AND it delivers!

I really hate to say that I'm a creature of habit, but the dishes that I have tried here are way too good to try other things - I'm scared that they won't be as good! 

I recently ordered for delivery for six of my friends and we ordered a LOT of food. It came in 45 minutes!! That is an amazing feat in itself. We live across the sunset too.

I ALWAYS order #36. What is it called? I have no idea. The name of the dish is too complicated for my simple mind to remember, but it is ground beef over noodles with a fried egg on top. Doesn't sound healthy? Because it isn't... this dish is NOT for the faint of heart - but damn is it delicious. I have yet to find this dish elsewhere and I always order it when eating here. In fact, we ordered two of these dishes.

We also ordered a soup (I don't know which one because my friend picked it) that had coconut milk and lemongrass in it. It was also delicious and made for a tasty snack leftover. Definitely one of the better thai soups I've had.

Pad see ew. Yes, it is one of the most common dishes in all of thai foodom... but damn, does this place do it right. The only place that I've had better pad see ew is in Berkeley at Thai Basil. My friends, who rarely eat Thai, loved this dish as well. They really hit this out of the ballpark.

In addition, we got yellow curry which was satisfactory but doesn't scream exemplary to me. I would definitely eat it again but it doesn't make me go bonkers like their other dishes.

Last, but certainly not least, we ordered the pineapple fried rice. This is one of the better pineapple fried rice dishes I've had. They include some dried fruits and nuts in the dish, which I found to be weird at first but have learned to embrace and desire it. This dish is definitely tasty and sometimes I even order this instead of #36. 

Overall, one of the better thai places in the sunset. I haven't tried Marnee Thai YET but I have a feeling it is just as good. I even convinced my creature of habit parents to try this place and they liked it too!
author: Christina B.

description:
I go here all the time. Well, I used to before i moved and it became sort of a journey to travel all the way to the inner sunset for a "quick" meal. 

I am a HUGE fan of Thai food, and I'd have to say, Chabaa is on my top 5 list, for sure. It's inexpensive (not cheap, but not expensive), food comes out fast, and its delicious. I never know what to order when I go there for dinner because everything looks so good, but I always end up getting the same things:

1. Pad Thai
2. Pad See Ew
3. Green Curry
4. Duck noodle soup
5. Ground meat with bell peppers and basil over rice
6. Duck with baby boc choy over rice

(not listed in any particular order)

Mmmmm...just thinking about it makes me want to take a trip there right now! Oh, and it does open late too. Chabaa closes at about 12 or 1am most nights (I think), which is great because with my schedule, I never know what time I'll get a chance to eat.
author: Linh P.

description:
I ordered the red chicken curry. Instead of rice though I wanted extra vegetables (don't crucify me). I wanted something cheap and somewhat healthy. I am on the paleo diet so the rice and other grains and starches are out of the question. They were able to accommodate the request. Food was brought out quickly.  It was decent red curry, kind of diluted. But for about 8 dollars it was worth it. 

The place is very tiny and congested. But if you're just looking for a quick bite to eat for a cheap price that isn't going to clog your arteries this is a good choice. Just don't expect top notch Thai (or red curry at least).
author: Shaved I.

description: Really good food! Just a warning there are icons with 1 pepper for mild/spicy and 2 for HOT!.... There is no 3rd pepper, or middle option (mild, spicy, hot ). But this is some of the best Thai I have ever had!
author: Lauren T.

description:
I heard from friends that this place was pretty amazing, but I had to try for myself. 

I'm in love with pad thai, I know it's a little boring and typical but there's is pretty amazing! 

The prices aren't too shabby and the other food that everyone else got looked really good too! Def coming again to try the other food!
author: Alison N.

description: Great pumpkin curry! This is a typical neighborhood thai place. Its pretty clean, the wait staff are pleasant. I never wait more than a few minutes to be seated. This time was not different. I got the pumpkin curry with pork. The curry was full of vegetables and a decent amount of pork.
author: Joel Z.

description: This is my fav Thai place in the Sunset.  I often pop in for a quick lunch (service is fast and efficient) and they are my go-to Thai food take out place.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
The delivery place we always order from.  I've never even been inside the actual restaurant.  
We have ordered many diffrent things from the not-so-secret menu and the regular menu and have yet to be disappointed.  As a few other reviews pointed out their soups are meh, but the curries are great.

I would normally give this place 3 stars but becuase its cheap and they deliver, they get bumped to 4.

DID I MENTION THEY BRING ME THAI ICED TEA WITHOUT ME HAVING TO GET OFF THE COUCH?
author: Natalie R.

description: Great restaurant!! Very service oriented staff!!! Love the food here, especially the fried chicken over friend rice and the delicious dessert menu, the only drawback I have is that it's open sooo late!!! I feel bad for the staff working so late....  But over all great restaurant!!  :)
author: Mario C.

description: This restaurant totally surprised me! First of all I don't really eat Thai food but the food here was very good! You get decent portions for the price. Also, the women serving us have excellent service & checked on us like 3 times! I definitely recommend this restaurant!
author: Amanda B.

description:
I can't say enough about the positive things at Chabaa. I come at least once a week. (During my lunch break) The waitresses are super friendly, and remember the small details about my order. I can be an annoying patron, which special requests and all. For example, I ordered the Tom Yum Noodle Soup today, 1/2 the noodles since I don't finish it, extra steamed veggies, no pork and extra spicy. Seriously.. I ordered that for lunch today. And they got the order perfectly!! There are many dishes to choose from here.. The string beans w/ tofu or meat if you like, the Thai omelets with ground pork, the chicken over fried rice... crab fried rice... the list goes on and on. 

Eating at Chabaa makes me smile.. (smile).
author: Alice E.

description:
My favorite place for Thai food. 

It's inexpensive, and the quality is top-tier. It's also open late.
author: Forest S.

description: Thai food anywhere is over priced. This place is no different. Nothing here that majesty it stand out. The secret menu items are ok. I've tried the pork neck grilled, I've had better at Sai jai. Spicy beef noodles soup is good here though and I always get that. Papaya salad with salted crab is decent can't go wrong with that. Phad Thai is a little on the sweet side. Fried rice isn't that great here, no flavor. The batter they use for fried chicken over fried rice isn't good or maybe they over cook it because batter is always dark and tastes burnt. I like this place over Marnee Thai though as the prices aren't as ridiculous and food is about the same.
author: P P.

description:
I was in the Sunset with my boyfriend and as we were grabbing drinks on Irving, I saw Chabaa across the street.  We quickly went on Yelp to check out the reviews and then headed over to look at the menu that they had posted on their window.  The prices looked very reasonable (most dishes were under $7) so we decided to order take-out from there.  I remember seeing someone rave around the Roast Duck Fried Rice so we ordered that as well as a Pad Kee Mao with Shrimp (the must have Thai dish for me).  However, it wasn't until after we had placed our order that I noticed that all the prices on their menu had changed (as indicated on their take-out menu) and everything was at least $1 more (WTF?!...why didn't they change the menu outside?)...

Anyway, the food was nothing spectacular.  In fact, the taste and quality of the dishes we had reminded me a lot of what King of Thai Noodles cook up (maybe a little better though).  The portions were generous though and our food was ready within the time frame they mentioned which was nice.  Perhaps I'll have to try their entrees next time...
author: Katelynn L.

description:
I came here a long long time ago, and back then I didn't yelp every single restaurant that I went to.

I came with my mom & best friend. My best friend got some kind of rice that tasted like rice and salt. I tasted it and I could not bear to eat anymore! Just licking a piece of salt made me thirsty! It was horrid. Somehow, he ate it all.. I guess he didn't want to be rude or something...but it was seriously just gross.

I used to love those little shrimp rolls or something, but the last time that I had them, they were bland and boring. Before this place was chabaa, it was something else. BACK THEN it used to be good. But hey, that's how long it's been since I've been here.
author: Erica A.

description: Absolutely no complaints. The waitress was constantly filling up our drinks. We had duck noodle soup and namtok (on their secret menu), as well as dessert. The service was on par with some western restaurants, which is rare for an Asian place!
author: Jeffrey C.

description: Nice friendly place. They open late on weekends making this the best after hour spot. The food is also delicious.
author: T L.

description: I love Chabba:)  it a very friendly place (delivery people too).  its clean.  the food is very delicious.  the prices are very reasonable.  Tom Yum and coconut rice with shrimp in a blanket is a wonderful meal:)  Go try it out:)
author: Lin B.

description:
From the outside the gleaming sign beckons you to enter.  Once you step through the doors you notice the openness, the understated-yet-tasteful modern decor.  You're kindly welcomed in and your mouth begins to water as you look over the menu...

A couple of friends and I tried this place tonight.  Overall the meal was excellent, service pretty good, and the price about right.  We tried the appetizer sampler (delish eggrolls), a red curry with pork (the pork was a bit overcooked), an eggplant dish (lots of flavor, soft-but-not-gooey eggplant), and a veggie combo (tasty and simple).  I think this is definitely worth a try---I'll probably be back to see if the pork is done a little better.

Times visited: 1
author: Amy L.

description: Hate to do this but do not come here. Food was below average. An hour after we left my friend was throwing up the pad thai she ate... And she only had a few bites because it was so bad. I don't feel so great myself, hoping that I won't be throwing up later. I would never even think about going here again, you shouldn't either.
author: Scott B.

description:
number one.  it's open till late.
number two.  the quality isn't jack in the box.
number three.sit and eat
number four.  thai food.

if you have a problem with this place, then you're probably neurotic.
author: Lea M.

description:
We were craving something a little different and so went exploring the streets of Irving... or at least doing so virtually through Yelp's built in map finder. Chabaa stood out, with great reviews and craving something different from our usual fare. Sadly, the place was a miss for us...

We ordered the Pad Kee Mao and Pad Si-Yu with a side of rice. The rice was good (yes, choosing to start with the positive). The other dishes? Not so much, each suffered from the same problem: way too greasy. We were sharing the food back and forth and were really put off from noticing the grease on the plates.

Overall, we were pretty unsatisfied. As the greatest mark against the place, we didn't finish our plates, not even close... and clang to the rice like the last bastion of hope from our meal. Our advice? If you don't mind greasy food, the food here is probably good, although our weak stomachs for it will keep us away.
author: Sami R.

description: This was my first time eating legit Thai food. I ordered the chicken pad thai and the shrimp fried rice. I liked the shrimp fried rice but for the pad thai, it wasn't my taste. But their service is friendly! It's really cozy!
author: Sandy C.

description:
I must have missed the other Thai place a few doors down so I stopped by Chabaa for takeout.  I placed my order and had to run out to the bank, approximately 2 blocks away.  By the time I returned my Pad Kee Mao was ready. I thought the dish really lacked- the flat rice noodles were suppose to come with chicken, green beans, bell peppers, Thai chili and sweet basil.  They skimped on the veggies and I wasn't a fan of the ground chicken and the spiciness.  Also ordered an iced coffee but I guess she didn't hear me and I got the Thai iced tea instead, which I've had better elsewhere. 

Good effort for their quickness but this place will not be a go-to spot for my Thai cravings.
author: Lisa C.

description:
i ordered the fried rice with duck, it was so good! 
Went there with my roomie after shopping, close to where I live. 
Love love the food there, my roomie said, you could never go wrong here.
Gonna go there again with my BF!
:)
author: Serena W.

description: This place as good as it gets as far as Thai Food. It's one of my favorite places to eat in the city and i always find myself coming back. I have tried many things on the menu and absolutely everything has been delicious. The staff is very friendly and are great about filling your cup with water.  When you go make sure to order the fried banana  with coconut ice cream for dessert, its sensational.
author: Heather C.

description: Great that it is open late, but not too impressive cuisine. Good service though.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Whats wrong with Chabba?!?! 

They used to be one of my favoueite Thai restaurant in town, their authentic thai fried rice were awesome. Even my Thai fds said it was one of the best. But now?!!?! I dont even want to go there anymore! 
Overall, their food is too sweet,. The tum yum noodle soup taste so wrong, the papaya salad is not even fresh...
Really disappointed, such a pitty to loose one of my must-go restaurants.
author: Bonnie T.

description:
The food was sub-par. Too salty and unmemorable.

Plus is that the servers are friendly and the place is really clean!
author: Marian C.

description:
Amazing Thai food. Great hours. Decently priced. 

I've had a lot of Thai food and this is one restaurant that I return to for some more Thai. Last time i was here, i tried the thai tea (as every table had an order), the fried chicken wings with garlic (very crispy and unique taste), red duck curry (smelled and tasted awesome) and a fried noodle dish that i can't remember but made with ho fun noodles. 

Everything tasted good. I have nothing negative to say about the restaurant other than street starting but the traffic is in and out, parking should not be much of a problem. But if you ever decide to try this place out, the curries are a must!
author: Amanda L.

description: Came here at night to eat some Thai food that my friends and I were craving. Ordering the same dish at a different Thai restaurant has always seemed a hit or miss on a variety of dishes but this place missed pretty bad on my friends' orders such as Pad Thai being too dry and Tom Yum noodle soup being too sour. My order on the other hand, Guay Tiew Lord, was decent at the very least. I would want to try this place one more time to see if it warrants my A-OK.
author: Wayeal Z.

description: This place was so great! I went with my family and had the combo appetizer, which was very delicious. Then had pad thai chicken, the pinapple and shrimp fried rice, and the fried egg with beef and noodles (im forgetting the name). It was very inexpensive, 49 for all 4 of us, including drinks. I have never seen a thai iced coffee before so i had to order it, and it was MAGICAL. so good. a little sweet, but just right. The service was nice and the ambience even better. I highly recommend.
author: Lily R.

description: My boyfriend and I love this place, it's our go-to late night spot and has really good food for the price. Pretty comparable to Marnee a few blocks away which I also love, but which is more expensive and definitely more crowded...we go there on more special occasions (we eat Thai pretty often!). Chabaa a great place to have an intimate conversation, some great food, and experience friendly service.
author: Claire C.

description:
Why do birds suddenly appear, every time you are near? Just like me, they long to be...close to youuuuuuu!

Chabaa, you are wonderful. You are open 7 days a week, 11am-1am (THAT'S RIGHT FOOL-YONS, 1AM!!), you have ridiculously low prices and excellent service!

My green curry was delicious-spicy but not too crae crae, the pad si yu was marvelous (with spinach and lemon grass instead of broccoli which I thought was great!) and don't even get me started on the Tom Ka soup with it's coconut milky goodness...

I'll be back my friends...I'll be back.
author: MrsKimch I.

description: a thai spot that's opened late, takes card, and delivers?! ohhh yahh! service is pretty awesome here too! ohhh and onto the food! the crab fried rice... let's just say it's a good portion, they use real crab meat, and they're not shady with the amount of crab meat they put in the fried rice either! this has got to be one of my favorite thai spots!
author: Ann T.

description:
I don't know why but I didn't like this place. 

I thought their fish cakes were disgusting. 

It was kind of a long time ago, but it's hard to want to come back here to give it a try when there are better places around.
author: Christina X.

description: Much prefer them to Marnee! Never had a bad dish here, off of either menu. Ask the waiters for suggestions from Thai menu - it's all been wonderful. Cheap, with incredibly friendly service. Love it!
author: Gabe G.

description:
I'm a solid fan of this place! Good food, great service, and open late. 

Their servers are so so nice! After we had ordered, my boyfriend was talking about how he craved some watermelon and lo and behold, there was a lady at the table in front of ours who had a takeout box full of cut up watermelon... so him being him, naturally he asks her where she got the watermelon from ie could we order it here somehow? I don't think she really spoke english, but the server explained that she was the owner of the restaurant and the watermelon wasn't on the menu, she was just eating it haha. Oh well! But a few minutes later, a server came by with a plate of watermelon slices, complements of the owner! I was so surprised and definitely impressed by how thoughtful and generous they were!

As for the food, we ordered the pad prik king (beef with green beans in chill paste sauce) and rice noodles with ground beef and an egg on top. We didn't really like either of the beef in our dishes... the ground beef was strangely kind of elastic and the stir fried beef was similar. But I loved how they cooked the rice noodles (slightly burnt in wok style) and the egg was perfect with the dish! Food was pretty solid, I think next time I'll stick to the more traditional dishes like the fried rice or pad thai/pad see ew. Combined with the service, this place would be five stars if we had liked the food a little more!
author: Janey L.

description:
My BF and I had walked by this place many a time.  Finally we decided to step in, and were hesitant to do so because it was empty and were close to walking down to Marnee Thai.  We gave it a shot and were greeted and seated promptly.  

We ordered the yellow curry, pad see ew (sorry for the spelling error) and the spring rolls.  Oh man, hands down my favorite yellow curry in the sunset.  It was perfectly spicy, with some sweetness.  The noodle dish was delicious too.  Everything tasted fresh, to say the least we were very satisfied.  The tea they served alongside the meal was also rather tasty, unlike any other I've had.  I had to ask what it was and the waitress gladly told me it was a combo of jasmine and thai tea.  Yum, I think i had like 5-6 cups of it.  

Service was great, the place was clean with modern decor.  We will definitely be returning to this little gem.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Please dont judge me for the color of my skin, for I can handle spicy food! For real- I will eat and enjoy food that would make a grown Desi cry! Yet once again I go into a Thai restaurant(also happens in Indian restaurants) and they ask how spicy I would like my curry. Granted I ordered the prawns in green curry which claimed to already be spicy, but I say "Very spicy" anyways. Of course they then bring out a curry which most Thai people would call mild. On top if that, it wasn't even very tasty. The prawns were a little too tough and lacked flavor. The curry sauce itself was fairly bland also.


But their pad thai is pretty good. A little heavy, but good.
author: David D.

description:
I've been on the search for the best pad thai and thai iced tea and I'm pretty sure I have found it at Chabaa!  This place is great!  Fast service, beautiful restaraunt and it's open until 1AM in the morning!  Perfect place for college students to get their grub on when they are high as hell.

The food is cheap and SO GOOD.  The best pad thai that I have ever eaten.  And their thai iced tea?  To freaking die for.  It comes in a pretty, tall glass and they even make cute designs with the straw wrapper (A rose or a cute swirly thing).  I will travel all the way from east bay just to have their thai tea.  WELL, great now I'm craving it now -___-

Enjoy!
author: Kristina I.

description:
This is my go too place for Thai Food on irving. Chabaa has good food, friendly staff and a clean place. The hours are pretty good too if you want some late night Thai Food. I've had two dinner parties here and have had no complaints.  The prices are also affordable. I usually get Pad Si-Yu(Pad See Eew), Yellow Curry with an appetizer or two. 

If you're craving some Thai Food and are in the Sunset, you should def check this place out!
author: Kathleen A.

description:
I usually come here if I'm craving Thai food because it's simple with affordable prices. I usually get a Pad Si-Yu, Pad Thai, or fried chicken over fried rice. The one time my friends and I decided to be "adventurous" with getting the Guay Tiew Nua Sub, it tasted OK. It wasn't really my favorite thing that I've had there. 

The workers are friendly and efficient. The food always comes out in a respectable amount of time. 

I would definitely recommend someone to come here for a Thai food craving.
author: Kathy L.

description:
This is my go to Thai place in the Sunset. The food is simple and delicious (just how I like it), the service is friendly and efficient, and they're open late. I had the sweet sticky rice and mango dessert last night and it really hit the spot.  I've really only gone in the evenings and there's still a good amount of people eating when I get there around 10 pm or so. 

What do I recommend? The duck noodle soup. I've been sick lately and along with the cold weather it really hits the spot.
author: Devy E.

description:
Authentic Thai restaurant that let's you sit there for hours and still serves the tea.  my new favorite thai restaurant!! :)  I love love love the Tom Yum Soup :)

glad that i gave it a try :D
author: Steph M.

description: I love coming here for a late dinner.  This is one of the few places that are still open and offer real, decent food in inner sunset after 930pm. Many of the menu items are your standard Thai dishes, but the real jewels are the soup noodle and special menu! my favorite soup noodle (or noodle soup, whatever) is the roast duck soup noodle. I tried the stew beef noodle once and it was a lot less flavorful. The basil fried rice on the special menu is incredibly good but spicy so be warned. There's also some kind of white sour soup on the regular menu that I can't remember the name of. To sum: Price is reasonable,  service good, food delicious,  and hours a blessing!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
We did a take out from this place as the decor more resembled a kitchen than a restaurant - i think they can better use the space. 

We ordered the pad si yu and the green curry. The noodles were tasteless and disappointing. The green curry was awesome though, as was the appetizer sampler (except for the tofu). 

What pissed me off somewhat was being charged $2 for the rice to go with the green curry. WTF?

Cute - how they fold the straw tops into roses.
author: Haris H.

description:
A friend of mine introduced me to this place, and ever since then i've been hooked!!

You definitely get what you pay for here. It's delicious.
Thai iced tea.. yummy
pineapple fried rice.. OMG..

For this place, i'm willing to circle the block amongst the terrible drivers to look for parking. It's worth it.
author: Neek W.

description: Tried this place while searching for a Thai restaurant that I'd been to in the past. This place was better. Had the Raad Na, can highly recommend it. Excellent gravy Anne the Chinese broccoli was cooked to perfection. Friend couldn't finish her pad Thai. Good portions, good food, good service (though some basic Thai language skills will help with the wait staff).
author: Secret S.

description:
When I lived in LA, I would order in from a Thai place called "Pink Peppers." The food brought to my door was outstanding in every way - I never thought I'd see the like again...then I found Chabaa, quite by random.

First, let me say: I've never actually been to Chabaa, just ordered for home delivery...I understand that its open late (which, in this town, 10pm could qualify for "late"), and that its a cool neighborhood place, but I have no experience with Chabaa other than they bring me stuff.

Good stuff. The green curry is off the chart good, and they do great things with duck. Everything that has ever been delivered is fresh, hot and tastes like its been made to order - which I suspect it is...

Extra points for having a website that allows you to order from your mobile browser. Hmmm....wait, I've never been there, don't really know its location, and I have never actually spoken to anyone there on the phone... uh, who are these people?
author: Rob D.

description:
ChaBaa is usually the preference Thai restaurant in my group of friends, and simply put I don't mind it at all. I think the flavors are a better than the average King of Thai(KOT varies on location, #2 is the best imo).

I also like supporting the locals, rather than chains. Anyways, the service is a good and attentive. They always greet and seat you immediately upon entrance. Orders are handled promptly, and food is usually quick as well, but not rushed. Decor is basic, but overall the experience is a pleasant one. 

Parking during dinner is usually easy around the streets of Irving, pricing is on par with the average Thai restaurants, if anything a little bit on the cheaper side, but not by much.

If you're wondering bout the 3/5 stars, It's because I had better Thai food in the city, but Chabaa is still great and worth a try.
author: Austin N.

description:
The first time I came to Chabaa was a couple of years ago, when my bf threw me a surprise birthday. The waitresses were very nice and attentive even though we had a group of about 20. 

I usually get #36 Guay Tiew Nua Sub and maybe their Green or Yellow Curry. Delicious!

They are open late too, which is definitely a bonus if you have the late night munchies!
author: Cheryl C.

description: Wow. this place is really great! we went in, ordered right away, food came quick, great size meal and tasted great! i had the chicken red curry. store was clean, service was kind and moved fast! price was good for quality. after tax and tip i paid about $10. i was very satisfied
author: William E.

description: Awesome food, I had the pad Thai with shrimp, tofu and chicken, and it was awesome. Great service and I'll definitely come again. They open till 1 pm on weekend and that what I love most about them
author: Hamidou D.

description:
For someone who loves Thai food, but can't eat spicy food, they are amazing! 
Eat there 2x a week at least!!!
Recommend the Paid Thai, Pad Pra Ram, and yellow curry are staples.  
Yummy coconut mango sticky rice! 

Con: if you pay by credit card over the phone, only you can pick it up, not someone else.  But at least delivery is free. :)
author: T O.

description: A friend of mine told me about Chabaa.  I am forever indebted to her because the food here is excellent.  The servers were fantastic and super friendly.  Go here now.   P.S. try the druck fried rice..
author: Marlon T.

description: they used to be a good service ! But the waitress are so mean and the way they talk to us ! Last time we want to pack our food to go and we ask for 2 box! They really give us 2 box .. But without a piece of the cover for the top ! Then we ask for it.. She really brought for us that piece but only 1 . We ask again for another piece for the box then she started angry and look at us ! Wat a bad service ever
author: Dreamatic W.

description:
This place has been a great addition to my hood, ever since it opened a few years back.

They now have an add-on menu with some really interesting, different Thai dishes. I'm excited to try a few new things.

They still make some of the best Pad Kee Mao that I've had and their Som Tum salad is always the way I love it...slightly spicy :)
author: Zoeboe D.

description:
YUM, YUM, YUM!! 

- Wings (Delicious)
- Yellow Chicken Curry (Awesome!!)
- Thai Ice Tea w/ folded rose straw cover (unique)
author: Priscilla C.

description:
Pad Thai.. Yum.

The environment is nice... pretty chill and cool. 

Cute girls here and there... and maybe over there too.... 

Im actually refering to the people that was eatting here.. Not the waitress...

But what a scenario =)


- Enough kidding around... 

Service: is really good for some odd reason.. They usually serve me when im there. I don't know about the rest of you guys... 

Food: Ah... So far i only ate pat-thai, but everyone else said their food was great. So food quality wise its pretty good =)

Place: Quite small, but i never experienced a line yet..

Price: Pretty decent.
author: Ernest S.

description: Been here a few times and was pleasantly surprised. Good service and good food at a good price. They get you in and out without too many bells and whistles to complicate your meal. They turn your straw when you order the Thai tea into a flower! I was pretty amazed by that alone.
author: Peter H.

description: Yellow curry was bland n runny! Stir fry was salty and pad Thai noodle was hard.
author: Jazzlynn L.

description:
I've had better Thai food, and I've had worse Thai food. All in all, my experience at Chabaa is always a good one because their service is awesome. I know they have tough competition just down the street at Marnee, but their service isn't nearly as good as Chabaa.

I usually get the Pad Thai (I do at almost every Thai restaurant I go to), and the one at Chabaa is pretty good. Their curry is also tasty.

So, it's not mouthgasmic, and it's not terrible. Whenever I have a hankering for Thai food in the city, this place is definitely one of my top choices.
author: Sara K.

description:
I thought of giving this place  2 stars but since it got such a high rating it won't hurt to go a little lower.  Yelpster who gave this place 5 stars, come on, where's your taste buds? I am shock that yelp didn't give this place its true rating.
The Tom Yum is so bland.  How can this be?  I feel like it came from a soup mix and not make from scratch.  
The night I was there, there was only 1 Thai person there.  So maybe this is a hang out for unfamiliar taste buds.   Still its hard to be a newbee because there are lots of options here and all of them are better then this location.  All you guys fall for the nice plates and color menus and what about the food?  I think they skimp on ingredients, portions small, too salty like someone had mentioned here.
I like the staff and service but don't think I will eat here again.
author: Mar H.

description: You can always get a good/square meal deal here and it was such the case several nights ago. The c-wings are good. Their curry dishes are good. I really like their tom yum soup. Kept staring / drooling at the Black Toyota Supra ('96?) parked outside; fully matte, 19" boss-azz wheels - just insanely perfect. Oh, and the meal was pretty good too :)
author: Derek N.

description:
After coming to Chabaa for the past several years, we
were happy to find a replacement for the old Samila on Geary.
We both ordered the Chicken Pad-see Ew, and were thoroughly
disappointed by the overwhelming amount of salty sauce.

Have they changed cooks or recipe?

They were nice enough to re-cook our dish.
The second try was better, but still overly salty and 
not close to the quality and flavor of the same dish 
that we have ordered many times before.

We might try this place one more time (not the Pad-see Ew).
There are too many alternative restaurants.
author: Lawrence L.

description: Consistently good food, especially because they're open late. Soups are excellent; add extra wontons to any soup for $2, you won't regret it. Spend $3 and get coconut rice with your entree. It's super tasty. Great desserts, too. Love this place!
author: N B.

description:
Food gets 3.5 stars. Delivery/service gets 1. 

I placed an order on Grubhub tonight around 7:15. At 7:50 I get a message from Grubhub that my food has left and it should arrive shortly. Beautiful. Around 8:40 food still hasn't arrived so I decide to give them a call for an update. The man who answered the phone apologizes and says they're very busy, but the food already left and should arrive shortly. At this point, it's understandable, being that it's Mothers day. 45 minutes later my food STILL hasn't arrived. I called again and a woman answered. I told her I placed an order two hours earlier and I still haven't gotten my food. She said that the food just left a few minutes ago and should be on its way. I told her that's what I was told 45 minutes ago.. and she had nothing to say to that. She also hadn't even asked who I was or what my address was.. so she obviously had no idea where my food actually was. At 9:40, my food finally arrives. Cold, of course. 

Two and a half hours for delivery?!?! There's absolutely no excuse for that. Honestly they should have called me from the get go and told me it was going to be a long wait if they were that backed up. 

I honestly really like the food here, and delivery usually doesn't take long at all (I literally live 5 minutes away). But this event really left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Nikkol K.

description:
Whenever I feel the slight inkling of a scratchy throat or a sniffly nose, I head over to Chabaa for their hot delicious roast duck noodle soup. It has magically healing properties. Like chicken soup but better. The duck soup base is well seasoned and they provide you with an adequate amount of duck breast ontop of the noodles of your choice. 

Ive been here solely for their flavorful medicinal elixirs so I cant speak for the rest of the menu. My bottom line, the duck soup is good and  I have been viral infection free for 1 year 4 months.
author: Vicky L.

description: Staff was friendly and the Chang beer was great! The place was quant and cute. The food was decent. The won ton soup lacked flavor. My husband enjoyed his fried rice and shrimp.
author: Stephanie S.

description: This place is great.... large seating area for large parties and reasonably priced.  The fish is tasty, and the pineapple fried rice and the mango sticky rice are excellent.  Staff is extremely friendly. Oh yeah, they don't charge for hot Thai tea so add 1/2 star bonus!!
author: Joshua L.

description: Don't order delivery online. I live about 5 min away by car and it took over an hour and 15 min to get my food. Not cool, bad service, even after I called to let them know.
author: M S.

description:
This place really isn't good!  I don't understand why Chabaa and Tea Way, which is right across the street, have such rave reviews.  This is like the half block of awfulness!  
I LOVE Thai food but Chabaa skimps out on all the good parts.  You'll see like one lone onion slice on your bed of food.  Actually I don't even believe they have enough vegetables in their kitchen to execute some of the foods on the menu.  Or they're just terribly frugal and don't put any vegetables in their meals.  My pad see ew was soaked in oil...but you wouldn't be able to tell at first because it's all sitting on the bottom.  
Not to mention, I had to wave down the waitresses every time I wanted something.  They were totally overstaffed for 9:30PM but all of the ladies just sat down at a table near the kitchen and chit-chatted the night away.  RUDEEE.
peace out Chabaa, never again.
author: Amber R.

description:
Thai food is one of those cuisines I eat a lot, so at first I was hesitant to go ahead and give Chabaa all five of my stars.  I mean, Thai food in general is near and dear to my heart, and I can't say that I've really had Thai food I did not immensely enjoy in all my time in San Francisco.  Should I be so generous with the very first Thai restaurant I review?

So I thought about the food.  I thought about their tofu satay appetizer with peanut sauce.  I thought about how it was pretty much the heartiest tofu I have ever had, and how it's firm, and chewy, and seasoned just right.  Then I thought about their curries, and all their diverse vegetables just swimming in a thick and creamy sauce.  I thought about how tender the pumpkin is, and how the tofu is soft and melty, so you know they're no one-trick tofu-pony.  I thought about the euphoric gleam in my boyfriend's eyes as he consumed a gigantic plate of spicy, tender pork shoulder (I tried it, you know, just to be sure).

And then my thoughts turned to calories, and the devil on my shoulder said "You know, all that coconut milk and all those pan-fried noodles, they'll catch up with you."  But then I remembered that the food at Chabaa is some of the healthiest around.  For so many dishes that are sauteed, everything feels so clean and fresh!  And I thought about how insanely easy it is for me to make healthier choices at Chabaa - almost everything on the menu will be happily turned into a vegetarian dish, and it doesn't feel like a cop out!  The flavors and textures are all still so remarkably intricate that you can really tell they put a lot of care into their food.

Speaking of which, hey!  I should think about their kind and friendly waitstaff and the way that, even when they're rather busy the food comes out with surprising promptness.  Or about the multitude of space heaters they have, to keep people like me warm in what seems like a sea of perpetually-chilly San Franciscan restaurants.  (Many are cold, but few are frozen.)

And then I thought about how we got two entrees (specials, no less!) that yielded leftovers, an appetizer, and a Thai iced coffee for $30.  For dinner.  Yeah.  You can have my five stars, Chabaa.  You're pretty alright.
author: Becca S.

description:
This restaurant is amazing. If you live in the area or ever find yourself nearby, you owe it to yourself to visit.

The food is great, the wait staff is very attentive and polite. They've always made a point to greet me personally since my 3rd visit. I cannot state it enough - You should come to this restaurant.
author: Jeff G.

description: decent thai food, but not my favorite. maybe i just didnt order the right items.. got a stir fry and a curry - the stiry fry (i think ground chicken with bell peppers and basil) was a bit sweet and the curry just had little to no flavor.  service was great and it's nice that they deliver and are open late, but i think i still prefer marnee thai
author: Lisa H.

description:
When I was learning how to color in the lines as a kid, I don't know how many pictures I've ruined and how frustrating it was for me to control my motor skills enough to not push the color crayon over the lines. After so many failed trials, broken crayons, crooked fingers and drool marks as I focused so intensely...finally, one day i produced the perfect picture.  It was a picture so beautiful, the gods would've shed tears just looking at it...It was a masterpiece! I felt pretty damn good.

it's kinda like that here.  When I stepped in and looked around, the walls reminded me of that perfect picture i colored, the lights and everything seem so coordinated. So in-the-line, so to speak..and it made me fell all nice inside, and it looked good too. The quiet softness about the place made me feel right.  It was also literally very quiet, great place to have a peaceful meal.  It may have been the late night that affected my perception of the surroundings...but I still liked it!

Now, I don't much like Thai food (I'm so sick of King of Thai and I think Marnee Thai is super overrated), but this was a pleasant surprise! I gotta say, it wasn't bad. It wasn't bad at all.
author: Tu L.

description:
This is my late night Thai spot in the Sunset district. I always order to go because it's always so cold in there! They have a little fan heater that's suppose to heat up the whole restaurant -____- To go it is!

I always order the Pad See Ew and/or the Duck Fried Rice. Nice service and good food.
author: A W.

description:
Yay! My first Yelp post. I looked over the menu here and thought okay this place is decent. When the waitress realized I was Thai, she said they had a Thai menu. I was like nah i can read English just fine but then she said "No, no I mean we have dishes that are catered to a Thai person." And  I instantly looked and my buddy and we said at the same time "SECRET MENU". Whoa this is like In and OUT.  There are so many different items that were on there like Issan sausages (sai krok issan) and Northern sausages (sai oor). They have Som tum bhu LAOs style which is not very common- the stinkier..the better. They made the som tum so hot that my eyes were watering. They even had the Yum nam salad..(nam is a fermented sausage). Pork shoulders with nam prik and roasted rice.

The menu is in Thai so you may want to bring someone who can read it or take thai lessons. The flavors are so strong so maybe thats why they don't have these dishes on the regular menu and the heat is like White man die hot!! Thai people don't like wasting food so they will make it less spicier for foreigners. If you can handle the heat, you can  politely ask to add more chili because it's harder to go from spicier to less spicy.
author: Geo D.

description:
CHABAA!!! This is my ultimate favorite Thai Restaurant, thanks to my big sissy for introducing me to this addicting place! My sister used to live right across, and during the times i'd be staying with her, we would be starving coming back from work, and tadaah! Chabaa was not even a minute away, and we'd be munching away. My sister is great friends with the owners who are also sisters, and also serve excellent service! The food is great (it's addicting, I kidd you not), the location isn't too crowded, if you're driving, good luck with parking, as usual, and the inside is clean, nicely decorated, and quite spacious. I'm so glad they opened another location downtown, a little smaller, but the food is just as good! I would always tease my sister for not brining me any Chabaa whenever she came to visit me, I could live off of their food. 

Really excited to spend my sister's wedding rehearsal dinner here in July, yummy!!!
author: Anne Marie M.

description: OMG! (and I don't mean that lightly) I'm a north bay native who has been living in Santa Barbara for a few years now and before my move south I traveled to Thailand. Finding decent Thai in SB is just about impossible and finding good or great Thai is impossible. Whenever I travel home I ALWAYS get my Asian food fix because I know it'll be a few long, dark months before my cravings are sated again. My sister lives a few blocks from Chabaa and recommended it for take out. SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO good! Just the right amount of spicy (you're supposed to sweat when you eat Thai!) and so, so, so fresh tasting! They even messsed up our order (we asked for Beef Pad Thai and got Chicken Satay?), but it was all so good we didn't care. I may drop out of school and start living on my sister's couch just so I can eat here more often. Drooooooooollll....
author: Joy E.

description:
Came here with a friend last night and it was AMAZING! The food was fresh and delicious, and it came out quickly. I had the Silver Noodle Salad and it was beyond fantastic.

Also, the decor of the place is really adorable.

And they deliver! They do have a $20 delivery minimum, which sucks, but order with a roommate, boyfriend, whatever. The food is just as good from home.

AND the best part: It's open late!!!
author: Rachel A.

description:
I will admit this..i took my mom and wife here to celebrate Mother's Day only because the first choice i wanted, Marnee Thai,was packed to the gills with hungry folks. Since I didn't want to wait, I decided to take them here.

I know that a lot has already been said about this place, so i will point out some of my own observations. The service here is real good. Our water was consistently filled without us even asking once. the food is also quite good, PLUS they have a great vegetarian menu. We had the green curry chicken, peanut curry beef, pineapple fried rice, papaya salad, and vegetable garlic dish. don't be fooled by the small looking bowls they servce the curry dishes in..i was at first disappointed by the small bowls, only do realize that those damn bowls are DEEP. They help so much good stuff and curry sauce that I couldn't finish it. So yeah..this is a good alternative when you can't get into Marnee Thai
author: Jerry C.

description: I like the hot seafood crisp noodle.that my last dinner of Chinese New Year at 2012.Because almost Chinese restaurant were closed then. My friend Louis taked me to there.
author: H S.

description: Don't know what happened... maybe change in chefs? I was very disappointed again after having lunch there last week. The basil chicken was so dry... and basil-less. Where's the duck in duck fried rice, one of my favorites here. The crab fried rice recently served with a small clump (1 1/2 TBS) of crab shreds piled in middle of the rice. The padthai was too vinegary and stuck together. Leftovers and no one wanted them.The prices are not cheap so I expect a bit more in quality. I was coming here more often than Marnee Thai in recent years for the friendly, less pushy service...but back to Marnee's again. I understand an occasional off day but after 3 misses, I will give it a rest before trying again.
author: jane f.

description: Love this place!! So good, used to get take out once a week with my boyfriend and every time I would have friends visit I would bring them here. One of the best local thai places!! Definitely recommend.
author: Kylie M.

description:
I was in the neighborhood and I remembered that the Weakly had just reviewed them so I figured it was worth it to stop in.

I of course got the Pork Neck, and it was totally worthwhile and very tasty. My date got #18 (beef pad ga prao) and she liked it.

The restraunt itself is unfancy but very clean and airy.
The staff is very nice and I guess we talked with the daughter of the owner for a few minutes about the now not-so-secret menu.

Definately coming back here!
author: Tom S.

description:
I'm half lying here on my bed trying to write this review while fighting off Chabaa's coma inducing cuisine. Thanks to my new fat tummy, I can prop my keyboard up against it as I type....zzZZzzz....

So, for my first visit here, I tried the very scrumptious spicy chicken wings. The wings were crispy and the sweet chili, garlic sauce was darn tasty.

I love the menu. It has pictures. I'm a visual guy according to the tests. Mmmm... #36, the Guay Tiew Nua Sub, looks really tantalizing. It's ground beef sautéed with bell peppers, onions and celery, served over flat rice noodles and topped with a fried egg.

My buddies both ended up getting #36 too... and they've been here. Ding ding ding... looks like I picked a winner!!! Yes, the aroma of dish #36 confirmed this as it was placed in front of me.

One bite, two bite... One scoop, two scoop...

Couple minutes later of non-stop shoveling and I was in a happy place. Stomach at maximum capacity.

Now, place keyboard down and sleep...
author: Sam T.

description: Their duck fried rice is fantastic. It's got great flavors and they give good sized portions for the price. The tofu satay was a completely different story. Ive never tried it before and thought it sounded pretty good, but I was totally wrong. The tofu didn't look right when I first saw it, and it tasted absolutely disgusting. It smelled and tasted like burnt plastic, and had the consistency of a fish cake instead of tofu. The price was also ridiculous for the amount of food given(almost 8 bucks for 4 pieces of tofu), and I will never order that again. I took one bite of it and ended up throwing it in the trash because it made me want to vomit. What a waste of money.
author: Sylvina W.

description:
Thai food that hits the spot! Duck fried rice..excellent..Actually I can't think of anything that is not delicious....Have almost ate everything on the menu..couple items left. 

Owner is just sweet like her mango sweet sticky rice
author: Chuck D.

description: Great Thai food in the neighborhood, actually think it's better than Marnee Thai down the street. Friendly service and good food! Great tom ka and pad Thai is what I usually order, but everything else I've tried has been great too!
author: Nicole D.

description: Popped in for take-out because I was in the neighborhood. Ordered roast duck fried rice, pad see yu, and spicy chicken. Oh my goodness. Delicious, especially the fried rice. That's enough to make me go out of my way to order.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Chabaa has a lot going for it, clean place, great staff, and good food. Well at least the dishes i order. For me its the eggplant with brown rice and tofu, pineapple fried rice, or the yellow curry. I always order the same things, that way i know it's gonna be good!


They also delivery, although they won't deliver to my side of the sunset @#! If they did, i would order every other day.
author: Tom N.

description:
i enjoy this place not necessarily because it's the best thai food, but because it's so refreshingly different (assuming you ask for the "secret" thai menu). i find the food to be better executed here than lers ros, and far less crowded. 

fyi, they don't offer the secret menu at their other location.
author: Mark A.

description:
WARNING!!
when you order curry, steamed rice is NOT included in the price, it's an extra- yea,lame

i ordered the yellow curry to go & it was delicious! ...but extra for rice? really? 

anywho, i think their yellow curry is way yummier than King of Thai's, but aleast King of Thai includes the rice -__-
author: Delilah B.

description:
So, this review might actually be for the other location.. I'm not from SF so I'll be damned if I know exactly where I was, but I wrote down the name at least! I was at the new location.. that doesn't have their booze license yet.

So, I was looking for some other thai place that I couldn't find. I asked the concierge at a hotel for a recommendation, and he suggested Chabaa to me. I almost walked by it, because it was a small, tiny hole in the wall. Upon first glance, it looked kind of sketchy, but we were hungry and feeling brave, so in we went.

And man, am I glad we did!

The red curry here was the best I've ever had. It was creamy, it was spicy without killing me, in short, it was amazing. The Phad Thai was also remarkably good, which is saying a bit coming from me, as I usually find it to be horribly boring.

I wish there was a Chabaa in Portland!
author: Katie W.

description: Really great food, but there was a nasty hair in my friend's pad see ew. Fuck that.
author: Michelle A.

description:
duck fried rice, red curry, pad thai, pad see ew, thai iced tea

delicious delicious. great flavor, nice presentation, good proportions. great service and good prices! I AM A FAN & I bring all my friends here! parking can get tough but I don't go anywhere else but Chabaa for some Thai food!
author: Tina N.

description:
Food: 4/5
Decor: 4/5
Price: 5/5
Overall: 4/5

I've dined here a few times and once again last night with my girlfriend and my friend. I don't remember what we got but we got a spicy soup, curry chicken, and curry beef with choy. The curry beef with choy had peanut sauce in it which made it taste amazing with rice! Also, the curry chicken was good because the curry wasn't too thick, it was just perfect with rice. The soup was OK at best. It might be the fact that my throat wasn't feeling the best or maybe spicy soup just isn't my thing. All in all Chabaa is a pretty good restaurant, the decor and all is amazing for a restaurant for its price. One thing that can improve is their beef quality. For some reason it seems like all Thai restaurants beef are hard to chew.
author: Edgar G.

description:
Good Stuff.

My boyfriend wanted to try Chabaa for the longest time. I'm glad we got the chance to try it out!

The Tom Kha was delicious. Also, I really like their green bean dishes. The beans are crunchy and saucey. The best vegetables to ever enter my stomach.

Service is wonderful and fast. They demonstrate Thai hospitality. 

I'm really happy that their restaurant is doing well, they deserve it. I always enjoy my visit.
author: C. T.

description: Cute little place with charming decor. Food is good as is the service. I love their crab fried rice. Sooo good!
author: Fallon P.

description: Food is amazing and the atmosphere is great. They decorate the place so nicely! Food is a good price and it's do delicious! You have to try to the curry!
author: Chanel T.

description:
I was planing to call for delivery and so I called Chabaa. I talked to the girl in Thai (since I'm Thai too) while she was putting me on hold, I overheard the delivery guy told her that he didn't like to delievery to Thai people. He also asked that girl if I was male or female....WTF
Very discriminating agaist your own kind and what the fuck does it matter if I'm a man or a woman. I didn't order them and told them I stayed at my friend's and forgot his address. 
Been there before too and the fried rice sucked ass!
author: Mark L.

description: I tried this place today and it wasn't bad at all..... We ordered tom yum, fried chicken fried rice and roasted duck fried rice. They honestly weren't the bests, but they were pretty good. The fried chicken on my fried rice though was like nasty. It was so soggy and soft, i can't even use my fork for it!!! Tom yum was good, that's probably what i'd recommend!
author: Verdina P.

description:
Delicious and worth every penny! I tried Chabaa for the first time last night based on other Yelp reviews. I got a delivery order and have found my new favorite Thai food. Fast delivery (about 1/2 hour) and the delivery person was really nice. I tried to order online but it did not accept my Inner Richmond district zip code, so I called and there was no problem with delivery. 

I ordered:
1. Spicy Wings - good; nice spices, but not particularly remarkable.
2. Corn Cakes - yummy while warm with the cucumber mixture. Not so great reheated today. Best while fresh.
3. Pad Pra Ram - Creamy and wonderful peanut sauce, fresh steamed spinach, good rice - I will get this again.
4. Panaeng Curry with beef - Heaven!!!!!  One of the best Panaeng curries I have tasted in the city. They add just the right amount of peanut sauce to the flavorful and creamy curry. Sooooooo gooooood......want more now....

I highly recommend this place.
author: Erica G.

description:
Good, well prepared Thai food.  The prices are reasonable, the decorations comfortable, and the staff quick to please.  Overall pretty good.  

-The green curry is excellent, plenty of chicken drowning in the full-bodied sauce.

-Basil chicken is perfectly seasoned and goes well simply over rice.

-The Pai Thai is good as well.  Al dente noodles complemented by peanut sauce and dressed with fresh bean sprouts.  

Everything is pretty consistent here but it's missing the big "wow" factor I normally associate with Thai food.  I'm talking presentation.  There needs to be more color with the dishes using garnishes or other accents.
author: MTBer I.

description:
Came here for the first time with the hubs.  He's getting over a cold and I am just at the beginning the cold I got from him so we really didn't want to venture too far out for food and Chabaa was close by.  It was absolutely delicious!! 

Excellent, attentive service.  Very yummy food.  Their corn cakes are super yummy.  I especially like how the food was very clean, plated nicely, and not hugely proportioned.  The prices are very reasonable and the atmosphere is great too.  They have walls painted in warm colors that are inviting but don't overly distract from the food.  No fancy decorations but definitely more organized and thought out than just thrown together. 

We will definitely be coming here again!!
author: Kayla H.

description: Waitress was sweet, and the prices weren't too steep. I got curry, rice, and a delicious Thai iced tea for about $12.50 at dinner prices. The portions were substantial as well. The green curry was nice and spicy but not overpowering. My friend lives around the corner so I would return if I was in the area.
author: Victoria N.

description:
I like Chabaa, but I like Marnee Thai more.

Change is inevitable but I'm gonna keep that from happening for as long as I can. So, whenever I eat somewhere, I order the same thing I always order. 

Nothing was different for Chabaa, I walk in to a plainly decorated Thai restaurant and was welcomed by the waiter with open arms. They were happy to accommodate our large group with extra tables, extra chairs and half their restaurant space. Chabaa has had a steady increase in prices but its expected. Although, I remember seeing this same price increase a few months ago. Don't get me wrong, the prices are still decent for the portion that you're getting.

I ordered the Pad Kee Mao (flat noodles stir fried with green beans, peppers and basil) with Pork; the dish is supposed to be spicy but it lacked the kick that I was hoping for. The green beans were a bit undercooked, tasted REALLY fresh. I, also, had the Thai Iced Coffee but it lacked any sort of coffee taste, all the coffee taste was masked by the sweet milk. I'm not sure, but I think they were having an off day cause typically they put out really good tasting food, tonight they just kinda... lacked any sort of flavor. 

Highlight of the meal: Little Thai candies they give you with the check. Tamirand, yummm.
author: Maggie H.

description:
Price:  Price is average.  It's around $7-10 per dish/plate.  This is typical pricing for Thai places.  It's definitely not the most expensive, but then again the portions were a bit smaller.

Service:   Warm welcome and helpful when ordering.  Received nothing but smiles and good service.

Taste:   I liked how the food had just the right spiceyness and they give you some extra sauce to add a little more kick.  I like how they also had peanuts to add.  I really liked the Pad Prik Khing (beef - because we didn't try the chicken) and the crab fried rice (which I wanted to order double portion because it didn't feel like it was enough - or it was that good that I wanted more).  I wasn't feeling the Chicken satay... I've definitely had much better.  With what little I've tried, I really liked it.

Atmosphere:  It's a nice little restaurant with it's own authenticity.  It's narrow but built deep.  It's located in somewhat busy street with bunch of Asian markets and restaurants.  Luckily it was a holiday so free parking, but other days may be a bit challenging.

What You'll Remember:  Legit Spiceyness.  Open until 1am.

Comment:  Definitely a place I'd go back to if I'm in the area, but not a place I would drive all the way to the city just to eat again.  I was sweating a bit, but I enjoyed my experience :)  Nothing really bad to say about this place, so check it out.

Cheers,
T-Chung
author: Thomas C.

description:
Yay!  Another late-night eatery in SF!  Open until 1AM, and they're even open REGULAR HOURS during the winter holidays (Xmas eve, Christmas Day, NYE, New Year's Day).  

Good Thai food, although I'd say Thai Time is better.  I found their curries a bit bland and a little too creamy, but the boyfriend loved 'em.  We had the red pumpkin and green veggie curries.  Papaya salad was good, the eggrolls were a teeny bit bland, the prawn rolls were yummy, they have crappy wines on the  Specials menu (that they initially forgot to show me) but it's fine for who they are; kudos for them for at least offering 'em.

I really liked how clean, comforting, and homey it felt, unlike a lot of cheaper late-night restaurants in SF.  The staff was super sweet, too.  Definitely a good place to head to on a cold winter night past bedtime.
author: Coleen B.

description:
There are too many great things about this place for me to elaborate on them.

-affordable dishes! $30 for three dishes and a Thai iced tea, and that's already tip included.
-yummy food, great portions. I love love LOVED the yellow curry and how they don't skim on the coconut milk! That alone ensures that I'll be back here soon.
-options for herbivores. I came with a couple friends who are pescetarian and it was nice to see that their menu said that everything can be substituted with veggies and tofu. Maybe I haven't been paying  attention to other places that do that, but I believe it's the first time I've come across a restaurant that offers these choices.
-friendly service. The waitress tolerated our loudness and brought us more of the candy that we had questions about. Our orders came out promptly too.
-spacious. Unlike Marnee Thai nearby, this place is less dense and you won't find yourself yelling to other people at your table because of the noise level. Unless, you know, you like talking loudly. The tables here are spaced far enough apart so that you don't feel like the table behind you can hear all your sexual innuendos. Yup, I said it.

In a nutshell, great quality Thai food for the price. It's authentic, economically friendly, they're open late, and the parking situation after rush hour in this part of Irving doesn't make me wanna poke my own eyes out.
author: Olivia V.

description:
Just great.

We went here on a Thursday night and there was hardly anyone in this place, but we didn't let that fool us. The service was excellent--the perfect amount of attention and timing without constantly buzzing in your ear. They spoke perfect English, something that's not necessarily good or bad, but interesting for a Thai place around here.

We split the pad thai with a Singha beer each, poured in tall narrow glasses. The pad thai is flavorful, but lacking in spice by itself. We added a little red chili sauce throughout and it brought the dish to life. It was exquisite.

After cleaning up every last noodlet from the serving plate, we finished our beers at a European pace, then ordered sweet sticky rice with mango for dessert. Needless to say, the dessert was also delicious.

Even the little pineapple candy that came with the check was good. I can't find anything to nitpick about with Chabaa. It's a keeper.

Next we'll be trying the pad see eww.
author: Brad F.

description:
We decided to check out this place since we were in the area looking for a place to eat and this place got decent reviews on yelp.  I was looking for something to eat on the healthier side of things and this place hit the spot.  I'm not sure how healthy my dish was (pad prik khing) but mentally it seemed healthy...maybe it's because I ordered it with brown rice opposed to white rice.  I love spicy food so I requested for extra spicy and the server looked at me with a shocked expression as though I wouldn't be able to handle the spice.  Instead she brought us a tray of chilies and peppers and it worked out perfectly.  I added two scoops of the marinated peppers and it sure was spicy.  I was glad that I ordered the thai iced tea since it helped cool my mouth down.

Portion size was just right.  I didn't feel stuffed after finishing my food nor did I feel hungry.  My guess is that it wouldn't be enough if you're a big eater.  Service here is prompt and your food comes out quickly.  I was tempted to try the papaya salad...maybe next time.
author: Serena M.

description: Great food, great service, warm environment, and adorable "straw wrapper" roses...
author: Kimberly P.

description: Great roast duck fried rice and the beef stew noodle soup is great. Service is awesome. Food reminds me exactly of King of Thai! Opens late huge plus....
author: King L.

description:
Having gone to Marnee Thai all these years, decided to try this place out for the first time. 
I ordered the Duck Noodle Soup and it was quite tasty. The soup may have been a little too strong and thick but it tasted good. The duck was tasty as well and the noodles and vegetables were fine. It felt like the amount of noodle was not that much though. The price I felt was a little higher than expected though for the area.
Also tried a stir fried noodle dish with seafood and fishballs and that was good. The amount was plenty and the amount of fishballs, squid, was good but there was only two shrimps.
author: Alex H.

description:
Came here quite a few times since the place i get my hair cut is like down the block. No matter what i order it has never let me down. i tried the curries, the noodles and the fried rice. i still wanna try the rice plates

Curry - I order the yellow curry when i want  onions and potatoes. But when i want something more spicy i get the red curry it also has bamboo shoots.

Pad Thai - its good not too greasy 

Roast Duck Noodle Soup - BF ordered this and loved it the oils of the duck seeps into the soup and makes it yummy
author: Lisa D.

description: This is my favorite Thai food restaurant when I'm craving for some thai ! The interior of the restaurant is nice and clean. The staff is pretty nice , they get you the things you need. The quality of the food is good for the price and the taste is good as well. I really don't have any complains about this place. Another thing that is good about this place is that it closes late and if you need a late night dinner this is the place to go . I've had their roast duck noodle soup, the chicken noodle soup,  and roast duck fried rice.  All of them were delish, except the fried rice was a little greasy. But other than that I like this place very much !
author: Lucy C.

description:
So I just got back from this place, for the 2nd night in a row I've decided to have thai food. So I'm sitting there eating my appetizer and one of the waitress brings out my main course. As I get done with my (appetizer) and just started on my (main course) another waitress/manager* ask me if I was still working on it.....?!? I simply said no, but thought to myself. maybe she was stupid or something because I barely took my 2nd bite and she askes me if I was still working on it....hahaha! it was pretty funny when I think about it. I sorta lost my appetite after she asked me that but I didn't eat anything all night and had just gotten off work so I was starving. I've decided to update my review, 2 stars. BECAUSE, the waitress/manager made me feel very uncomfortable like she wanted me out of the restaurant. The food was just okay this time around. 
food-$18.00
tip-$3.00 

Thanks anyways
author: Thanh K.

description:
I love this place for many many reasons...

1. They take AmEx!!! I get 3% back on restaurants, and this is one of the few places I know that takes AmEx, esp in SF. Let me know if you know more!
2. Roast duck noodle soup - O. M. G. I've had this at pretty much every Thai place I go to, and this place gives you the most noodle and most duck, and it's scrumptious and still just $7, which is the going rate for DNS (duck noodle soup).
3. Thai iced tea - yum yum, refreshing, can't go wrong.
4. Great and fast service.

Can't find anything to complain about, so... 5 stars all the way!
author: Daphne L.

description:
