I adore this place. I found it when the other Thai restaurant down the street was crowded but honestly, the food isn't as good as it use to be over there.. 

I've read some of the other reviews and I can't really confirm or deny any of the complaints. My dining experience has been later in the evenings and I have not yet ordered from their takeout or delivery menu. 

With that being said, I also found the service to be more then adequate if not a little overbearing at times. The wait staff is excellent but like I said, I tend to go during off hours so I can't say what the earlier shift is like.  For me I've had people help me figure out what I'd eaten in the past that was totally yummy but couldn't remember the name of.
The picture menu helps. 
One young lady even showed us how they make the roses out of the straw wrapping when we asked. 

The meal portions are acceptable but not overflowing. 
The menu is the key to this place.  For me, their strong points are their salads, appetizers and their duck. Their soups and noodles are fine and their Thai iced tea is not overly sweet, which I like. 

They stay open until 1AM. Need I say more? 

The only things open later into the evening on a weekday, that I know of, are some yogurt shops, a crepes place, some donut shops and Chabaa.  And Chabaa stays open longer then all of them. 
. 
The space is long and skinny with a mix of modern and traditional decor. The wood gives it a nice warm feeling. Because of the long and skinnyness (is that a word?) of the restaurant, it helps to be assertive when getting the inital attention of the wait staff.
The kitchen is on the other end of the restaurant and it would just be weird to have the staff hanging around the door in such a narrow space but once seated, everything is good. 

In summary: I like this place. I wish they'd do a groupon.
author: lily l.

description:
Ok, so a few things here:

1. They deliver!
2. They are open late 
3. If you are ever in a hurry, don't come here, they have a poor sense of time, and often times forget, to take order in a timely manner.
4. I love drinking hot tea, however its water with a hint of tea, hmmm, not want I really want to drink.
5. The servers seem bored, and move at a snails pace.
6. The food is good, thus 3 stars, so at least try it out when not in a hurry, and don't order the hot tea (water)!
author: Jay K.

description:
Came here just a few hours ago on Christmas Eve (12/24), or more like Christmas Day since we walked in right before they were closing (1 a.m.). Since we came right when they were about to close, we had to order to go. The restaurant looks really nice and clean. I would have a meal here, but it was not meant to be. It looks like a tiny portion type restaurant, so I wouldn't expect a generous portion. I did not visit the bathroom, so I cannot comment on that.

I had a Chicken Pad Thai in the car. I think the aroma is stuck inside my car. I wouldn't know. It was quite the portion. As for the taste, it was above average Pad Thai. I don't know.. the last Pad Thai I had was from King of Thai, so I think a lot of Pad Thais would beat that. The noodles had a nice texture, the tofu tasted good, I would definitely come try it out and sit inside the restaurant. I wouldn't mind ordering to go either.
author: Glen H.

description:
I went back to Chabaa I couple of nights ago because I was craving curry that wasn't Indian food.  

I tried something new Pad Ram(?).  It was just fancy Pad Thai.  My boyfriend got the Green Curry, usually my favorite dish, but didn't order because last time it didn't hold up to others I've had.  Well, I don't know who the cuss was cooking last time compared to this time, because this Green Curry was BOMB!  And he loved my dish...  So we switched plates, and were both completely satisfied.
author: Jaclyn O.

description:
Better than KoT but not as good as MT (I'll let you guys figure out the acronyms there). Haha. But it's very worth the four stars.
Thai Iced Tea tastes pretty consistent, not too sweet or too watered down compared to other places. I actually love ordering their Silver Noodles plate.. 'Cause I've never seen it at other Thai restaurants. I always manage to either get it myself, or get someone with me to get it. lol. Their Tom Yum soup is good too! :) Especially with the flat rice noodles. Yumm.. Now I'm hungry.
author: Susan Y.

description: worst delivery ive ever had. food was late to arrive, the driver didn't speak English and only said "cash in tip" repeatedly it when i told him i didn't want to tip, food was disgusting, ground pork was extremely low quality and everything else tasted like microwaved 99 cent food. don't order from here, spent $33 for extremely low qaulity food that made me and my girlfriend sick.
author: jackson m.

description:
Food is delicious and the service is good too.  This place is great in that it stays open late! 

I've had the Pad Thai and various curries on several occasions and recently tried the Pad Kee Mao. DELICIOUS!

My only complaints are that there weren't enough veggies in the noodles and that there was beef in the chicken dish that we ordered. This wasn't a problem for us but if you are opposed to a certain type of meat, or meat in general for that matter, you better make it clear when you are ordering.
author: Stephanie V.

description: Me and my friend went to this place around 6 or 7, yesterday. My friend ordered pad thai and I ordered #39. We had an appetizer which was very delicious but pricey. We both finally got our food, mine had very little taste, so I asked for soy sauce. My waiter supposedly went to get it. I waited about 5 mins for my soy sauce until I asked again and my waiter forgot about it. There was very little people atm. They had really bad service, the waiter was rude and everytime we asked for something she would reply "ok" following with "what?" afterwards. I couldnt finish my dish, so I took it to go. This morning, I decided to finish my food and as I was digging through it, I found a bug. Never comming back here.
author: Judy C.

description:
Delicious! Came here today for lunch with a friend. We found it randomly after taking a day to walk around golden gate park. We just went down irving and there it was. We were in between this place and Sunrise Deli two doors down. Although i was craving a shawarma my friend was able to sway me to the thai side.

We split the Tom Yum soup. It was spicy and coconutty and amazing. I had the Prad Prik Khing, it was perfectly spicy and the side of rice added a good balance. My friend ordered duck fried rice, and it was really good as well. We wanted to order the calamari salad which looked spectacular but we're both students, so....

The waitresses were nice and attentive, prices normal, and food quality great. Will for sure be coming back, after I visit sunrise deli of course, because i still want my shawarma.
author: Paula I.

description:
SERVICE: Friendly staff, quick service.
AMBIANCE: Causal, a small restaurant but spacious. Never seen it get very busy or loud
PARKING: Difficult during the day but easy during late night
REVIEW:
I love their fried rice dishes ( my fav: fried chicken over rice, thai fried rice, crab fried rice)
I don't like the noodle soups. The noodles always seem to be in clumps and broken into small pieces. They probably precook it and then recook it when ordered causing the noodles to be over cooked and broken. 
Despite this prices are really good for what you get and they open late.
author: Jess H.

description: The food here is super tasty, good prices, friendly service and I love it how they stay open until very late every night! (until 1am I think).  And they have a great selection of different types of rices (jasmine, coconut, brown, etc.), which I appreciate very much!
author: Alondra T.

description:
BBQ pork shoulder. Enough said.

You have to get it with the sticky rice though, it's just not the same with regular jasmine rice.

They are a little expensive (minus one star) but the food made me remember that random street-side cart in Bangkok my uncle took me to when I lived in Thailand for 6 months. I miss paying no more than 2 dollars for good Thai food. 

Once again..GET IT WITH THE STICKY RICE!!
author: Mike A.

description:
came here again! except this time was a pick up order.

spicy chicken wings
duck fried rice
pad see ew

I AM IN LOVE WITH THE CHICKEN WINGS!!!!!!! it was still crispy after i got back and its the perfect mix of salty and sweet. although i wish it was a bit more spicy. nevertheless,  SO GOOD.

duck fried rice: i love the rice. i love the texture of the rice. the duck was good, just wished there was more duck.

pad see ew (w/ beef): pretty awesome as well, nothing over the top. tasted like how pad see ew would taste like.

still lovin this place!
author: Jamie Y.

description: Duck fried rice was supposed to be good, but it was alright, way too oily.  Almost more than necessary it seems like.  I got the pad see ew to compare with Marnee Thai and it wasn't even close.  It was way too salty, I could barely eat it.  There was only one other group there and somehow they messed up both theirs and our order.
author: Thomas N.

description:
Came here a couple of times and even ordered to-go at lunch time during my high school days. Their pad thai is good, fried rice is satisfying, and their desserts are a little bit too sweet. Tried all these items on different occasions. 

The vibe to this restaurant's very calming, spacious, and clean. The waitresses here are patient and friendly. Good choice for a quick bite. The wait here isn't long either.
author: Tina C.

description:
Sunday night called 2 hrs ahead for evening reservations was accepted with no problems.  Parking took a little time, but found something within a couple blocks.
This is a tough review because I was torn between the good, the bad, and the ugly...
     The good was the "secret Thai menu" is translated into English and available seemed more of a word of mouth gimmick.  We chose the BBQ pork back with tamarind sauce was super delicious.  
     The corn cakes are large and a fantastic mix of corn and batter, great appetizer and starter with the Thai Iced Tea with an origami rose was a neat touch.  The Chicken Pad Thai was good, but needed an extra kick, ask for the hot sauce, they will bring a tray of 4 jars of red pepper flakes, garlic chili sauce, vinegar infused with jalapeno, and crushed peanuts.
    Service was good, my friend from out of town was late 30 min, they allowed us to sit at a table without making a big fuss.  Water was refilled without asking.
    The bad was the fish cakes looked like something you get out of the frozen section of Ranch 99, uninspired taste and McDonald's sausage patty texture was just not good for $7 for 4 is a pass.
    The ugly was the Thai beef fried rice looked like a 5 yr old kid made it.  The rice was too wet with the consistency of wet concrete that glued to the spoon when trying to get a serving on the plate. It had maybe 5-6 pieces of thin sliced small pieces of beef, barely any veggies and not worth the $9.
      The bill was under $60 for a table of 4 was a really good deal.  I like really good deals, but the only thing that was memorable was the pork back.  Everything else was just lacking a little in full Thai flavor kick.  I would stand the wait and prices of Marnee Thai, but would come back for the BBQ pork back and maybe try more of the secret menu.
author: David K.

description: In my quest for delicious tom yum noodle soup, Chabaa did not fail. The tom yum soup was very authentic with lots of goodies - shrimp, seafood, and roasted pork. The waitress was also super nice, they even let me use my credit card despite not meeting the minimum.
author: Fawn Q.

description: Went there lunch time12:30 . We were the only ones there. Found a little 4 or 6 legged creature in my combo beef noodle soup. Didn't tell the waitresses because I know I won't be back for a long long time. Felt like vomiting because of the msg afterwards.
author: uncle m.

description: The curry dishes and fried rice plates are all pretty good!
author: Mark C.

description:
The restaurant itself is really cute. The decor and atmosphere of the place is delightful. The food wasn't the best I've had. But then again, I'm from SoCal. I tried the Pad Thai chicken and it had weird aftertaste. My friends ordered the pad se eww (which was delicious, perfect blend of sauces, spices, and noodles), the curry (which he said was really spicy, but good), and the fried chicken with rice. That was very tasty.

Overall, it wasn't a bad place.
author: Krissa M.

description:
Came to Irving for Japanese and ended up across the street cause the company wanted Thai instead.  I only ordered the Chicken Pad Thai, which was good, but not sure how great a judge of Thai food I am =/

Good enough for me and the company enjoyed the food as well.  Prices are fair and customer service is accommodating.  The waitress "misunderstood" which salad we wanted but when it was brought she brought it back to retrieve the one we ordered.  Didn't like that they brought it after our main dishes though.  I don't know...just a preference to have my appetizers on the table BEFORE my main meal.

Not spectacular but not bad either...another good Thai place! =)
author: Ninja H.

description:
Open really late! decent prices! lots of choices...

the duck fried rice is a must have. the best fried rice hands down .
author: krystina ann r.

description:
I thought this place was really good. First of all, it's really clean in there and I love that!

Chicken Satay was so good, and the chicken was so tender it just fell off of the skewer. Peanut Sauce was yum! (as anything with peanut butter always is. My grandmother liked her soup, but I'm not exactly sure what she got. The Pad Thai was great! Also a plus that they are open late (I think until 1am)

YUM YUM!!!
author: Courtney M.

description:
Nice.  Very nice.  Cosy.  Not intimidating when traveling and eating by yourself.  Great menu for those who may not be real familiar with eating (and ordering) thai food.  Very reasonable prices.  Tasty food. 

I had the red curry (my fav) with chicken.  Very nice helping of steamed rice.  More food than I could eat and very good.  Also got the spring rolls.  Nice but barely above average.
author: Andrea P.

description: The food is so legit here. The pad thai and the thai-styled fried rice has so much flavor, but does not overdo it. The perfect balance between sweet and sour and moisture, without being dry at all. The place is pretty nice too, it's well-lit and they have little decorations for Halloween (a lighted pirate and some miniature pumpkins on the side). The waitress was really patient, kind, and soft-spoken. She wasn't super helpful when I asked what dish she would recommend, but she was still sweet. They also give cherry-flavored candies at the end!
author: Vicki L.

description: Good for a late night dinner. Loved the duck fried rice and the tom yum soup!!
author: Christina T.

description: This place is so good, I've been ordering here through eat24 for years. I always get the pork larb, chicken pad see ew (sp?), and duck fried rice. The duck fried rice is definitely my favorite. Can't get it better anywhere else. Delivery is always on time and the drivers are nice.
author: Melissa C.

description: Got the Tom Ka Shrimp Coconut Soup. They pour the soup for you when the soup arrives at the table, so the service is good. Usually Thai places I go to doesn't do that. Got the pineapple fried rice, which was a big plate. Shrimps included in it. I liked it! Yellow Chicken Curry also that comes with either brown or white rice. Got the white rice..but let me tell you, in the curry, the potatoes are so good! Its soft inside and crunchy-ish on the outside!! I think I enjoyed the potatoes the most! Haha. Anyway, Thai Iced Tea ($2) had a strong tea flavor and that I like a lot. They turned the covering of the straw into a rose when they serve the Thai tea. To me that's unique idea. The total bill was $32.50.
author: Vivian L.

description:
This place is great for both grabbing delicious to-go meal, or sitting down for family style feast.  If you know what you want before you even pick up the phone, you'll respect their dishes.  I, for one, greatly appreciate their picture menu, because I can just scope out what I'm in the mood for.

The taste, the presentation, the portions, and the service warrant my 5 star rating-- but each individual dish warrant a review.

Try Pad Si-Yu, Roast Duck Fried Rice, Raad Na (pork), and Chicken Satay.

And if you'd like to jump in and pick up something to go it took about 10 minutes and it was packed to the brim with Thai tastiness.

Check this place out.
author: L J.

description:
Friendly
Great food
nice ambiance

Ask for V or O ...........they are the best. 
Curry duck
mince pork with basil over egg
pad thai( for some reason I always order pad thai at thai restaurants and california rolls at japanese restaurant)
pad se ew(sorta like a chow fun with beef in a wet sauce)

They open late on the weekends and the girls are very sweet..........not in taste but as in kind..........you know what I mean.  Tell them I sent you
author: jason g.

description: Too many noodles not enough other stuff. Not that I wanted any more of the very bitter Chinese broccoli of the non-descript chicken. At least the bathrooms were clean and the service pretty good. This place proves that not all food in hole-in-the-walls are worth putting into the hole in your face.
author: Alexander J.

description:
I wish I had eaten AT Chabaa more then once.  I did enjoy having them deliver food so I'm not complaining about that :)

I loved the setting of Chabaa.  The interior colors and dark food tables really made the place feel warm.  We had great service and got to sit right by the window cove which made it very private, separated from the rest of the restaurant.

They have good food and they are open late so definitely take advantage.
author: Crystal R.

description:
I will start by saying the flavor of my food was really amazing... but... for 25 dollars? not so much

I ordered roti, which was amazing, only it cost FOUR DOLLARS for a piece!!! I mean, it's basically a flattened doughnut.. which i can do myself for what? 80 cents? 

My yellow curry was amazing and creamy, the only thing lacking was the shrimp that i payed a dollar extra for. In it's place? chicken. I am glad i got some meat rather then none, but come on!!! Get my order right! i did it online so it wasn't like there could have been a miscommunication or anything!

Boyfriend get Pad Si-Yu which was also very good. He got shrimp as well, costing a dollar extra. how many did he get? 4. 4 shrimp for a dollar. I mean it's better then my record of no shrimp for a dollar really now? 

I honestly probably would go back to this place because my yellow curry was amazing and i'm pretty sure my non-Thai-food-loving-boyfriend also enjoyed his food. Just don't order shrimp.

READ ME? DON'T ORDER SHRIMP!!
author: A. H.

description:
New Review:
I really liked this place until my experience this Saturday. It is usually a good place for a late night meal. My friend had noodle soup, and when it was almost finish she found this caterpillar looking bug swimming in her soup. It was not small, it was like half a inch big. DISGUSTING! We flagged the waitress over. She had the balls to tell us, 1st words out of her mouth was, "It is a bug commonly found in vegetable. You know there is no harm to the bug. It will not make you sick" Of course we know it is a bug, but it has no place in our food. What infuriated me the most was her condescending tone, as if we put the bug in ourselves to get a free meal. After going back and forth with my friend, she grabs the bug with the napkin, says she will void ONLY that item, and walks off in a huff. What happened to service? 

Old Review Posted 3/15/2007: 
Good food, great service,  what else more can I say.
author: Erica B.

description:
From the makers of King of Thai comes . . . Chabaa!  Dun dun dun! If you're stoked for mediocre Thai food you've come to the right place.  But if you've come for something that tastes a different from King of Thai, then you're at the wrong place!  It really doesn't taste much different.

I came here with a couple of friends tonight.  Between us we had pad kee mao, roast duck noodle soup and tom yum soup.  Generally speaking, pad keep mao is one of my favorite thai dishes.  Inauthentic, yes, but tasty nonetheless.  Except for tonight.  The green beans were a little off and some of the noodles were actually cold, most likely precooked, set aside, and rehashed.

But along with a lot of places on Irving Street, it's often hit or miss and maybe I arrived at Chabaa on a bad night.  But with so many other places to try, I doubt I'll be returning soon.
author: Tony L.

description:
Since I moved into the Outer Sunset a few months ago, I have been a frequent diner at Marnee Thai, and have found little reason to explore thai options beyond that fabulous establishment. When I found the place PACKED last Friday night, however, I decided that I was too hungry to wait, and thus, convinced my date to take a risk on Chabaa Thai.

All I can say is: What a pleasant surprise!

To my tastes, the food was just as good as Marnee's (we tried the pad see-u and the masaman curry), but the service was far superior. While I have frequently found the waitstaff at Marnee to be  rather  rude (I hate  feeling pressured to order the most expensive items!),  the servers at Chabaa were warm and friendly. And while Marnee often tries to rush me out the door, Chabaa didn't seem to mind our lingering for almost 2 hours over our 1 course meal!

My only complaint is that our waitress had absolutely ZERO knowledge of the wine they serve. Being a wino and having noticed wine glasses on several tables, I was suprised to find out that the restaurant not only had no wine list, but had also failed to educate its waitstaff in the difference between whites and reds. Amusingly, once the information was retrieved, Chabaa turned out to have a pretty decent selection of standard labels (BV, Kendall JAckson, Ecco Domini, etc)., and the chianti we ordered did pair quite nicely with the masaman curry :)
 
Overall, however, my experience at Chabaa was quite enjoyable. And given that most people do not like wine with Thai food, I think I can forgive their ignorance in that area.
author: Leslie F.

description: Love this place; it's the only place open late close by and everything is quick and good. Soups are really nice, as is the chicken satay and veggie stir fries; ingredients always fresh and never overcooked. Sometimes soy sauce marinades are a little on the salty side, but overall a great, quality and cheap place to eat.
author: Liz R.

description:
Prices are around $9 and up. Portion size is decent for one person- not too much, not too little.  We went around mid-afternoon, it was not that busy so the service was very attentive and accommodating.

My group of five ordered three plates and one bowl of soup and shared. You can, of course, ask for more bowls and plates.
-Pad Thai with Chicken
-2 other stir-fried noodle dishes
-Tom Yum Soup

Everyone at my table liked the pad thai and you can't go wrong with stir-fried noodle dishes at decent Thai restaurants like this one. The Tom Yum soup does taste like the soup base of the silver shrimp MaMa packages, but more sour, which was too much for my liking but I heard this is how the soup usually is.

So overall the food was good, we could have even disregarded the soup and eaten 3 dishes among all five of us and we all would have left satisfied. This place can be cheap if you eat family-style, but if not, you'll be paying about $10-$11 depending on how much you tip (with no drink).
author: Alice C.

description:
Previously I would only come here when because Marnee Thai down the block was too packed. The last time I came a week ago, I realized I actually really like this place!! The food quality is great. This time I ordered Tom Yum noodle soup and my husband got a beef noodle soup. Both were deeelicious. I'm actually craving the Tom yum noodle soup right now. 

Not to turn this into a Marnee bashing post... but the service here is SO much better than the services at Marnee thai. The waitresses are always super friendly unlike Marnee with the rude older lady.
author: S H.

description: I've been here once and i live 45 minutes away, but i'm still tryna be a regular here. I'll just swoop up a friend on the way then eat my heart out in Thai food heaven. This place if worth a first, second, and third try.
author: Patrick A.

description:
Tuesday. 11:35PM.

Friendly service, late into the evening. 

I was sick this week so I needed soup, pronto! 

Munched:
1. Veggie soup with steamed chowfun noodles
     + Not oily, perfect for a sore throat
     + Tofu and mushrooms are a nice mix

Final Call:
Late night grub beckons toward Chabaa!
author: Chuck N.

description:
...Just your average Thai.  

The menu is filled with pictures, but not all dishes are represented in photo.  Their tea cups should be replaced, as they end up too hot to hold when it's filled with tea.  Inside, a high ceiling makes the restaurant seem airy and less cramped.  A wooden bench lines a wall as seating--different, but it reminds one of a pew.  

The kicker is that they're open late, past 10 p.m., even on weeknights.  But there's so much better and unique Thai joints in this city to even consider a trek out to the Sunset for what you can get at a King of Thai chain (psst...they're open late, too).
author: Marsha Z.

description: I came here with a couple friends, the interior was decorated very beautifully. The place was packed so we waited about 5 minutes to get seated. I ordered the Roast Duck Fried Rice, it did not look like the picture. They chopped up little pieces of duck and threw it in, not enough. The service was slow and in the middle of our dinner they decide to leave the door open so it was very cold while we were eating. The food wasn't bad, but I had higher expectations.
author: Dara S.

description: Yum! This place is great!!! I live in the neighborhood and after hearing people rave about Marnee my boyfriend and I checked it out a few times, each time trying different things. We were not impressed... So, we went to Chabaa and that's what I'm talkin' about! The food is great and the service is awesome! This is our go-to Thai place without fail. Everything we've tried (and we've pretty much tried everything) is awesome! Can't wait for my next curry dinner!
author: Chloe B.

description:
Yum, Yum, Yum. I had an amazing curry here last night. It was just the right amount of spicy and full of veggies and tofu..........
I was a little disappointed that there were no spring rolls on the menu (my favorite), for appetizers but the curry and an order of pad thai had was enough to stuff myself silly. My goodness service was fast and super attentive. I'd stop by again in a heart beat! 
The fact that parking was a cinch was an added bonus!
author: Hilda Z.

description: Went to go pick up an order to go. When I arrived to go pay for my order, I offered my card to pay. Keep in mind this place accepts card. She instantly says do you have cash? I'm said no sorry, just card. She gave me the stinkest attitude and said "ugh, next time okay?" can't really expect to run a business while at the same time be cheap about card transactions.
author: Lawrence N.

description:
A bad craving for Thai needed to be fulfilled, and I didn't want to venture too far from where I was. And of course I looked to yelp for some help. Seeing that this place got great reviews, I took off for my adventure. This adventure was successful in fulfilling my hunger state, and I don't mind returning for my fill of Thai food. 

The food was pretty good, and the portions and prices are well worth it. For roughly $7-8 a plate, you get a nice warm cuddly plate of savory and spicy food. I tried out the Duck fried rice, Beef with string beans, and yellow chicken curry. All full of flavor, and the right touch of spiciness! Quite fulfilling for two! The complimentary tea was excellent as well. 

The food was great, but the service made it even better. The minute we walked in we were greeted and seated right away. The waitresses were very nice, and made sure we were happy. It's not a huge restaurant, but still enough seating for small parties. Quite enjoyable, plus we got a little distracted to the movie playing on the tv :) 

Chabaa made it a great relaxing Saturday evening dinner. I will definitely be happily distracted again to this pleasing lime green awning to enjoy some great Thai food!
author: Catherine O.

description:
I come here periodically. Their noodle soups are delicious--always tasty and consistent. Sometimes they put tooooo many noodles, so just ask for less if you want more soup. Tom Yum Noodle Soup is the best. 

Their stir fried noodles can be a little inconsistent. Sometimes dry, sometimes perfect. It depends on the night. 

Papaya salad is really yum. Good tart kick to it, and their level of spice is pretty consistent. Some other restaurants serve papaya salad with no spice one day and then five alarms the next day. 

Curries...are okay, not the most flavourful, but always consistent. I always have leftovers from this restaurant! Good service even with my crazy requests and reasonable food prices. Not sure about their drink prices because I never order drinks here.
author: Ato Z.

description:
I never quite understood the hype over Marni Thai. Chabaa in my opinion is far  more tastier. I love their larp and papaya salad for my "lighter" days. Heavier days, I go for the duck fried rice, green chicken curry, and the ice cream pancake .....thing.

The service is great and  personable.
author: Cin H.

description:
I'm not an adventurous Thai eater. But they totally worked with me and my preferences and even explained to me what certain ingredients were when I ordered. It was ready in a matter of minutes. I wished there was brocolli in the Pad-Ke-Mow, but it was still great. 

Definitely recommend.
author: Megan S.

description: Came here looking for Thai food because I didn't want to wait at Marnee Thai. It was a GREAT idea to come to this place! The food is amazing and the portions are excellent! I personally think Chabaa is better than Marnee because the portions and flavors of the food! Also the prices are about $2-$3 cheaper than Marnee and the service is a lot better as well!
author: nabil s.

description:
Thai food that isn't as good as Marnee Thai in the Inner Sunset, but better than the Marnee Thai in the Outer Sunset. 

Skip the appetizer combo, it consists of a lot of bland fried food. The green curry here was really good (and spicy). The noodle dish's were cooked well, but had minuscule amount of meat and veggies.

Dish's aren't super original, but they are good at making standard Thai food that tastes relatively fresh. I'm looking forward to going back and trying their fresh spring rolls, they looked awesome!

Wish I could give them a 1/2 star because they deliver, but I can't so I won't (gosh I'm mean).
author: rachel c.

description:
What in the hell (or insert your choice of a Gordon Ramsay insult)? How in the name of all that is good does this place average 4 stars? 

First off, this place is cold as hell.  No one notices this? It's about as cold inside as it is outside, and this is in the middle of the sunset on a winter evening. 

The waiters and service were average. Some simple requests were apparently challenging for these guys. We asked for straws for our glasses of water since the cups were questionable in cleanliness. Our server came back with one. We asked for a couple more. Twice...

Now on to the food. This is a real doozy. The name of the restaurant itself is  Chabaa "Thai" Cuisine. Nothing the three of us at our table ordered remotely resembled Thai food. I eat Thai food on occasion but often enough to distinguish, authentic Thai and good Thai. This was neither. One order at our table was Tom Yam soup. It is supposed to be spicy, fragrant with hints of seafood tastes. What we got was a red-looking beef broth with soup noodles. Not going to be overly critical here, but isn't that Pho? You know, Vietnamese cuisine? Next at our table was an order of Pad Kee Mao. It is a basil-laden, spicy stir fry of flat rice noodles with a combination of many unique spices to the country of Thailand. My friend commented that it was rather bland, not so spicy and boring. It reminded him of Chow Fun. That's Chinese... I had the Pad Thai. One simple question I will pose to offer as evidence of my claims: where were the peanuts? Pad Thai is a peanut-sauce based dish. There were no crushed peanuts, no peanut oil, no peanut sauce in general. Disappointing. 

As a restaurant, it's fine, deserving of 3 stars even. As a "Thai" establishment? 1 star. Thai, my ass.
author: Larry Y.

description: I like this place because they open late and the servers there are really nice.  I always order the tom yum soup and duck fried rice.  I'd say the soup is a little lacking because they don't put much ingredients in there, but the duck fried rice is delicious!  There's a lot of flavor and the pieces of duck are big!
author: Melissa T.

description:
Chabaa is a nice family run Thai place in the middle of the Chinese area on Irving.

On average the dishes are around 7$ each. Free rice at lunch time but you have to pay for white or brown rice with dinner.

The food tastes great but I suspect some Vietnamese influence. No complaints on flavor or portion size. Plenty of hot tea though I did have to ask for refills (not a big deal).

They happen to be right across the street from the new Quickly which open in the old Double Rainbow location. Currently quickly has 59 cent specials.
author: Brando Calrissian ..

description:
My companion and I decided to walk here yesterday after a cold, drizzly day in the Sunset.  We were seated immediately (though the restaurant was busy on a Friday night, and parties larger than two might have to wait for a table).  We ordered two Singhas (~$4 each) and an appetizer of fried tofu ($6).  The waitress was friendly and prompt; our appetizer arrived shortly after she brought our beers.  The fried tofu was a large portion and tasted great with its accompanying sweet peanut sauce, but the sauce had to be rationed to leave enough for each piece.  We couldn't finish the entire appetizer; unless you go with a larger group, you might want to stay away.  It tastes fairly awful when reheated the next day, and overall is less sweet and tender than the fried tofu in their other dishes.

For entrees, we ordered Chicken Panaeng Curry ($7.70, rice costs extra during dinner) and Prawn Pad Thai ($8.50).  The portions were massive, filling, warm, and delicious.  They also arrived quickly, especially for a Friday night.  There was plenty of moist chicken in the Panaeng Curry, and my companion and I cleaned our plates.  The Pad Thai, which had a somewhat small quantity of prawns, was so huge (and we were so stuffed with curry) that we had to package most of it for the next day.  It was still delicious when reheated, unlike the fried tofu.  We will certainly return, especially on chilly, damp evenings.
author: Kate T.

description:
I ordered take out and the Pad Thai was without doubt the worst I have ever eaten.. I still felt ill the next day after eating a few spoons of it.

The restaurant looked busy so I hope for the sake of everyone sitting inside the food was better when you eat in.....
author: Alex P.

description:
Nestled in among the businesses between 22nd and 23rd Avenues, Chabba's entire aura is warm and hospitable.  The decor is fresh and stylish with excellent attention to details.

The food is simply delicious and the same attention to details really shows.  We started off with a Thai beer, corn cakes and fresh cucumber salad, which were simple divine. The main course was a delightfully tasty pumpkin curry dish with prawns, basil and coconut milk.  For dessert, we sampled the "Sticky sweet rice with mango" ...that my friends was  just impossibly good!!! Overall, great food and  superb ambiance. 5 stars homestyle!!
author: I. O.

description:
I'm upping this place a star because while looking for some Chinese take out late at night and failing, we found Chabaa to be still open -- open til 1am in fact.

And the food was really good! Better than I remembered!
author: Susan Y.

description: I wanted to try a new place that delivered so I decided to try Chaaba. Boy was it the best decision I made that day! It blows a lot of takeout and delivery places out of the water especially in the thai department. The prices are reasonable and the portions are BIG!! They are open late which my friend who is a chef told me about it too. The service is great and the delivery was pretty fast! I am definitely going to be only ordering delivery thai from them since Marnee doesn't deliver.
author: Nadia N.

description:
Let me first say that I don't know what "authentic" Thai food is.  I've never been to Thailand and I am sure that, like many other ethnic cooking, it really is all subjective since tastes, etc. often vary from region to region.

That said, I just want to say how much I love this place!  Clean, well-lit place.  Pleasant wait-staff, good prices, menus with pictures!  And they stay open late!
author: Leslie W.

description: The price point for the food here is well worth it's variety of Thai food that you wont see on all that restaurant menus.
author: Jimmy M.

description:
This place. Its low grade. Take the time and extra buck or two to go Marnee a block away. I'm giving it two stars because I'm a nice guy. I ordered a simple dish: pad see ew. It comes with broccoli. That's why I ordered it. I was thinking to myself: "I'm going to eat some vegetables here, along with my noodles". Except that the amount of (Chinese) broccoli they put in the dish would have been appropriate only as a garnish. If I hadn't had it much better every other time I've ordered it elsewhere I wouldn't complain. Aside from the lack of green the noodles were mediocre and I wouldn't eat em unless I was really hungry, but that's not the hat I wear when I'm critiquing food.  

The clincher was the girl's attitude when I called in disappointed and hoping for some explanation (I ordered take out and picked it up). Solidly rude, she was. As a business owner I know that a smart manager/host person should at least be polite, and really they should offer to redo the dish for free. I actually wouldn't have taken them up on it but the gesture might have kept me as a customer. 
Last trip for me.
author: Josef S.

description:
I just tried this place out for the first time. One star for generously delivering to me when I was outside their normal delivery zone (although on second thought I would have had a better night if they'd said no and I'd called somewhere else) and one star for food that was edible and didn't make make me sick or anything.

That said, I am truly flummoxed by all the positive reviews here. Maybe the food is different if you eat it there? I tried three different dishes, and they ranged from okay to nasty.

The fresh spring rolls were wrapped in some kind of unusual wrapper, not the rice paper wrapper I am used to. This wrapper was thick, stiff, and dry, and each roll had a line of mustard on top, which to me really clashed with the dish. Perhaps this is a regional variation of the delicious fresh spring rolls I'm used to, but even the mustard couldn't save these from deathly blandness.  The vegetarian yellow curry was fine. The predominant flavors there were sweet and ginger, never a bad combo. The vegetarian Pad See Ew was revolting. Overly salty, heavy sauce with no complexity to it at all. Not too greasy, which is always helpful for this dish, but just entirely dull and kind of lumpish. I ended up throwing most of it away - there was just nothing appealing about it that might entice me to consume it.

There's so much Thai delivery out there these days that I've been researching, trying to find one that really delights, but I think I may stick to the already known solid-3-star places for a while, not wanting to risk another disappointment like this one.
author: Scrumptious S.

description: Pretty good Thai food. I mostly come here when it's late at night and everything's closed except for fast food places. I went here once when I was vegan and the kitchen was accommodating which is a definite plus. I guess my main thing is that the prices are a little higher than other Thai places. Still the food is decent and the wait staff is nice.
author: Angelina G.

description:
Stumbled in here by accident because me and some friends were planning to go to Marnee Thai but we couldn't find it. (Marnee Thai was a block away when I went back on yelp to check the address after lunch.)

Anyways this place was not a disappointment and I was kind of glad we stepped in this restaurant. Parking was easy since it was a Sunday and for all my San Franciscans know what that means....FREE METER PARKING!
 
The place was kind of small but cute. The waiters were really nice and patient since our table took a pretty long time to decide what to order. More because they have a lot of the items on the menu with pictures. I'm the type of person that reads the description of the entree that I'm about to order but doesn't look like how I picture in my head then the menu should be helpful. I had the Pad see ew(sp?) and that was pretty darn good. It didn't have a lot of oil in the food and for $6.95 it was a pretty decent portion. The waitress always came by to make sure our water cup wasn't half empty so we had plenty of water to last for a lifetime ha just kidding but it was really sweet of her to check back on us.
author: Tracy A.

description:
thank you for being open late night and serving the good stuff!
not sure why a "secret" menu is necessary, but glad to have tried it, since the normal menu is mundane when you have lers ros, sai jai, as well as LA eats at sapp, ord, and pa ord, etc.
too bad the new sf tenderloin outpost isn't equipped to make all the same stuff
the pork shoulder was very good ("pork neck")
get the grilled bbq version, just like sai jai's pork shoulder fried rice but a different sauce.  flavor is excellent, meat so soft, but grilled so nicely
also tried the gaeng som cha om, which was very interesting...never had a thai dish like that before
was tangy and yet right amount of spicy all at the same time
breaded fish, omelette cubes, veggies, mixed in a pungent, tomato, tamarind sauce.  kinda unique but not something i would crave
author: Rob C.

description:
This is the best Thai restaurant in the city! I seriously eat here couple of times a week before work starts. I been eating here ever since it first opened. The staff is extremely friendly. Since I eat here so often, they always know my usual dishes. 

One good thing is this place opens till 1am, which is good so whenever I get hungry late at night, I get to eat yummy Thai food!

I recommend green curry chicken, pad gra pow ( with beef), and vegetarian tum yum soup

Also, their tea is REALLY good! i love drinking it on cold days, which is almost everyday in san francisco.
author: Willa L.

description:
Why does this place get such good reviews? We got take-out and I couldn't eat it--I had leftovers instead.

Tom Yum soup: tastes like a stock cube. I can make better myself. Shrimp were not fresh and overcooked, too hard and rubbery.

Red Curry with Duck: I love duck, but this one had a bizarre aftertaste that was very disagreeable. The pineapple was also funky; I've never had pineapple that tasted like rotting butter! Also the curry sauce was nothing but sugar. Absolutely no flavour.

(For the record, my wife did like her pad thai.)
author: Aaron G.

description: I go to Chabaa quite often. The food is always very good and the service is fast. The servers are always very friendly and helpful.
author: Robert C.

description:
With Marnee right up the street it is really hard to give Chabaa 5 stars.

The food is always tops.  Pad Thai needs a bit more flavor...  I usually get the duck noodle soup for my late-night snack attack.  Being open until 1Am means I don't have to drive to Clement for King of Thai and deal with the idiots that yap yap yap about nothing.  

Great neighborhood spot!  

Some of the Best Pecan Pie ever!
author: Scott S.

description:
This place is a real gem among Thai restaurants. 
We've had a variety of dishes here, and all have been nothing short of excellent. Both of the soups listed in the vegetarian section [one mild and coconut milk-based (Tom Gah?), one clear and sour (Tom Yum?)] are highly recommended. My favorite entree has been the crispy fried noodles in what they list as "Thai gravy sauce," topped with veggies. My husband also loves the Pad See Ew with no egg. Super!

They're open late, the staff is attentive, and the prices are very reasonable.
author: Ramon E.

description:
I have NEVER had anything at this place that didn't taste AMAZING and leave my tummy feeling like a rainbow-riding unicorn named Satisfaction was escorting my belly to wherever Good tummys go when they die happy and are exalted upon high.

That confusing statement being said... try the Cashew Chicken.  Muy bueno, mi amigo.

Also, the Hoi-Jor appetizer - Fried bean curd paper stuffed with ground shrimp, pork, crab meat and water chestnuts. Served with a side of sweet plum sauce.

If you don't like that shizz, you be hopeless, nagga.
author: Blake C.

description:
Chabaa is awesome because it's the only joint pretty much opened til 2am or later on irving! the food is authentic and the service is great! After a late night date, we`ll head to chabaa for it's Tom Kha Gai soup made with a spicy Thai coconut soup with chicken and a pumpkin curry with beef & rice for entre. 

p.s. they take card, unlike KING OF THAI!!
author: Fat C.

description:
If I'm going for Thai, it'd be this place.

Pad Thai - Awesome.
Chicken Wings - Prett-tay good.
Red Curry - This + brown rice = crack.

Price: Relatively cheap, especially if you're comparing to Marnee Thai.
Employees are always friendly and attentive...Can't go wrong coming here.
author: Kenneth L.

description: Ugh. I came here with a few friends who recommended this place. I ordered chicken with green beans and bell peppers with rice. First off the waitress forgot one of our orders so she had to come back and ask us again what we wanted. The service is pretty quick which was a plus. The food was pretty disgusting to me - the green beans were rubbery and undercooked, the chicken was dry, and the sauce was rather bland. So basically all that was considered good was the rice and bell peppers. The portion for that specific dish was rather small compared to what my other friends got (pad thai & beef noodle soup) so I was left unsatisfied. My friends were not full from their meals either so we went across the street and got some popcorn chicken from an undisclosed tapioca dessert shop.
author: Ryan L.

description: Had dinner here. I forgot the exact dish I ordered, but it came with chicken and I asked for brown rice. Tasted good for me. I'm used to all those thai joints downtown and it's not like this over there. Their green tea ice cream with fried banana was pretty good too. Was well woth my money.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Among the 3 things that I ate here - only the meat roll appetizer was worth our time. The green curry was salvaged only cos its spicy kick was sufficient for me but taste wise rather bland and it tasted too sweet. I just dislike it when restaurants throw the balance off their savory dishes with too much sugar and same goes for the tom yam soup. Service-wise, it was attentive and staff were friendly but I rather be somewhere else....and I hear Marnee Thai calling my name...
author: Topazskye L.

description: Was craving some Thai for dinner so I searched for some Thai restaurants nearby and I found this place. The Pad Thai was sooo delish!! Craving satisfied.
author: Victoria D.

description:
I think this place is slightly better than King of Thai.  My old favorite used to be Marnee Thai but I was there recently and I feel like most of their stuff just aren't up to par anymore.  Either they are slacking or their main chef left.  So i decided to give Chabaa a try.  

I feel like their food is really solid and the prices fine.  Gave an extra star for the service.  They were real attentive and the food came fast, but hot!  
I will def. be bck.
author: AhLin C.

description: When you're hungry, it suffices, but we have definitely had better (for delivery). The best dish was the Pad See Ew. Delivery took as long as they quoted.
author: Cara K.

description:
Chabaa is a great restaurant to check out! The atmosphere is very mellow and the waiters/waitresses are very friendly. The food is excellent and not too oily. They will customize your food if you ask for it. (e.g. I order items without MSG) 

Chabaa FTW!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
My boyfriend and I love this place; we eat here a couple of times a month!!!  Every dish we've had, dine in or delivery, has been DA BOMB.  There are so many little personal things they do to make you feel at home.. i.e. free Jasmine tea when dining-in, the owner coming by the table to say hello...  The only "negative" thing I have to say is that their delivery service does not start until AFTER 5pm.  The prices are great compared to most Thai restaurants in The City -- I can't tell you how much I've over-paid for bad Thai food in the past, my tummy and wallet thank Chabaa very much! :)
***UPDATE*** they deliver after 5pm
author: Jess R.

description: This is the first time we tried this Thai restaurant and it was very disappointing. We  had the cashew chicken and it was horrible. They say sautéed sliced chicken but it was breaded chicken. Actually the chicken was so tough it tasted like cartilage. I was shocked it was breaded. It was like they ran out of chicken so they decided to fool us with breaded bread. Never going to eat here again. I've been to many Thai restaurants and this was the worst. Pad Thai noodles tasted like yesterday's noodles. Chicken Tom Ka was weak. Chicken was very chewy and broth was too light. Overall meal was horrible.
author: Cheryl G.

description:
I am soo into Thai food that I'm planning on getting a Thai wife just to cook for me. Maybe she can cook as good as the cooks at Chabaa (but lets hope they're not Mexicans) I got the green curry, pad thai, and thai iced tea. Green curry - oh so tasty "A-roy"
Pad Thai - great, but not the best I had. B+. Thai iced tea - you can't really mess up this drink. so B+
I'll come back here to get me Thai fix on!!
Saaa Waat Deee!!!
author: Matt V.

description: A nice Thai restaurant in the sunset that is surrounded by many other Thai food establishments.  Most around are average at best but Chabba I rank slightly above. Food is tasty and I score a 4 for dish presentation as well. Staff is extremely courteous and friendly. Portions were very generous in comparison to other Thai restaurants. Corn cakes are a must as well as the Pad Thai. Great place for late night eating too as there aren't many options to choose from in this area.
author: Jude A.

description:
parking during the day is off and on.  basically, if you see parking take it, and walk over.

i've been wanting to try a thai place for the last year but can't seem to make the time.  so while looking at the yelp listings, i found this place. Chabaa Thai Cuisine.  Good thing.  I like this place a lot.

Right in the middle of the block.  They serve all the different kinds of thai food that you could want.  I like that they like to use some chinese ingredients like chinese sausage in their BBQ Pork Friend Rice.

I decided to try their paenang chicken curry.  I was told it was medium spicy.  Now, most people go with SPICY as, HOT.  Or HOT HOT HOT.  You know what i mean.  Well, this spicy is that amount of FLAVOR.  I LOVE THAT.  When the flavor is incredible you want spicy.  You want it medium Spicy, this place doesn't burn your tongue.  So if you consider spicy as Hot, then you aren't looking for this.

I like the prices too.  Its actualy cheaper than most of the Thai Places i've been to.

THE BEST THING?  One of the girls is very helpful and speaks really good english.  Not complaining about anyone...i'm just saying that if you have a LOT OF questions...then hopefully this one girl is taking your order, because she can cover it for you.
author: Bing D.

description:
If I could, I would give this restaurant 3 1/2 stars. =P Why? They used to be cheaper when they just started and now the prices seem too much. Even though it's just 50 cents more to each dish, when you add it up to certain dishes it's too expensive. An example would be the appetizer Prawn in a Blanket, which costs more than $7 for six fried shrimps and some sauce.  That's more than a buck a piece!! It tastes great but $1.25 for a shrimp?? Plus if you compare the prices of appetizers to main entrees, they're pretty much the same prices.  I mean, aren't appetizers supposed to be cheaper??

I have to admit their food tastes great but with the prices they offer, I think I rather go to Marnee Thai.  Actually, let me rethink that since their dishes are a little smaller. =P  Anyways, I wouldn't come here as often as I use to now.  Have to find myself a new Thai restaurant to try.
author: sidney c.

description:
Chabaa is a cleaner King of Thai! The food here is very decently priced and the waitresses are prompt and ready to fill your glasses of water quickly!

The best think about Chabaa is they are open till 1am!! T
author: Jo L.

description:
It takes credit! yay!!! 

The service is great and the food is great.  Pretty decor with that modern vibe, seems pretty clean.  I really like that Won sen sen dish or whatever? the one with the minced meat and lettuce and silver noodles. =) They open late also so its great for late nite dining.  The Angel wings are very good last time we ordered, the corn cakes are pretty good though.  Tom Yum is Tasty ! Not too spicy.
author: Helen Y.

description:
YUMMY!  This place is reasonably price for the quality of thai food they serve.  Great presentation, wonderful strong and clear flavors with friendly staff.   I believe they are open past 9PM so thats always a plus in my book since I am a night owl.

I especially found the cashew nut prawns tasty!  When I went, we spent $30-40 bucks that came with 4 entrees.  That's a deal especially since we are all trying to save some money here and there in this economic climate.

I would recommend:
1) Cashew nut prawns
2) Green Curry - they don't water down the curry !  YAAY! - thats a big deal for me since I LOVE COCONUT MILK, I can bathe in it.
3)Tom Ka

This place is a gem in the jungle of San Fran.  Check it out!
author: Russell B.

description:
I've eaten here a few times, and was pleased to find it's open until 1am.  The service is pleasant and friendly, the place is clean and the atmosphere is fairly laid back.  The food is pretty good; I like the tom yum soup in particular.  

However, I recently ate at Marnee and thus am not sure when I'll be coming back to Chabaa.
author: Josh F.

description:
I grew up in the bay area, but moved down to LA.  Even then, whenever I do make trips up, Chabaa is one of those stops you HAVE to make when you are in SF.  It's became my instant favorite Thai restaurant.

Just walking in, the decor is simple, and very clean.  The place is well lit, and has a very friendly environment.  My first visit was probably like no other.  The waitress welcomed us like we were frequent patrons of theirs. I admitted it was my first time, and asked for food suggestions.  After knowing what types of food I liked, she made several suggestions that I still order today.  I asked her how spicy she can make my curry.  Explaining how I loathe curry that is too spicy, and no flavor, and vice versa,  She explains the process of how they create their dishes, and how it can maintain flavor, AND spiciness.  I was skeptical until the dish came out, and she definitely delivered her promise.

All of them are extremely friendly, and even long hours of work, they're laughing along with you.  I like most, is how they're not afraid to ask how the food was.  They stop by once in a while and will ask if everything was alright, or if it met our expectations.  You know it's a good restaurant when the waiters are not afraid to ask.

The menu consists of a wide selection to chose from.  I generally dislike menus with pictures, because often times, businesses misrepresents them, HOWEVER, the pictures on Chabaa's menus actually looked exactly like the ones in the picture, (if not better).

The food is always fresh, and does not disappoint.  I love how flexible they are too.  Sometimes I bring friends who are picky, and want to modify a dish.  They're happy to make that special dish for them.  Very quick, and very dependable.

Definitely a place I will always be going back to.
author: April W.

description: Just came here tonight around 11:00pm ish and was very hungry. I really wanted fried rice and so I tried the BBQ pork fried rice and got the vegetarian pad thai. The service was good. (I feel like all Thai restaurants have good service.) When the barbeque pork fried rice came it was in a small portion. I couldn't see any BBQ pork but saw a lot of chines sausages. The rice was pretty oily and I was fearing for the added fat in my body. If you are "watching your weight" you should ask for less oil because the amount of oil is just scary. Usually I would get Pineapple fried rice and that dish isn't as oily as this one but maybe the oil was from the sausages. I also thought it was pretty salty, especially the eggs. The sliced bbq pork was good. Then came the vegetarian pad thai. The difference between vegetarian and regular pad thai (chicken/shrimp) is that the vegetarian one was more salty. I liked how they put a lot of veggies in it but it was lacking in ground peanuts -it seems like there was one teaspoon of peanuts in there. I don't know if it was the timing that made these dishes less than admirable but I was not very satisfied with the taste of food. I am not even picky but I think they should be more careful with seasoning the food. The thai iced tea was very sweet. I think their long hours at work may have impaired their work because it seems as if they just add extra salt, sugar, and oil to make them "taste better". I should have went to king of thai.
author: Carmen L.

description: nice atmosphere/service and lovely decor. i also like how the place is always dim. The food is good, but the ROTI (dessert) is delicious. love love love it
author: Jennifer T.

description: This place was much better than anticipated. I ordered the Shrimp Pad Kee Mao; one word, delicious! Tasted extra spicy, just the way it should be! It's definitely up there w/ Osha Thai's Pad Kee Mao. Plus, it was very cheap! Possibility of becoming my new favorite thai spot!
author: Alex T.

description: Love their sweet sticky rice with coconut ice cream.
author: Noel C.

description:
My absolute favorite Thai restaurant....EVER! I love how they're clean, how they're all so friendly (they know my name), they're quick, and they're open late. I always run over here after watching a late show or movie...and I'm always satisfied. My family begs me to take them here whenever they come to visit. My aunt forces me to pick food up here before I go and visit them. Now doesn't that say a lot?

If you're sick, go for the Tom Yum Gai. Yummy, yummy soup. It ALWAYS makes me feel better!
author: Ang L.

description:
UPDATE 4/16/07:
Up one star bc Pad Si Yiu is still delicious!  The bf got some ground beef with fried egg over flat noodles, and he liked it.  He said it had a bit too much MSG though.  We also tried the Chicken Satay, which I expected would have been dry... but surprisingly it was really moist.  Delicious!


----------------
After a failed attempt to try Nopa last Saturday, my friends and I drove all around San Francisco trying to find a place we wanted to eat.  First, we made our way to Noe Valley, but it seemed that the parking gods were not with us that day.  Every restaurant we wanted to go to had the most horrible parking situation.  After 1+ hours of driving around, my friends decides to head to Irving and 9th and just pick a restaurant.  Needless to say, we couldn't find parking AGAIN.  Finally, my other friend suggested thai food and we went with Chabaa because we found parking right in front.  

I ordered the Pad Si-Yu with Pork and I thought it was delicious (I don't think it was the hunger talking).  The noodles were flavorful (in chinese, there was enough "wok hay")  and portions were plentiful.  I scarfed down the whole meal just bc it was so good.  I also tried my friend's pumpkin yellow curry and that was also delicious.  The service was great since the waiter kept refilling our water without asking. 

Here's the reason why I gave three stars:  Despite the fact that the food was good and the service great, my friend ordered the Tom Yum Soup and found a bug in her soup.  Honestly, I don't know what kind of bug it was, I know it's not a fly or mosquito or those green veggie bugs.  My friend fished it out and then didn't want to know what it was.  Ignorance is bliss, I suppose.
author: Michelle W.

description: I like this place cuz it's open late.. Food is pretty good as well.  Just try it! Also try the specials...
author: Demanding T.

description:
I always get pad siu pork when I get Thai food. This place is great because:

* They scored a 94/100 on their SF Health Inspection Report (compare with scores of 60-80 for their neighbors).
* English-speaking service is friendly, a welcome break from your typical Sunset Chinese dive.
* They use eggs. Some place's don't, to cut costs.
* Not too salty. They can help you get your taste on without cheating with the heavy sauces.

There is one thing to complain about - parking is a bitch in this neighborhood. But it's not their fault.
author: Rob T.

description:
I don't eat thai often, but decided to try Chabaa as an alternative
to Marnee. 
Pretty bare bones and on the cheap side. Not a lot of ambiance. 
Our corn cakes were crispy and pretty tasty. The
tom kha/coconut soup was thicker than usual but not as flavorful
as Marnee's. We all had veggie curries(red, yellow, and peanut) and they were ok but lacking a little zest.  I'm giving them an extra
star for quick and friendly service. 
I'd give them 2.5 total.
author: Sandrita R.

description:
This place was always passed by because I live around the corner from Marnee Thai.

Though Marnee Thai is much better, their pad thai was really good.

I loved that this was open into the wee hours of the night. I'll remember this place when other places are closed.
author: Sharelle W.

description: Okay, this place is really closer to four stars.  It's good but having gone there for a few years now, I'd say that some are hits and some are misses.  I still love their duck curry but it really is too milky/creamy; I end up having add quite a bit of salt.
author: Erika C.

description:
Just ate here for the first time, and it won't be the last.

I can corroborate Sweet J.'s report that the portions are not huge.  But for me, a man more or less average in build if in no other way, it was exactly the right amount for a meal.  I didn't take anything home, and I didn't leave anything beyond a grain of rice or two.

I had the green curry with chicken.  My meal-mate, normally a vegetarian, should have been in veggie heaven with a menu that says you can any dish with the three basic meats or veggies and tofu; but in the end he succumbed to the lure of the mixed seafood red curry, and did approximately the same amount of damage to his plate as I did to mine.

As a huge Singha fan, it doesn't hurt me that they don't have a full bar but only wine and beer.  The food is excellent.  The service is friendly and attentive but leaves you space to relax and enjoy your meal.  My server was extremely helpful.  I asked about the spiciness of the green curry, which had two peppers beside it on the menu instead of one; she probably thought a blue-eyed dirty blond would be wanting something soft, and said they could tone it down.  I demurred, and we talked until she offered me a scale of one to seven.  I said, "Five", and was a little surprised to hear her say "Really?"  Was I going too far?  But no, five was perfect, I could have eaten a six but I wouldn't have liked it as much.

Definitely going back.  Oh, and parking was trivial on a Wednesday evening.
author: Chuck D.
Jelisa S.

description: We finally had the opportunity to get in for a sit-down meal at Chabaa instead of the take-out on our first experience. It was great! Flavors were great, but what puts it over the top of Marnee Thai is the attention to detail. The details to presentation and garnish make the experience that much more. We'll definitely be back!
author: Cster x.

description:
Average Thai food, nothing special. Last time I went there I got sick.

I like the atmosphere though.

Parking is a b*tch too!
author: Keith R.

description:
Marnee Thai is overrated.  Chabaa is a few doors down and is WAY better in terms of food, service, space and even menu.  Maybe the latter is up for debate as I haven't been back in Marnee Thai in years.   I tried it a few times and it never lived up to the hype.

Anyway - Chabaa. The servers are always so sweet - even when I bring in my 2 & 4 yr olds.  

The plates are cool.  As in, the dishes.  The dishes are modern and ceramic and are not plastic with a Ming Dynasty motif on them.  The rice doesn't come in a fake silver urn.

The food is failproof.  We have been eating there since they opened a few years ago and have never, ever had a bad meal either there or to go.  

We love their soups - the broth is amazing and the product is always super fresh.  The stirfries are also fab - we love the one with eggplant and beef (pad ma kuer?).  And the ol standbye pad thai?  Awesome.  What makes a pad thai good to me?  One that's not too sweet.

Next time your friend asks you to go to Marnee Thai, go ahead and go along and once you get there and see how long the line is - suggest going to Chabaa instead.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Michelle L.

description:
This place is OK. The food is OK; the service is OK; my only gripe is that when we went in for lunch today, they charged us 18% gratuity for a 6 person party AFTER tax. 

Usually isn't gratuity calculated before tax?

When I brought it up, the guy replied with "well, it's only a few cents different." I figured that if they have a note at the end of menu mentioning an additional $0.50 per dish, they'd at least try to get the customer service to be decent.
author: David F.

description:
Yes, the thai food here is just ok...so if you want to be all 'San Francisco smug' and talk about how you found simply the best  thair food in the sunset, head a few blocks down irving to Marnee Thai....BUT!  If you've come home from a long day of gettin' screwed by the man and you're feeling like a lazy biznatch, just log on to Chabaa's website and simply order your food online.  

It's a super user friendly site -  I have like a third grade education and a mild retardation, so if i can do it, so can you.

And seriously, as soon as you hit the 'submit order' button, there's a dude at your door with your order.  And he's not even creepy.
author: John H.

description:
I love love LOVE Thai food in San Francisco.  You can get such fresh, affordable, flavorful stuff.  Chabaa is a place I insist on returning to every time I'm in the area for one simple dish: duck fried rice.  For some reason, I can't find it in Manhattan, and duck grease is simply the perfect thing to be soaked up by rice.  MMMMPH.  The other stuff is good as well (noodles, soups, etc.), but I probably wouldn't come here if it weren't for the duck fried rice.

They have free delivery during dinner time and service is always friendly and quick.  There's a 15$ minimum charge for credit cards.
author: Deborah H.

description: I have been at this location of Chabaa Thai Cuisine at the end of May with a friend. The food was tasty but the service was mediocre. After checking the menu, the lady came to take our orders. Along with the fish, I ordered some Thai iced tea. After about 15-20 minutes the food was still being made, which was not a problem, but the Thai iced tea never came. The lady that took our orders got herself some food, sat down a few tables away and started to eat. I had to order the Thai iced tea a second time with another server. At that point, food and drinks  came. If you want to use chopsticks, they have plastic ones on the table, not a very healthy option since anybody can touch and play with them.
author: X. Y.

description: Warm restaurant. Nice people. Tried the Green Curry and the Tom Yum Soup. Both were really good, BUT I expected it to be cheaper based on some of the reviews. It's more expensive than thai places on Clement, but they have decent sized portions. Also, a pro is that you don't come out smelly like some thai places.
author: Katherine F.

description:
Ok, the reason I was brought to this place was not for the food, initially, it was because a guy friend of mine told a bunch of my guy friends that there is a HAWTTT waitress there. I'm not a huge fan of thai food, nor do I ever CRAVE thai food. If I've I'm ever eating there, its not b/c it was my decision. 
 
I have yet to see this hawt waitress that they speak of....

But I have been pleasantly surprised by the taste of their food though!!! This is WAAAAAY more important to me. HA!
Out of all the thai places I've been to,  I'd like to say that I like chabaa the best. But my flavor for thai food is way limited, so I can't say I'm a super reliable source.

Last night I had their crispy noodles with veggies, fish cake and gravy, SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO GOOD. I believe its #35 on their menu, there's a picture of it too. The other times I've been there I usually order pad thai, b/c that's the "safe" choice, and usually you can judge a thai restaurant by their pad thai anyways, but I like #35 WAAAAAAY better than their pad thai. Usually you get these crispy noodles in gravy at Chinese restaurants, this one is way better since I like my crispy noodles crispy, and not drowning in gravy, the gravy is at the bottom, so for you soggy noodle lovers, you have plenty to love down there too. 

I also really like their crab fried rice. Nothing out of the ordinary, but I love it and I'd order it. And I usually don't like paying for fried rice too. Next time I want to try their pineapple fried rice, but I always steered away b/c it looks like cat food in the picture. But since they secured my trust with their crispy noodles, I will try pineapple fried rice next time. 

Place is clean, and their bathroom isn't super nasty either. I approve.
Dcor is simple and clean, I like their light fixtures. Always fresh flowers at each table.

Service has always been very good here. Never had any problems. 

Also this place is good for groups!
author: Irene C.

description:
Excellent Thai restaurant. They're open until 1am everyday! 
Prices are reasonable. 
I just looooove their Pineapple fried rice. It makes my mouth water just thinking about it. 
The atmosphere is nice and relaxed. Service is friendly.
And its 100 times better than Marnee Thai.
My new favorite Thai place in the city.
author: Judith F.

description: Pretty good food. I had their pad thai and curry foods before. Their thai ice tea is decent too! Not busy during lunch hours on a weekday and for dinner make a reservation beforehand as it can get busy! Parking is right outside, I think after 6pm it's free parking (not sure). I would come here again, especially during non busy hours!
author: Vanna C.

description:
I got the fried corn cakes and those fat noodles with beef and a fried egg on top. I forget the name...Pad Kee Mao? Pad Mao Gao? No idea. But whatever, the noodle serving was huge for $7.95. It was PERFECT. The fried corncakes with their cucumber sauce was mouthwatering. I need to go back...
Plus, its open till 1.
author: Alexa M.

description: The food is decent, and these guys were our go to delivery place, but won't be anymore. I placed an order online and included the tip. It took over an hour for the driver to show up, but the food was still hot so it's all good. I signed the slip and when I handed it back, he asked me if something was wrong with the service. Confused, I told him that no, there wasn't, and that I'd included the tip when I'd placed the order. He heaved a dramatic sigh and then asked if I knew how far it was from the restaurant from our place (about 20 blocks), and asked if I was sure I didn't want to tip more. I didn't have any cash anyway, so I told him I was sure and another dramatic sigh and he turned away. I'm not a stingy tipper and have never had someone complain about the amount I've left before, so I'm really not sure what to even make of that, but we'll definitely be finding another thai place for when we feel like calling in. It's too bad Marnee doesn't deliver.
author: Redd C.

description:
So yesterday was birthday and I wanted Thai. I wanted to try something new in San Francisco., so I looked on yelp and decided to go to Chabaa Thai Cuisine. I figured I had never had a bad experience at a Thai Restaurant with the food always being good and the service awesome.

Chabaa Thai Cuisine was the bad experience I had at a Thai restaurant. The service was horrible. We sat there in a nearly empty restaurant and waited to be served for I dont know how long. At that point I actually had a gut instinct to get up and leave but I didnt want to say anything. 

Im not a Thai food expert so simply asked questions about various dishes,etc.  They seemed like they were irritated with this and then when the food came it was way below par. 

I think if yesterday wasnt my birthday I would have just moved on with this being a restaurant that I would never go back to without saying anything. But considering the day it was, the food that was not so good as compared to other thai restaurants that I had been to, and the most offensive thing was the horrible service, someone  could not pay me to go back to this place.
author: Alicia J.

description:
Yep those corn cakes are something else.

This is not traditional Thai though.  There are some fried entrees and even pecan pie.

The decor was atypical but cute.  I don't know if I'd go there on purpose necessarily but if I was in the neighborhood, already parked, and hungry, I might indulge again and definitely I'd go here over Marnee Thai."
author: Femita J.

description: Chabaa is open late and has a very cozy feel to it. The service is good, fairly attentive wait staff. The food is ok, not always consistent. It's good for a late night snack/dinner and it won't dent your wallet.
author: Adelina W.

description: We had a wonderful meal delivered to our home. Green papaya salad, duck, pad prik khing and soup were all terrific. The vegetables and ingredients were very, very fresh!
author: Lois M.

description: Had lunch here a few weeks ago and ordered the fried chicken fried rice.  The rice was really, really oily and as for the fried chicken, the ratio of chicken to fried parts was way, way off; there was hardly any chicken left underneath the batter.  It's a decent place for lunch and the service is pretty good, but I really wish their portions were a little bigger.
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
Can't lie. Some of the best Thai food I have ever had! Pad thai was delicious and the amount they gave for the price was mmm, delishhh. And corn cakes. Where have they been all my life? I had no idea what they were until Chabaa and now, all the times I come here in the future, I MUST get them. They're genius. 

And open until 1? I think I've found my new late-night munchies restaurant.
author: Steph W.

description:
I love this place-- clean, attentive, good food, open late. Hits all the requirements. 

I usually get the green curry when I come which is so delicious (could use some more eggplant, but I guess perhaps not everyone loves eggplant). Pad see ew and Pad Thai are also delicious. Tom Yum Soup is sooo good with lots of shrimp and they're nice enough to scoop out your first bowl for you. 

I usually come here late but there's never a wait and the service is awesome. Yay for Chabaa Thai!
author: Christine Y.

description:
Note: This is more of a warning rather than a review.  

Be careful when declaring how spicy you want your food prepared.  Last time I was here, I ordered pad kee mao and told them to make it "spicy."  Big mistake.  I wound up eating my food over a 2 hour period since my mouth was on fire after every couple bites (it's good thing I ordered to go as I would've looked like an idiot sitting there waiting for my mouth to cool down :D).  No doubt, this was the spiciest meal I've ever eaten.  I'll come back another time to get a tamer pad kee mao in order to give Chabaa a real score.  Until then!
author: Sam C.

description: I went back for a birthday party and I have to say my opinion has changed. Good food and great service.
author: Tina C.

description:
I really like Thai food and I think this is one of the nicer restaurants that does Thai very well for a good price. I would say the food is comparable to King of Thai but the restaurant is definitely on the nicer side.  I can pretty safely say that this place is authentic one I realized that almost the entire restaurant is run by Thai people. I would highly recommend the Pumpkin Curry or any of the the stir fried noodles. The restaurant is also very nicely decorated with lights and vases that put me in a very relaxed and comfortable state.

Good food, good service, nice restaurant!
author: Virginia C.

description: I don't know how to be at all funny or original about a place that's this middle-of-the-road, so I won't try. The facts: it's a medium-sized restaurant in the Sunset with solid victuals of a rather genuinely Thai persuasion, and prices just a tad over the coveted one-dollar-sign mark. (Hyphen count so far: 6. Staggering.) It's well trafficked and therefore well staffed, and the dining experience is pleasant. Some of the best tom yum I've had outside of Thailand; recommended, as are the curries. Ordered takeout once, though, and got the wrong kind of noodle in the duck soup, which was rather flat and meatless to begin with. Pretty much the definition of three stars in my book, check it out if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Peter B.

description:
i walked by Chabaa many times but until last week i saw a "PEOPLE LOVES US ON YELP" sticker. so i thought to myself, "THIS PLACE MUST BE GOOD!" 

Chabaa is an inexpensive, nice, clean and Thai restaurant. i didn't dine in but i got take out for dinner. the cashew chicken was good and the prices wasn't expensive. $7.05 for a whole meal. i was satisfy! but if you want big portions like King of Thai, then you will probably be disappointed. the portions are about 1/3 less than KOTs portions but i think Chabaa is BETTER than KOT.
author: Carol Y.

description:
I LOVE CHABAA! HANDS DOWN FAVORITE THAI RESTAURANT (apart from all the Osha's)  IN SAN FRANCISCO!

-Great atmosphere
-GREAT FOOD!:
