-Better Thai Ice tea
-great location
-the best services (and beautiful servers!)

I've been going here since it opened and the owners (bookie,Flower,Peach, Joy, Etc) all provide an excellent casual dining experience in the heart of the sunset.

Love you guys thanks for all the good eats!
author: Jedi H.

description:
This place rules. I've gone back more and tried more things and its all good by me. I'm sure there are better Thai places out there but for reliable quality food at great prices (under 20 bucks for 2 every time (including tip, but with just water to drink)). This place is becoming routine because it's close and cheap and has a huge selection.

For what it's worth usually there's quite a few people there, so I'm not alone in liking this place :)
author: Josh S.

description: Wasn't impressed, the vegetarian tom yom tasted like feet, I can't eat thai food anymore because of this place.
author: Kenneh l.

description:
I've ordered take out from them twice. The first time I ordered the Red curry with chicken ($6.50) and Guay Tiaw Lord (sauteed shrimp, ground chicken, calamari, sliced fish cake, bean curd and dried shrimp with white onion, bean sprouts and black mushrooms, served over flat noodles, $7.25) and rice of course. The Red curry was good, not too hot for me, but I didn't like the bamboo shoots that were in it. The Guay Tiaw Lord was okay, I'm partial to it since I don't like calamari. But what made me order from them again was the serving size! I got this tall cup of curry, pretty much full to the brim. It was a great price for the amount you get.

So because I knew it was a good deal, we ordered out from them again, this time getting the Yellow curry with chicken ($6.50) and the Pad Si-Yu with chicken (stir fried flat rice noodles with egg, Chinese broccoli and soy sauce, $7.25). This time, we didn't get rice because we could just make it ourselves. I was looking forward to my tall cup of Yellow curry so when I opened it, I was surprised to find it only halfway full! I was REALLY bummed (since this dish was YUM!) and wondered if the decreased portion size had anything to do with not ordering rice. The Pad Si-Yu was YUM as well. Think of Chow Fun, cooked in a dry style and it's somewhat similar to this dish, but sweet.
author: Janel Y.

description: A little on the greasy side but it's really fantastic stuff. I ordered delivery and me and my girlfriend both ate for under $30, and had leftovers. That's great value in my book, and I'll definitely be ordering from them again.
author: Bryan E.

description:
My boyfriend and I absolutely loovee this restaurant. Its' one of our favorites. It has excellent food and the atmosphere is just wonderful!

Food is at reasonable prices. The service is excellent.
And correction: They do take reservations. 

I had a party of 20 here. 
couldn't pick a better place.
author: Nathalie N.

description: Ate here for the first time tonight.  We ate family style so I can't remember all the dishes were, but I can say I was blown away.  This is what the "other" popular Thai places used to be like before they went all hipster and trendy.  The food was fantastic, flavors were exploding with every dish.  I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews about the service, the girls working tonight were great, maybe we just showed up on a good night. Nevertheless, this is definitely my go to place from now on for Thai food in the city, especially since they are open so late.
author: eddo l.

description: Came here with the boyfriend. He ordered a seafood crsipy noodle and I order seafood soup with rice stick noodles. When our orders came my boyfriend's plate looked extremely small like it didn't even have much in it, mostly the noodles were drowning in the sauce. As he was eating I saw something glimmer in the dish and took a closer look at it, GUESS WHAT? A piece of hair was in there.. Asked the waitress to take it back, and if we could change the dish. He ordered the chicken pat thai. She apologized then set the pat thai on the table. We resumed eating.. Half way through our food.. my boyfriend pulls something out of his mouth. It was a piece of STEEL WOOL. REALLY GUYS?! What the fuck is this? First a piece of hair, then a piece of steel wool deep buried inside a tofu..? What happened to this place? I guess that sign saying they didn't change anything but management was totally wrong. We said that's it. Poor baby, you know how painful it is to bite down on any types of metal when you have fillings. She didn't charge us for the pat thai. Ugh disgusting.
author: Eugenia X.

description:
The roomies and I used to frequent Sukothai....until this little baby opened its fine doors to our taste buds.  

Mind you, we refer to this place as 'Chubby Cobra.'  Don't ask me why, it was probably muttered in the midst of a drunken/stoned  tirade, but it will forever be our lovely Cobra.  

Onto the food - the green curry is my absolute favorite hands down.  They have 7 levels of spiciness.  The highest I've tried was a 5, and let me tell you it was the hottest thai food I've ever had.  I plan on going back to get a 6, but I need to come prepared with a gallon of water and a bottle of pepto.  Oh, and if you're in the mood for an appetizer, the chicken satay is the perfect way to go.  

This place also does great delivery service...works perfect if you are too lazy to walk down there or it's just crappy weather outside.   

5 Stars for Chubby Cobra!
author: Cyrus R.

description:
man, i hate being the odd man out.

but ill brave it cause its too important.  i must take a stand...

so i was starving and found chabaa and they delivered.  sweet.  i was grumpy and weak from not eating ALL day so i hopped on grubhub and ordered away.

i ordered the vegetarian noodle soup (veggies & tofu in chicken broth) and the tom yum j soup (hot and sour soup with tofu) and roti.  the soups were not too bad but the tofu tasted funny.  funny like weird and odd not haha but not funny enough to not eat it, mind you i hadnt eaten all day.

fast forward...

late that night, i was hanging out in the oval office.  i was king of the porcelain throne.  i wont go into details but i was sick.  from both ends.  it was bad.

fast forward...

four days later my stomach is still reeling and im left sucking on damn ice cubes and watching the food channel like its porn.  

so... im positive it was something i ate from chabaa.  

it is a hard lesson learned my friends.
author: kim f.

description:
I love this place since they made amazing penang curry with roasted duck.  What was especially awesome about this place was they delivered!

I worked a lot and would come home dead tired after a grueling day of work -so I would ring Chabaa Thai up and place my order.  Within 10 minutes, it was at my door - my lovely penang curry with roasted duck.

It was sweet and if you request it (Thai Spicy), they will make it hot for you.  I love them, I love them, I love them.

God, do I miss them!
author: Neline S.

description:
We've ordered to go here before and don't remember it being this bad.  There isn't much meat in the dishes, and the meat that is there isn't that good.  The beef looks pale like pork, and the chicken is dry and hard to chew.

Pad thai with beef - noodles tasted good, but there were only sparse amounts of small, pale meat.
#36 - even the "ground beef" looked pale and not quite right this time
duck fried rice - eh, nothing I'd order again
BBQ pork fried rice wasn't bad
deluxe vegetables - $8 for a small amount of veggies, not worth it.
author: J. L.

description:
I have been to a few Thai places in my day, but frankly, I'm not a connoisseur. I don't swish the broth in my mouth, waiting for the flavor palette to fully emerge. I want food that smells good, looks good, and tastes good. One star for each of these! My duck noodle soup was exactly what I wanted. Their pineapple fried rice is also excellent, as is the yellow curry. I also enjoyed the Hoi Jor (sp?) and eggrolls (cucumber salad was good too, but I think it would be really hard to screw that one up). 

I didn't give five stars for strange things like their non-updating of menus (prices increased, but they just tell you in a sticker on the menu that every item is $.50 more), and how you have to order rice with your curry, since it doesn't come with. However, they did get an extra star for service. I went on a weeknight, and it was slow when we came in, but picked up. Our waitress was SUPER attentive, filling our teas promptly and clearing finished plates equally fast. When we commented how much we like cucumber salad, she noted that they used to serve it with the yellow curry, but no one would eat it, so they stopped doing that. However, for the two of six in our party who got the curry, she brought out cucumber salad! She was just really nice and we had a good time. 

All in all, it was a great experience. Not mind-blowing, but pretty darn good. (2 $$ since we got a couple appetizers, but the portions are generous so it all balances out.)
author: Rachel B.

description:
Chabaa has a fair amount of competition due to its proximity to Marnee Thai (which is down the block), but I consistently choose Chabaa over the venerable award winning competitor - and I'll explain why. 

I prefer the openess of Chabaa - higher ceilings, newer tables and chairs, and a much cleaner feel.  The staff is extremely friendly and attentive and the menu is laid out well with good descriptions.  The food is served on modern plateware and portions are quite generous.  Though a bit pricey compared to the chinese places on Irving, I find the pricing to be fair and a bit lower than Marnee. 

But the most important aspect is how good the food tastes.  The cook is very skilled, as the food is as consistent as the sun rises and sets.  The food is always fresh and always delicious - although they may wish to rexamine their appetizers.  My current favorite is the fried chicken and fried rice combo.
author: Dennis Y.

description: Ordered delivery for my b-day.  The delivery went through without a hitch.  Could have been a little more generous with the portions but tasted great.  Ordered the green seafood curry, couple orders of the pad si yu, and two other curries ...
author: Andrew L.

description: Vegan/vegetarian section on menu. Sparsely decorated. Slow service but good food. We ordered veggie panang and although very different from how we normally get it at other Thai restaurants, it was good and plentiful. Reasonably priced
author: Karen K.

description:
Was seated upon arrival. I asked for the secret menu and was given both the secret and non-secret menus. From the secret menu I chose the seafood curry custard (ho something-or-other). The waiter asked mild, medium or spicy. When it came it was on the spicy side of mild, though I can't blame him. Next time I'll ask for medium-plus. There really needs to be a spiciness calibration scale that can be used between restaurants, like

"If your place's spicy is Thai House Express Tenderloin spicy then I want medium, but if it's Regent Thai's spicy then I want extra spicy."  Or maybe "one-half of Thai spicy." Or something like that.

Still it had a nice, fresh, curry-ish flavor with a nice underburn. It wasn't "custard" custard a la the Japanese chawan mushi, but there were agglomerations of custardy egg here and there. Anyway, it was flavorful and a reasonable portion and I would order it again.

I made a nutritional misstep with dessert. I incorrectly assumed that roti with coconut ice cream wouldn't come with the sweetened condensed milk. It does. I must admit a guilty pleasure in enjoying condensed milk's creamy sweetness, so of course I didn't try to scrape it off or anything, and it was really good with the ice cream. But I think it's a bit overboard and if I were to order it in the future I'd specifically order it with ice cream only. Just saying.

Pleasant service. Do bring a sweater if it's cold out, I was fine with one and not chilly, but a coat would not be needed. (Seems like places are either warm or freezing, but Chabaa has made a reasonable compromise at cool.) Thai soft rock played at a low volume.

I would definitely eat here again, would try more things on the no-longer-secret menu, and would bring friends.
author: Charles B.

description: I like this place because it's quiet and the service is great.  My favorite is beef over noodles with an egg on top.  I also love the fried rice because of the crab paste! But because of the cold weather I have been craving the roast duck noodle soup.  I run on carbs so the noodles were all gone and the fatty part of the duck was floating in my soup.  Soooo good!
author: Amy L.

description: I cant recall the first time I ate here, but I knew immediately after that I would definitely visit again. On more than one occasion, this restaurant has left me with fond memories. It saved me from a horrible movie date and cured my stomach of disturbing noises(hungry) the night before my birthday. The room is generally calm, but I would enjoy coming here even if it wasn't. The waiters are friendly and the food comes on time. Order a thai iced tea if you can :) They make the most interesting things from the straw wrappers. Oh, but don't eat the candy they give you when they give you the check. Seriously.
author: Katherine L.

description:
OMG the food here is delicious. Oa's parents do a great job of cooking here, I like the service, the food rocks, although yes, there are some fried items here -- definitely a stop-over instead of the other spot a few steps away. 

Yes, it does take the place of Thai Spice, but it's much better, and again, the service and food quality has been unequivocally some of the best I have received in the city. 

Pad Ga Prow is a must, Pad Prik King is good too. yummy Thai tea, and desserts too. 

a visit is in order if you have yet to do so.
author: j d.

description:
Not bad.

Not wow either.

For the price, its healthier *assuming* than going to KFC. 

mmMMMmmm... KFC biscuit.
author: Stanley L.

description:
A nice place for some quiet dining.  Food was ok, nothing so exceptional.  The tom yum that we had was a bit sour than expected.  The corn cakes were yummy, but that's because anything fried is awesome.  The other dish we ordered was the pad see kao (sp) and it was a bit dry on one hand, but enough flavor on the other.  

The waitress was very nice and attentive.  Food came out fast and I like how they just gave us tea!  I would go back here again and probably try out some curry.  Btw, nice decor.
author: Chau L.

description:
Lovely! After midnight, a few friends and I walked in to Chabaa and were greeted by the friendly waitress. Although it doesn't have as much character as the nearby more established Marnee Thai, this restaurant does have some decorative touches towards the back by the kitchen. The prices are just slightly higher than those at King of Thai, but definitely justified: this place just feels cleaner. A friend and I ordered the  vegetable and tofu Pad Si-yu. The waitress was knowledgeable enough about veganism/vegetarianism to ask if eggs and fish oil were okay. Impressive. On a cold, drizzly night, this not too greasy dish hit the spot.

Props for understanding hungry night owls exist in the Outer Sunset and staying open until 1 every night!
author: Kari M.

description:
Went here with two friends on Easter since none of us had anything else to do....it was nice and empty. The space is really cute, nicely decorated. I had Cashew Chicken which was really good, but I was under the impression that the chicken was going to be sauteed or something, but it was pretty much deep fried. No so good for those jeans. It kind of bothered us that one of my friends and I got our dishes first, and then had to wait quite a while for 3rd friend to get hers. But it was worth it, she had some curry that was FANTASTIC. I would definitely come here again, really well priced and the servers were super friendly.
My favorite thing about eating anywhere in the Sunset is the easy parking, puts me in such a good mood.
author: Jenna W.

description:
Finally, Thai delivery that is actually pretty good, even if still a bit greasy on the noodles, but who's not?

The bacon wrapped and fried shrimp came with a sweet and sour dipping sauce and that was delicious. The pad kee mao with ground pork and the green curry with chicken were well above par. Only disappointing dish was the corn cakes which I ordered out of curiosity and found a bit flavorless.

If I do order delivery Thai food again, I'm calling Chabaa. Can't wait to try all of the Yelper's dish suggestions.
author: Ben W.

description: The food was excellent. We had the yellow curry soup and Pad Si-Yu flat noodles. Was dissappointed that there weren't any lunch specials and charboiled chicken with the carrots and cucumbers in that rice vinegar yummie goodness. Service was good, food came fast.... but the selection was not interesting enough for me.
author: D M.

description:
Good Thai food and great service.  

I ordered carry out and was seated down and given a nice hot cup of tea while I waited.  Everyone was very sweet and the food was good, not super original or slap-yo-momma amazing but very good, standard Thai food. My only complaint is I wish the serving sizes were a big bigger my order was mostly rice, and not a whole lot of the actual entree.
author: Gabi S.

description:
I am not one to frequent any restaurant  but man... this place ROCKS and over delivers with service, quality and VALUE!!! And it's open late, unlike anything else in the area! 

I have now been there about 12x in the past 6 months.

It's family owned (yeah!!!) and what a nice and sweet family they are! The skewers, curries are all great! Have not had anything that I did not love or like. Thai ice tea is the best I have ever had!

The decor is simple, clean and tasteful! The place itself is very clean and well kept!

My hidden gem!
author: Javier F. R.

description:
went there to eat with my friend really good food :D they give you hot tea when you arrive from the cold outside :D
this sound really yummi right now!!!!!
author: Alex G.

description: I live closer to king of Thai but would come here instead anyway. The portions are bigger, they accept credit card, are super fast and best of all - super friendly :) 2 thumbs up!
author: Nadia I.

description: I wish the Thai tea was bottomless, but it was good nonetheless. The pad thai is also good, along with other plates that my party ordered. We received fast service (again, from what I've experienced). It was 15 of us and they served us pretty quick. No rush for us to leave. I would definitely go back! =)
author: Marissa P.

description: Terrible service! The staff makes you feel that you should be fortunate to have their attention. Don't come here, go next door.
author: A C.

description:
I first had Chabaa at a student conference a few months ago (I'm guessing it was a huge order of take-out).  I went to the restaurant last night with a few people and was pretty impressed-- the ambience and decor are nice, and the smiling waitresses are all very polite and attentive to providing good service.  

If you're impartial to meat, this is a great place to go because most entrees can be modified to suit vegetarians (the menu-- pictures included!-- reads so itself along the header).  Although dishes are priced very reasonably and thus seem to be individual entrees, they're actually served family style (of course, nobody's going to force you to share).  

We had one order of papaya salad, larb, and three noodle based soups, as well as two very beautiful and tall Thai iced teas.  The total came to about forty.  Hot tea is included.
author: Lynn O.

description:
Chabaa Thai is excellent. 
The food there is on par with the Thai food I had in Thailand. Best of all, they have certain dishes that only Thais and those that have visited Thailand would know about. If you speak the language, you can ask for those items as well. ;)

The staff is very friendly, the food is very fresh, prices are good, portions are good and so are the hours. I highly recommend Chabaa Thai.
author: Larry J.

description:
Tried this place about a month ago for delivery. It was ok, nothing special. When we crave Thai food, we usually go to Marnee Thai to eat there or get take out from there. When we get too lazy, we have a back up place, Sri Thai, on Lincoln Way, which delivers. 
But Chabaa Thai has this chicken that is similar to Marnee Thai, which Sri doesn't. So tonight's choice, hubby's request, was Chabaa. I place an order online at 7:10. The website said to allow UP TO 45 minutes for delivery. So I wait. And wait. And wait. 8 pm. Nothing. I am very hungry at this point. I call them. 
Me: Hi. I placed an order online about 50 mins ago. I hope it went through. My food is still not here.
Chabaa-What is your address?
 I tell them. 
Chabaa-Your food is on the way, the driver already left.
Me-Great, thanks a lot. 
8:15. I am super hungry. Still no food. I call again.
Chabaa- I told you, your order is on the way. Please be patient. We have a lot of orders today.
Me-Ok......Do you know about how long?
Chabaa-The driver should be there any minute. He left a while back.
8:35 STILL NO FOOD! At this point I am ready to kill somebody!
I call back.
Me-It's me again, where is my food????
Chaba-YOUR ORDER NEVER WENT THROUGH. It happens sometimes, technical issues with the website. Let me take down your order again, and the driver will deliver it as soon as it's ready!
Me-Are you f***ing kidding me??? It never went through? You couldn't have checked when I called the first 3 times?
Chabaa-Sorry. Let me just take your order again.
Me-No thanks. I will order from somewhere else. And do expect a review on Yelp about this experience.
9:00 pm. My phone rings. It's the manager of Chabaa, asking if she can do anything to make the whole situation better.
I say no, I already ordered from Marnee Thai and will have my food in 10 mins (hubby drove to get it).
Moral of the story? Don't get delivery from this place. At least don't place your order on their website. (Sri Thai's website works perfectly each time). But if you don't want delivery, why in the world would you choose this place over Marnee Thai???
author: Alina S.

description: Four stars for their yummy pumpkin curry and perfectly cooked rice. I also ordered pad se yew and the beef was dry and rubbery. I don't know if it was cooked way in advance and then thrown in with the noodles, but it was not tasty at all. I would go back for the curry. Service was ok, but I was literally the only one there. There's also a $1.50 tea charge. Boo.
author: k h.

description: Decent place especially for late night on that part of Irving Street. Last time I went, I ordered the stewed duck leg vermicelli soup, which was quite good. Also oftentimes I ordered Tom yum noodle soup just by habit, though here it's not as well done as other Thai noodle places I've been to.
author: H K.

description: had the duck fried rice. very well cooked. tried the pad see ew and was good as well. was not too expensive as well. great for late night dinners. thai tea was good as welll
author: Russell I.

description: I love this place! Already made it one of my top thai cuisines in the S.F bay area. Food is tasty (they have one of the better pad thais I've tried) and atmosphere is perfect for a casual date or hangout!
author: Phuong V.

description: Nice neighborhood spot not too far from Golden Gate Park.  Food is reliably good, service excellent.  Inexpensive.  Would recommend to anyone.
author: Craig M.

description:
Tasty, valuable, clean, open late, great service, and consistent quality on all of their dishes - Chabaa is the go-to spot if you're craving a nice Thai dish at any time of the day.  

I personally like their Pad Gra Pow (w/ a fried egg on top), Crab Fried Rice, and Pineapple Fried Rice.  I've explored most of the menu and have yet to run into a dish I dislike.  The only knock I can think of is their lack of spiceyness on certain dishes (but I just think they're trying to be nice).  Ask for the extra heat and they'll usually bring it.  Their portions are always plentiful, and they're never short on smiles.  Highly recommended!
author: Brandon C.

description:
My wife and I love this restaurant. Around 20th and Irving there are a handful of good Thai restaurants, but I recommend this one above all the others in the area. The decor is clean and spacious, the staff is attentive and courteous, and the best part is that the food is wonderful.

We tried at least 6 different dishes here, including the fried banana ice cream dessert. None of them disappoint. The curries have a deep, rich flavor, the Pad Thai is as good as you'll find anywhere, and the stir fried dishes are just great.

Finally, you don't pay much, either. Most dishes are 7-8 bucks. Tea is complimentary! I can't find a single thing to complain about this place - we love it, and we stopped going to other thai places nearby.
author: Kevin H.

description:
What do I think about when I think of Chabaa? First thing, the waitress. Every time I go and she's not there, it just breaks a little of my heart.

Okay, with my stalkerish behavior aside, I think the food here is pretty good. It has never gotten too packed here, and the service is great. The Pad Siu Yu (not sure on the spelling, it's the chow fun-like stuff) is really tasty. The noodle soups are soso, but are cheap (~$4-5).

Overall, this is a very good restaurant. Cute waitresses, good food, roomy, even for large groups, good service, cheap - what's not to like?

EDIT: I think everything on the menu went up like $1  !!!! o noes, the noodle soups are now like 6 bucks.
author: Lawrence L.

description:
The Thai food was okay. Not as good and authentic as Dara Thai in Berekeley. Its better than the other place I tried in SF. I ordered 2 orders of Pad Thai one they taste distinctly different. One was flavorful and good and the other one is just too sweet. No consistency.


4/23/08 update: I went there at around 11pm and had pahd thai and papaya salad. its was really good this time! my roomie had the red curry.. that wasnt flavorful enough. but the penang curry was good. id come back here to order the pahd thai and papaya salad again if its consistent
author: Beach L.

description:
This is pretty much my favorite Thai place in the city. I really like the flavor of their Tom Yum soup. It's spicy, but not too much for you mortals, as well as clean flavors with tasty meat and vegetables a floatin'. Every entre that I have had there was excellent.

To beat all of this is the price. Our last visit included three human beings, all of whom can pack away the food, with a total cost of just over $40. We even had food to take home.

There's also the added benefit of getting some falafel to go for heating up later from Sunrise Deli two doors down. Then your journey to the fat side will be complete.
author: Aaron C.

description:
The food is good, the service is great, and the waitresses look good. 

I like their Thai fried rice and they are around $8. They fill you up and most of the time I can never finish the whole plate. 

If you want chilli or jalepenos, you have to ask for it because they do not keep it at the table.
author: Joseph F.

description:
I used to live over in the Inner Sunset, and the area (and SF in general) lacks in good late night/24hr food places... compared to the rest of the country. 

BUT then there's Chabaa Thai: the lime green signed savior of the Sunset for the freshest, quickest, eat-in/pick-up Thai food in the West.  All the Curries are amazing & I recommend getting an extra side of the Peanut Sauce because it is VERY good. 

I believe they're open until about 2am, so not too bad for the late night gourmet munchies.
author: Jake B.

description: This is my go to neighborhood Thai place! Whether I'm dining in or ordering take out, I think Chabaa has proven to be delicious every single time. I have tried the corn cakes, chicken satay, hoi-jor, crab meat fried rice and pad si yu, but the entrée that keeps me coming again and again is the roast duck noodle soup! They give a good amount of noodles, thinly sliced duck meat, and Chinese bok choy in a very favorable broth. In addition to the quality of their food, customer service is always great and parking is easy to find. 5 stars!!
author: Julia K.

description:
This place is yummy and reasonably priced. 

Roast Duck Fried Rice and Tom Yum were delicious.
author: Mike G.

description: The food is pretty good but man oh man the people there are shady liars.  We were avid fans of this place and went in many times and the service is fine and they are open late.  BUT the delivery is something else! even when doing online ordering (where they don't have to try to write down your phone in order) they managed to screw up our delivery orders 4 or 5 times, we finally complained and they offered us a free meal the next time we ordered, which was cool-- but when we tried to redeem their offer, more than 2 hours passed and when we called to inquire they said it had already been delivered.  Well we didn't have any food but they insisted they gave us our food and we were wrong.  Well we never got that food or any attempt at compensation. They don't value the customer enough, we haven't been back since.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
Great Thai food in the middle of the Sunset District. Here are the faves:
Crab Fried Rice
Fried Catfish
YUM!!!
author: Jet V.

description:
Food: Delicious
Price: very affordable
Service: alright. Not superb but not lacking either

Nice to have a decent thai food option close to SFSU. Also appreciate that they're open late, so many places in Daly City close so early! So the trip to Irving is worth it. Curries are really good, I've had better pad thai before though. They should consider offering lunch specials, or perhaps discounts to college students :)
author: Nancy C.

description:
i brought my sister and brother here because she wanted thai food. i ate here once before with friends.

we ordered, spicy wings, pad thai, panang curry, anddd pad see ew.

I was craving chicken wings, soo yummm, yea....for 8 bucks....6 wings is not worth it..

the pad thai was okkayyy

the curry wasnt that flavorful.

pad see ew can always be a winner haha favorite and easiest thing to order.

there was only like one other group here, i guess they don't get that many ppl or it was slow hour....1pm? the waitress never looked happy when refilling our water or getting our check. the dude was nice though, at least he smiled! oh and the lil candy they give at the end....hahah tastes INTERESTING...there was a corn flavor...O_o yes...my brother ate it....tastes like corn juice he says....yup well it was fun for us to just talk, the food was ok...i'd come back if i was in the area....they're almost just like king of thai anyways
author: Christine M.

description: I like Chabaa.  I like it even better than Marnee (my husband doesn't, though).  And I like that they deliver, usually very quickly, though sometimes it takes 45 minutes - on rainy nights.  They are pretty consistent, and the food is tasty and it seems like they use decent quality ingredients.  If you are in the Sunset, and you want some decent Thai food delivered to your door, call them.
author: Cami B.

description:
The food here is okay. Nothing special to write home about. There is a reason why Marnee thai is packed with 15 -20 minute waits, and Chabaa Thai sits down the street nearly empty. 

The spicy wings can't even compare! Noodles are acceptable, and so was the soup. 

Just nothing special from this place, even though it has a nice decor. A fine alternative if you don't want to wait for Marnee Thai.
author: Josh M.

description: good food and good prices! definitely recommend to anyone in mood for Thai! :)
author: Manuel V.

description: Hey if you come all the way out, and Marnee Thai is a 30 min wait, walk down the block to Chabaa. The food is just as good and the items are about a dollar cheaper. I really like the green curry and pad thai.
author: Young M.

description: Their pineapple fried rice exceeded my expectations.  They will now regularly receive money from me in exchange for said pineapple fried rice.
author: Tim G.

description:
I love Chabaa. It's a great place to go late at night when you don't feel like eating crappy food. (No offense King Of Thai!)

The first time I went to Chabaa, my friends and I were starving and were just looking for somewhere to eat. The green sign caught my sister's attention and we made our choice. I loved the service and atmosphere so much that I ended up bringing many friends there. (I think I suggested Chabaa on 4-6 different  occasions.)

Now my friends are hooked and we frequently go there. (One of them even wrote a review, HI RYAN!) We absolutely love Joy, if you don't know what to order, she will definitely help you out.

What's holding me back from giving them 5 stars is that it's quite chilly inside and I don't like how they mop the floors while customers are still eating. But other than that, I love!
author: Yuri K.

description:
This is a delicious neighborhood place. Consistent menu, and tasty too.
It's a great place to bring kids. The pad thai is flavorful yet mild - a good choice for the youngins. Also - lots of space - for a group dinner or a toddler that likes to walk around.
author: rebecca c.

description:
This restaurant is in my neighborhood and I love the fact that they deliver pretty good thai food.  I've never eaten there but it definitely looks like a nice clean joint, plus its open late at night.  

The food that I have had there is flavorful and tasty.  I've had differnet curry dishes, spicy beef and the chicken wings and have never been disappointed.  I would say that I have had some better thai food in the city but  the fact that Chabaa will deliver their food to me makes it that much better.
author: JR P.

description: Great food to be had here, and being open late is a huge plus, especially in the Sunset where few things are open late.  One thing I particularly love about Chabaa is the delivery service.  The food is still great even when delivered, which is something I'm usually suspicious of / turned off by, but Chabaa really figured out how to make it still taste great and delicious.  Definitely worth a try if you're interested in eating in.
author: Madison P.

description: Great Thai food. Not sure why Marnee Thai always seems to be where it's at, although they are very good. But Chabaa can hold their own! There's much more space there, and although the decor isn't as cute or classy the place is very nice and so is the staff. Can't wait to go back.
author: Katie S.

description:
I attempted to order from their website thinking it would be really easy, but my order was not going through.  After calling them, they reset something and my order was finally able to go through.  Although I was a bit annoyed, I understood.  What I could not understand however was why my food took more than 2 hours to be delivered.  To make matters worse, the delivery guy forgot to bring our thai iced tea...  The restaurant apologized for the delay in food delivery but kept saying it was because they were really busy and receiving a lot of orders that night.  Whatever the reason, it's false advertising to say that you'll deliver in 45 minutes!  Needless to say, will NOT be ordering from here again.  I thought ordering food online from them would be easy, but it turned into a hugely frustrating 2+ hour ordeal.

In terms of the food, the duck fried rice and green curry were decent.  The angel chicken wings were ridiculously dry...maybe it's because it was probably sitting around for 2 hours before we got it?
author: Shirley J.

description:
I came here for a late dinner with my gf and friend. We were almost immediately seated and given a menu.A few minutes later we were then asked to move so they could sit a larger party where we were sitting. I was okay with this since they were really nice about it and didn't force us to move.

We ordered the following:

Pad Thai - Strong smell of fish sauce but okay
Pad Si Yu (yes this is how the spell it on the menu) Tasted like really good chow fun but I could taste the msg
Red Duck Curry - Good but i didn't see much duck
Peanut Sauce Chicken with vegetables - Peanutty

Overall quick "fast food" type of thai place.
author: Brian W.

description: Delivery guy is greedy!!  I gave him a reasonable tip for delivering the food, and he complained because it was not 15% of the bill - he thinks he is a waiter??  I have never had a delivery guy complain about getting a tip at all.  This guy needs to go
author: S B.

description:
This has grown to be one of my favorite restaurants! A friend introduced us to this place and now I'm hooked. I tried to think of something bad to knock down the rating and I couldn't think of a thing... there IS the nasty candy they give you with your bill, but usually I just leave it aside.

First off, I've never found parking to be a problem and I've usually been seated immediately. However, usually I come here for dinner so I can't speak up for the lunch-time crowds. 

The service has been good... waiters are attentive.

The corn cake appetizer is great! It's always fresh and slightly crispy with a yummy sauce. The Thai Ice Coffee is always good and my friends who get the Thai Iced Tea like it. Usually I order Pad See Ew or one of the Fried Rice dishes and always enjoy what I order. 

I've also tried the dessert here once... I can't remember exactly what we ordered, but I remember that it was good and gone fast.

Great food for really reasonable prices!
author: Autumn P.

description:
i felt the food was great, but the service,..... is a different story. we went in for a late lunch and the waitresses werent attentative at all. we were never greeted, we had to seat ourselves, we werent catered to at all, no refills for our waters, our check came back after years of waiting... not a very good first impression. 
whats really funny, was that the family across from us were taken care of frequently from the waitresses. Both of them. uhhhh really?? im not one to bitch about a place, but never coming back here. peace&love
author: sam k.

description: After spending a little time in quiet Petaluma, my friends and I decided to come here for dinner. The service was good and the food was good. Overall I enjoyed this place. I would come back again.
author: Damien T.

description:
4-5 stars? really?

i prefer osha's and marnee over this place any day. crab fried rice was plain...all it consisted were teeny bits of crab meat & scrambled eggs. ehhh.

pat si yu "pad see ew" - meh. had much better. they don't give u the whole chinese broccoli with this...just thin slices of it and the meat was dry.

me don't like. sowee.
author: Rosalynn D.

description: Chabaa Thai's Pad Thai is the best I've had anywhere, and their coconut soup is also just as amazing.  They only get 4 stars because their Thai fried rice is a bummer, and that is one of my favorite things.  Bummer.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
Fabulous. Tasty. Cheap. 

If you love Thai food, come to this incredible spot! We split the Green curry with prawns and the Pad Kee Mao with chicken. Whatever they did to those noodles to make them so gummy and tasty was magical. I don't really want to know what chemicals/oils went into production but I don't care.

Can't even decide which of the dishes was better. Both were awesome, and I think I would drive all the way to SF just for this downright delicious, delightful value of a meal.
author: Rachel V.

description: I come so often to Chabaa that the waitresses know my order and just ask me if I would like my "usual". Wonderful! They also bring me fresh peppers to eat along side with the pickled peppers in the jar. I love it!
author: Julie F.

description: I go to Bangkok for the dessert, but I always rely on Chabaa for the soups, specifically the pork and fish ball noodle soup with rice noodles. Either I have not found this soup at all at other Thai restaurants or they don't prepare it as well as Chabaa does. To start, it's always warm inside, service is fast, the employees will remember what you like and how you like after about your third visit, the food is delicious, and the price is soooo right, especially in today's economy. Seriously, I probably go here 1-2 times a week. In the winter time, this soup will warm you up and calm you down from a hard day. You have to try Chabaa!!
author: Lizzy C.

description:
circa 1995, i had my first thai meal. wow, what crazy flavors, what interesting tastes.... but wait 

"i thought this was supposed to be spicy?"

up till around 2001........ yeah 

"can i get my tom yum goong extra spicy"

....and till now, im thinking 

"this is a really good tomato-y shrimp-y soup with a kick. "

2001, seoul, south korea, location.... so a buddy finds out i like thai food. we go to her favorite thai joint.

apparently the owner moved to korea in his 20s, worked odd jobs here and there and saved up enough to open up this place. 

now, take note, he never went to any "western" countries.... his thai food isnt pussified, american palate thai...

me : can i get my tom yum goong extra spicy?

buddy: are you crazy? regular is too spicy for me.

granted i DO eat spicier food than her, but i did not have any idea what i was getting myself into.

me : oh i get it extra spicy all the time. 

......

few sips

BEER SOMEONE GET ME A FREAKING BEER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

chabaa reminded me of this awesome experience. i forgotten what REAL thai extra spicy can do. actually, i didnt know you could get that kind of spicy here stateside. i asked a few times at different places throughout the country... meh.....

here at chabaa?

i was sweating..... my hair went flat........ i felt drops of sweat dripping down my back..... the nice little waitress kept coming by to check up on us, 

"see i told you, too spicy... never tell a thai person you like spicy....."

apparently this was four chilis

she likes five

they go up to seven.

now thats some good tom yum goong. hahaha no, it really was.....beyond being the hell broth spice of death, it was actually pretty good. i just wish they used mushrooms other than button. for some reason, button mushrooms dont scream thai to me. 

i also liked their duck fried rice.. come on, duck. fried. rice. simple, good. 

i really cant speak for anything else, im just really happy to find a place that will make the tom yum goong the way i like it, nuclear. 

3.5 rounded up for the nice, funny waitress.
author: Euge L.

description: Just picked up an order from here so I can't really speak on the service but the food was pretty good. The pad kee mao was just ok. Nothing spectacular, but edible. The panaang curry was quite good though. Also liked the peanut sauce. I tried to order online originally, but after going through the process, and finally trying to put the order through I was told the restaurant "couldn't be contacted", no biggie but kind of annoying. I'll go try it again, but not immediately.
author: Parker H.

description:
In a cold Sunset weekend evening, the place is pretty empty compares to the restaurants near by.  We have ate around this area many times but never have stepped in here but today we feel bold.  There are 6 table being occupied.  We didn't see what other people have ordered, but what we ordered wasn't that good.  First of all, we are attracted by the nice decor.  Its interior has a calm feeling about it.  The wood benches and table is rustic.  Then the food arrived, its kind of amateurish, portions small.
I remembered reading a yelp review saying the portions are just right.  I guess it translated into "small."
The food itself is unbelievably salty.  I am not the one shy with salty food, I love salt on everything.  I am the one who pour soy sauce on everything and craves potato chips often.  But oh no my noodles are off puttingly salty.
I tried my friends' chicken and rice.  It has a nice spicy flavor  Nicely executed, but yet again too salty.  I think there's something wrong with the chef's palette, his taste bud must have been lost. He some how didn't know how salty it is.
Maybe the portions justifies the saltiness, you really can't eat much of it.  
My dish descriptions has green beans in it but there was none.  I find the dish lack certain other ingredients in it that I have tasted somewhere else.Sprouts,? basil?  carrots?  green onions .I don't remembered.   Besides being salty, its missing some ingredients...... where did it go? 
Over all disappointing, considering there are so many Thai choices in the area.  There are how many KIng of Thais?  Marnee ? and other Moms and Pops kind of place which can blow this place apart.
I can't imagine yelp will give it 4 star.  Somehow this is not even close.
author: Lantz G.

description: I had a great experience at this place, we had the green curry chicken and it was delicious, along with the chicken fried rice. We got the food togo and it the service was very fast, although we were the only customers. The price is average, not super cheap but worth the money. I would definitely return if ever in the area. The parking in this area is horrible I have to warn you.
author: Leslie A.

description: ive been living in sf all my life, and i have to say, chabaa is my favorite thai restaurant. all of the food is great and they stay open all the way till 1am. definitely the best place for a late night meal if you got out of work late.
author: Brian T.

description: Umm..not sure what to think of this place. They didn't give my change back after I paid for my takeout. They were too busy talking to each other I guess.  It also took forever to acknowledge me and give me my takeout. On top of all that the food was just OK.
author: Sophia C.

description: Nice place. Average Thai food. OF COURSE better than King of Thai, but not as good as Vanida Thai Kitchen on Taraval =)
author: M J.

description: I have been to this place probably a billions times by now and I have to say  I LOVE THIS PLACE! Service is great, staff is friendly, and food is AWESOME! I remember coming here around 12:45a.m. (they close at 1:00a.m.) and the still welcomed me in (as you may know other places would lock me out; since there kitchen is probably closed)!
author: A L.

description:
I'm Thai.

I'm picky.

I'm a regular.

So are my friends.

As authentic as you can get.

My favorites: Tom yum soup with chicken, duck fried rice, tom yum noodle soup, yellow curry, tom kha soup...ok, so I love all of the dishes I've tried here so far. 

Super clean, decorative, and friendly ambiance. They also deliver! After trying many Thai restaurants up here, this has been the only place I've found that's comparable to the Thai restaurants back home in LA. Life isn't so bad now that I've found this place.  Chabaa rocks!
author: Spicy T.

description:
food was overpriced. service was bleh! and the food was just okay. just go to marnee thai. food taste better over there and its only a couple blocks away.

i still want to try to chicken wings tho...
author: B B.

description:
This place will blow your stomach away! Thai food has never tasted as good. Their customer service is outstanding. The food wait is not long. The bathrooms are clean. The neighborhood is convenient. Plenty of street parking spaces (if you are early). Overall I highly recommend this place if you are ever craving for Thai food. I had the panang beef over steam rice, and friends ordered a variety of entrees, curries, appetizers and all were very amazing! Bravo Chabaa!

+1 star = Great food
+1 star = Great customer service
+1 star = Cleanliness
+1 star = Great safe neighborhood
+1 star = plenty of street parking
author: Joremel A.

description: Chabaa takes the place of Thai Spice, which stood in the shadow of Marnee Thai a few doors away but unlike Spice, Chabaa emerges from the shadow of its pretentious neighbor. The service is good and the food even better. You need not suffer the yelling of an owner gone wild (Marnee's) to enjoy Thai in the Sunset.
author: David D.

description: This is ,so far, my favorite Thai place.  This place is comparable to King of Thai, they are open late and are cheep but the atmosphere and food is SO much better and they take credit cards!
author: Allie S.

description:
If I went to this place to sit down and eat I might have given it 4 stars, but since I always order delivery, and it is honestly the best delivery I can get that isn't pizza, 5 stars it is. The minimum delivery of $20 is only a bummer if you are ordering for only one person.  When ordering for two it usually is pretty easy to hit the mark.

I've ordered a bit here and there from the menu until my boyfriend and I settled on "the usual" as we are prone to doing.  Everything we've ever tried from here has always been well prepared and had quality ingredients, some of it just doesn't fit our tastes.  

The best thing about the food, in my opinion, is that it is consistent.  I hate when the food from any restaurant is really good one day, and then is terrible the next.  Having ordered from Chabaa at least 20 times now, I can say that isn't the case, the food is always just as good as it was the last time I ordered.  

Since it has been awhile since I have ordered anything other than 'the usual', it is the only thing I feel comfortable talking about.

I normally get the yellow curry and my boyfriend, the pad thai, both with chicken.  The yellow curry is really good,not too sweet or spicy.   It has just enough of a kick to make my nose water a bit, which for me is perfect.  The potatoes in the curry are usually undercooked though, I think they've only come fully cooked once, but there is always a good amount of chicken, which is properly cooked.  The pad thai is seasoned perfectly, always has plenty of chicken and fried tofu, though sometimes I do wish it has a little more peanut flavor, but my boyfriend is always happy with it.  

We also typically get a fried rice, which is the same rice base topped with whatever 'other' you order.  We've tried all the options that don't have pork or beef in them.  By far our favorite is either the duck or the fried chicken, typically there is only one breast/cutlet.  My last personal favorite are the egg rolls, I love the noodles that are inside of them.  My boyfriend really likes the fish cakes.  

The chicken for everything seems to be the same thinly sliced chicken that looks like it was steamed, maybe poached, I'm not sure.  It isn't tough or anything like that, but it hasn't had time to pick up the flavor of whatever you order it in either, which can make it out of place in some of the soups.  It is always white meat though, which I think tastes better in the food we normally get than dark meat would.

From time to time I get the mango with sweet sticky rice as dessert.  The amount of mango it comes with seems to be determined by the season.  When they are in season it comes with a whole, pretty good sized mango.  When off season, usually a half of a large mango or a whole small one arrives.   The sticky rice is flavored very well, not too sweet, and it is wrapped separately.  This is really nice if you are like me and can never eat dessert with your meal because you are always stuffed, but you like your sweet sticky rice warm and your mango cold.  It also comes with a little sweetened coconut milk to pour over everything.

Again, definitely, by far, the best delivery I've managed to get in my neck of the woods, oh, which is Parkside btw.  Good, consistent food, and the people that run the place are really nice.   One of these days I may even make the trip to eat at the restaurant too.
author: Loni B.

description: I always order Pad thai whenever I am at any Thai restaurant[period] . I got the veggie one and my friend got the beef one. It seemed like he had more beef then I had veggies in my pad thai?? Why is that! Anyways the pad thai was edible, but not my favorite. It was tooo sweet. I should have asked for a lime. My friend smelled his dish before he ate it and he knew at an instant that it wasn't good, so he just picked out all of the beef from the pad thai. And we got the leftovers and left them on the street for a homeless person to find. I do not think I will be coming back here again..
author: Janet Z.

description:
Duck breast soup's new name = Duck fat skin soup 
Where is the duck

       Chabba used to have great Roasted Duck noodle soup. The first time I had it, it had decent chunks duck breast meat, the broth was so aromatic that it caused me to return 2x more. I wanted to take my mom there.  However, the recent two trips my soup had few vegetables and mostly duck skin fat with few pieces duck breast meat. They have become stingy. I went there a third time and had hoped the second time was a fluke, I wanted to make sure it would be back to good.  But it got worse on the third visit. Less vegetable, barely any breast meat. And they fill the soup only half full. I am not going to treat my mom duck fat soup. I ended up just taking the soup home, it was so fatty I was afraid to eat it.   I probably will not order the duck soup again.
author: A Z.

description: This place is fast becoming my band's place to go to after practice. Great Thai food, and open until 1am! What could be better! I've been enjoying the Tom Yum soup lately as it's getting a little chilly out these days...
author: Carmen C.

description: Quick stop thai food. I like how it's open late and I can drop by anytime. Their chili is amazing but it kind of kills off my taste buds. I guess it's a love hate kind of thing.
author: Jon W.

description: Great late night Thai food, friendly service and a clean atmosphere is hard to find. This place is a gem.
author: Ryan N.

description:
I'm a Thai food addict and I have to say that this place is an o.k. restaurant. The services and atmostphere are great and Food are also great but the reason for 3 stars not 4 was that I have experienced better Thai food in some other Thai restaurants in the area. 

I like their curries but the Pad Thai was a little bit disappointing as it was too greasy to my taste. 

Based on other reviews, I think it's worth coming back for other dishes, anyway.
author: Sonia O.

description: Chabaa, an unassuming little shoebox of a place with earth tone walls and a surprising lack of crowds for a saturday night, is not a place that gets your expectations particularly high, so it was a welcome surprise when they brought me the best-tasting thai curry in San Francisco (though, admittedly, I haven't sampled much competition yet).  Some thai curry sauces have a tendency to cop out by over-relying on either spiciness or creaminess, but Chabaa's nails both aspects (I had the red curry, but also got to try a bit of panang and tom ka soup--amazingly consistent).  Throw in the crisp veggies and chewy rice, and you've got everything you need.  It'll be very interesting to see how it compares to Marnee's.  One word of advice: don't let them sit you by the door, unless you have a wool coat on you and don't mind wearing it.
author: Wes M.

description: I just recently moved to the inner sunset, and this is one of a handful of really good Thai restaurants in the area. The restaurant is small, but the portions are large. The staff is very friendly, the food is delicious, and the prices are reasonable. Unlinke many of the restaurants in the area, this spot is open until 11 pm during the week and midnight on the weekends. Whether you are dining-in or just grabbing some quick take-out food, I would highly recommend this location.
author: Michael H.

description:
Dear Chabaa Thai managers,

First of all, I love your food and until now I was mostly satisfied with your delivery service.  However, tonight I placed my web order 65 minutes ago and still haven't received my delivery. 

Here is good customer service ( your sales and marketing)...
lesson #1:
Why did I have to call you to find out if my order is on its way?  Why didn't I get a courtesy call letting me know that you were going to be really late?

OK...now I have been waiting 75 minutes.....

lesson #2:
I have spent SEVERAL HUNDRED DOLLARS on web orders over the last few months.  I am a really good customer.  You should treat your really good customers better so they will continue to do business with you.

Doorbell just rang....85 minutes later......

Bland and insincere 'sorry i had a lot of orders' from driver

Food is lukewarm...not surprised.

lesson #3:
It is ALWAYS more expensive to get a customer back than to treat them right.  I placed my last web order with you tonight until you reach out to me and apologize for your bad service.  Any good business should be able to figure out  who I am from my Yelp review name + my zip code + my frequent web orders + knowing how late you were and that I called to find out what happened to my order.  Goodbye until then.

J
author: Jim H.

description: Get the pork neck, it goes so well with the dipping sauce, totally drool worthy. The duck fried rice was ok, the rice could have been more flavorful, they did give a decent amount of duck though. The red curry was bland, needed to be tastier.
author: San X.

description: A couple of friends and I found came to this place because Marnie Thai was totally packed. I am so happy it was. This place is the ultimate place for thai food. I only get the pad thai, spicy chicken wings and satay chicken. TOTALLY GOOD! I really like their complementary tea( hot thai tea). And their desserts are the greatest. Only flaw is the parking. Its pretty tough to find parking around the area, but most of the time, my friends and I get pretty lucky.
author: Lainy P.

description: This place doesn't get enough credit, what with Marnee being so close by, but it deserves more good reviews and as a resident of the neighborhood, I eat here more often than anywhere else.  The atmosphere feels relaxed and relatively spacious, they have great pad kee mao, and I'm a big fan of their appetizers.  Their fried tofu, corn cakes, and Thai pancakes are all particularly good.
author: A J.

description: My boyfriend and I love this place. Especially when it's late, we're hungry, and we're too tired to cook. The prices are excellent, the pad-see-yu is excellent, and the customer service is excellent! The nice decor is also a plus. I've recently moved from the Sunset to Nob Hill so I'm sad Chabaa Thai won't be walking distance any more but I will be back!
author: Jamie W.

description: I love coming here! Their thai food is so yummy...better than king of thai. I can never go wrong with their green curry. Some of my other faves is the Pad Kee Mao, Pad Thai, Papaya Salad, and any of their fried rices. Just thinking about chabaa is making my stomach growl!
author: Suzan L.

description: Okay place. I came here after the super bowl game at a bar near by. We were hungry so we stopped by. The food was okay, but not great. Service was okay and the price was decent.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
chabaa is one of my favorite thai places in the city and a extra star bringing it up to 5 because tuttimelon is right across the street so i can get my tarty froyo for dessert. this is like a comfort place for me :) 

friend: i'm hungry lets go eat
me: chabba?
friend: ooooo and tuttimelon afterwards 
together: YAY!

this conversation so many times ahahaha :)
author: esther k.

description: I usually order red curry after learning how to cook pad thai myself. Cute place, wait staff were friendly. Quick lunch or dinner. a-OK
author: Tiff W.

description: I really really liked this place! It's so rad that they're open late...I'm always looking for places that are open past 10. There's easy parking, the decor is really pretty (I love those glass lamps), the waitstaff were all friendly and attentive, the menu's got old favorites and new stuff I haven't tried, and everything was delicious (I had the raad na and he had the duck fried rice). Plus they gave us this really cool salty plum candy with our check. And the bathrooms and kitchen area (which you kind of go through to get to the bathroom) look really clean. I'll totally be back!
author: Lynae Z.

description: Chabaa is the best Thai cuisine restaurant ! Their  Fried rice (any kind of ) is soooooo delicious , much better than King of Thai, I dont know why a lot of ppl like King of thai, their fried rice is like garbage compare to Chabaa's, not only theirs, I thinks Chabaa's Fried Rice is the best in all of the Thai restaurants I have been to. highly recommend!
author: Sophia l.

description: This review is for take out only.  I agree with Tony L. that Chabaa is just a glorified King of Thai Noodle House.  The menu is very similar to that at the various KOTs around the city.  I've had the Tom Ka soup with chicken, the Tom Yum soup with chicken, the spicy chicken wings, and the Pad Prik King with tofu rice plate. Of the above, I would only order the Tom Ka chicken soup again. Solid three stars.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: Very clean place, great food, great service...the waiters are really nice and friendly. Needless to say...its good as it is but not perfect.
author: Clementine D.

description:
i know a lot of good thai places, and this has to be my 2nd favorite. theyre curry is on point and their pad thais are yummy. their waitesses are cute and nice. very clean. clean restrooms and kitchen (you can see it as you go to the restrooms). the one thing that sets this place apart from all the other ones is their desert. THAI ICE TEA ICE CREAM. ive never had or even heard they made that before. the 2nd part of why i love this place is that its QUIET. 

HIGHLIGHTS: Silence, flavorful currys and pad thais,and desert
author: Anthony M.

description: The decor is simple, the place is clean, and the staff is very friendly.  The food is good, too.  I like their papaya salad and a noodle dish I can't remember the name of, but it has vegetables and tofu (maybe palak praneer or something like that).  I prefer going here over Marni Thai (even though I prefer Marnee Thai's food) because at Marnee Thai  I have to yell to be heard and am basically on top of my neighbors, since the seating is so crowded.  This is a good place to get some decent Thai for your money.
author: Liza W.

description: Perfect if you are looking for late night fare that's savory and very un-fast food-like. I have only good things to say about this place. They are really friendly and attentive, and the food comes hot, fast, and delicious. The decor/ambiance is simple and clean. I am definitely a fan!
author: S P.

description: I like their food. The calamari salad is pretty good. Fried rice and pad thai are pretty good, too. Their angel wings are not bad but the flavor just on the surface of the chicken wings. I like how they offer two types of Thai beer. Staff is very friendly.
author: Mike S.

description: A mountain of Thai food. This place is a 4 star if you don't take that into account. If you are seriously malnourished and are craving Thai, $7 gets you food for your next two meals and a nice round, impregnated-looking belly.
author: Haz O.

description: Nice, clean, open restaurant right on Irving St. It's very much like King Of Thai, except a lot cleaner, more relaxing and quiet. The staff there is really nice too. The dishes are about the same price as King Of Thai, and they also offer a lot more vegetarian dishes. The appetizers aren't too great, but the noodle and rice dishes are really yummy. Another bonus: they are open really late...I think until 1am, so its great for midnight snacking, followed by some tapioca drinks for dessert!
author: Jessica h.

description:
delicious food
#36 was so hearty, yet still light.
the tom yum soup was great
the red curry with beef was so thick- and if there is one thing that bothers me-it is the watery type curry sauce---not there though, nice and thick
loved it!
author: Pug P.

description: Nice, comfortable place to eat. Good food, friendly service and Joy is a cutie ;)
author: Mark K.

description: I came here when they first open about 2 years ago.  Since then the food quality has stayed the same with the portion size decreasing slightly.  I usually visit once a month and the food is always good.  The staff is attentive and friendly.
author: Alex W.

description: my experience here was very odd and unusual. I liked my experience. The food was alright but it didn't excite me. I didn't leave the place wanting more. Although it was a great place for vegetarian because they got a section for vegetarian food. But I would recommend this place for some Thai food.
author: Lu G.

description: Good food and friendly service. I've had the curry chicken, Thai fried rice, pad Thai- these are the usual dishes that I get to rate any Thai place. All of which were good. I like the openness and cleanliness of the restaurant. The place is also opened late(1am) for all of the night owls who got the craving for some good curry.
author: Bert T.

description: This place made King of Thai look like Denny's on a late saturday night. Because I always went to King of Thai with friends when we had nowhere else to eat. Chabaa has converted me. Their service is better, and I enjoy my food more when the service is equal or greater than the dish. I have to thank my friend Yuri for taking me to Chabaa, she recommended some really nice desserts. Go for the Roti, don't even think about eating at Chabaa without ordering Roti after, or the mango with sweet rice... Oh man, that sweet rice put me into a great mood after eating. And usually I'm in a bad mood after eating because I screw up my metabolism a lot when eating out. This place may likely screw up my metabolism a lot more often now too, but hey... I won't be upset. Five stars for converting me!
author: Ryan R.

description: If you enjoy the authentic Thai food at Sai Jai Thai in the Tenderloin, you'll love this place.  We're talking the outer Sunset as opposed to the Tenderloin so that's comparing apples to oranges in terms of style, ambience, and neighborhood cleanliness and safety.  The service is very attentive and polite.  Try the duck larb and the special Thai sausages.  There's a special menu written in Thai, so make sure and go with one of your Thai reading friends for the northeast country style specialties that are available.
author: Ric S.

description: It's your average thai place, it's open late, and they deliver. So stars for the convenience, but nothing to write home about. Pad thai, fried rice, chicken wings, all average, yep.
author: Jasmine O.

description: Had to come here to since Marnee Thai was closed. I guess the good thing about this place is that they open late, even on the weekdays. We ordered the Panang Curry with beef, Pad thai, steam rice and TWO Thai iced teas. The Panang Curry was good , but the pad thai was really bland and tasteless. Also they only gave out one of our 2 thai teas, and when she came out with the second one we were already done eating our meal! Does it really take that long to make thai tea! Well 3 stars for this place ...for now.....
author: Wooodis D.

description: MMMMMMM......i just moved to the sunset and this is my very first restaurant so i had a lot riding on this initial experience....i was walking down irving and was hungry soooo i came upon this spot...it looked clean from the outside so i looked over the menu...found what i always get when i go to thai food....pad ma kuer....i looovvveee eggplant.....i went ahead and had this one with chicken .....it came out fast and hot....delicious and just the right portion...not much to say about it though...i wish it were a little bit spicier but next time ill just ask....friendly staff good prices and a great location(for me anyways lol)...im stoked that i have a great neighborhood thai spot...oh ya fyi they only accept cc if its over $15...
author: shannon b.

description: Our go-to delivery place; as often as we order from them, I should probably add the delivery drivers to my Xmas card list.  Great prices, consistent quality food, and delivery is frighteningly fast.  We've gone in a couple times, and the quality was just as solid (in all honesty, if I am going to leave the house, I would go a block down to Marnee Thai).  I'm a customer for as long as they'll have me.
author: Brendon O.

description: First off! The A+ version of King of Thai. I hate King of Thai now ever since I discovered Chabaa! Knowing that Chabaa opens just as late as K.O.T makes me have another reason for coming here. Not only is the food good, the hours of the business is great as well. You can have a late nice dinner at a Thai place without being harassed by men in purple. The atmosphere at Chabaa actually have a Thai essence to it. I would come back and I would totally recommend this place to my friends. No doubt! I would totally come back whenever I want a PAD THAI! The pad thai here is great. Really nice peanuty background to it.
author: Johnny T.

description: Great crab fried rice and shrimp pad Thai!
author: Tina L.

description: Ive been here many times and loved the food every time. The prices are good and the portions are great. I usually get pad thai and thai ice tea, while my gf gets something random from the menu, and even though she picks something by random, it always comes out tasty. the restaurant is clean and the service is good. will definitely come back soon!
author: Danny Y.

description: My favorite place in all of sf. Great food, perfect vibe, wonderful service.
author: Carlos L.

description: Being a new father and shunned from sit-down restaurants due to my proximity to our newborn girl we've started to explore the world of food delivery. Chabaa was our first experience with delivered Thai food. I looked them up on Yelp but having no menu just ordered some of the Thai standards, Green Curry & Tom Kha both with fried tofu and Veggie Pad Thai. We were glad to hear they had brown rice as an option as well. All the food was promised in 45 minutes but it arrived in 25 minutes. Everything was well packaged, no leaky messes. Above all, the food was great! I really love Marnee Thai on 9th Ave, this is not *that* good but for standard Thai food, it was totally great. The fact that it was delivered made it most excellent. We'll totally eat here again and perhaps try something new since we have a menu now :)
author: Bill S.

description: This is my second favorite thai restaurant right behind Marnee Thai. I ordered here on christmas day because marnee was closed. I love the pad see yu and pad kee mao. I actually prefer the pad kee mao here over marnee. It is darker here for some reason and not as tomatoey. I also tried papaya salad for the first time. Not exactly my favorite because i am a meat eater but would not mind having it again. It was pretty spicy even for me.(i love spicy food). Dont know how the prices compare the marnee but cant be that far off. I love how they have online ordering.
author: KC F.

description:
Chabaa is a restaurant that looks like someone spent a lot of time and thought creating.  It's clean, has very nice decor, and a great menu with pictures of their delectable eats.  So why the three stars?  My boyfriend and I used to order here A LOT.  Like once or twice a week.  We loved it, it was cheap, and they delivered so there really wasn't a reason not to.  BUT, the last time I ordered from there it took an hour and a half for my order to come!  (It's only supposed to take 45 min)  I called and asked them where my food was and they weren't particularly friendly or apologetic.  When the food finally came it was cold and flavorless and extremely sludgy and oily..  Like so gross that I didn't even eat it.  I haven't been back since and I have to say I'm pretty disappointed.  One of these days I'll write them a letter of complaint.  

I still gave three starts because every other time I ate there it was great.  I recommend getting the pad ma keur a la carte with a side of sticky rice.  Also, the bbq pork soup with vermicelli noodles is soooo good.  They're also happy to accommodate you when it comes to spiciness (my boyfriend can't handle the thai chilis).  I would recommend eating at the restaurant instead of ordering delivery (ever since my bad experience).  Overall Chabaa is a great little restaurant when you want some of your favorite thai staples.
author: Mira D.

description:
my friend introduced me to this place.

the decor is unique and the colors make it very homey.

i usually go here late at night so props for that! my friends and i usually look for something to eat after and event or just a long night. i suggest this place because i LOVE thai food and i know its open later than our usually spots.

some items i've had:
prawns in a blanket -- i love seafood and i love how the prawns are giant!
tom ka -- it was perfect when i was feeling under the weather and wanted something sweet and salty. the first time my boyfriend had thai soup and he loved it here. i like how there wasn't too much going on in the soup like i've had at other thai restaurants.
pad thai -- my staple at thai restaurants. it was delish!
i've also had the pad si-yu and fried chicken over fried rice.

but my favorite is desert. i love love love desert and i love the roti with ice cream! i love roti and i love ice cream. i've tried it other places but no one makes it like Chabaa!
author: Jenna R.

description: The good: Attentive service, free tea with meals, and the menu has pictures of the food so you can see what you're ordering.  Prices are reasonable, about $6-8 a dish and portions are hearty.  The bad: There isn't really anything bad about this place.  However, the food is average, nothing to really set it apart from the million other Thai restaurants in SF.
author: Swirls L.

description: Coming from New York where everyone delivers, to San Francisco where no one does has been a shock.  I'd resigned myself to thinking that the pizza delivery guy, UPS and my postal worker were the only delivery people who would ever cross the threshold of my front porch.  Then came you, Chabaa.  Your tasty pad thai and your yummy tom yum were delivered to me hot and and before the 30 minute time window the guy gave me when I phoned in my order.  I was so happy that I overlooked the fact that your price was a bit higher than I'd hoped.  I know, I know, I can't have it all.  Thank you for delivering, my sweet little Chabaa, I hope to see you on my front porch again soon!
author: Luna K.

description: This is our default thai place we eat before a long night of drinking or just being lazy.  Normally I am just lazy.  I usually order the duck fried rice and pad see EWE for myself.  I make the manatee watch me but she ends up eating the entire box of duck fried rice.  Regular manatees don't eat duck but only the fat ones do.  They don't deliver until after 5pm and there is a minimum order.  Kinda sucks but I am too lazy to walk 5 blocks.  Sucks to be fat.
author: Fatty A.

description: This is a great restaurant, why wait and be cramped at the place down the street, I won't name names. I like that is it casual and the food is very authentic. Not fancy or over the top impressive, but just like the food I had in Thailand.
author: michael w.

description: Came here twice and was disapponited both times.  The flat rice niodles were overcooked, the soup tasted like fish sauce mixed with water and the green papaya salad was very bland.  We also ordered the Thai iced tea and that was good.  The Pad Thai was also decent.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Awesome food selection and clean dining area! I love the pad thai here. Make sure to ask for no MSG in your food!
author: Jj H.

description: I am always on the lookout for restaurants open late since I work nights.... so I was VERY happy when I came across this place that stays open til 1am in the SUNSET!!!! that's totally unheard of! AND the food is good :)  I ordered the prawn rice noodle salad and the basc chicken curry. Only reason why I'm not giving 5 stars is cause my prawns were not cooked all the way through. I can eat raw shrimp of it's meant to be raw.... Not when they are warm and half raw ;p but the flavors were so good that I just dumped the shrimp and ate the noodles :-D
author: Marina K.

description: Good range of vegetarian dishes and open late (I think the waitress said they're open until 1 am every day).  My friends had noodle soups and liked them.  I had a tofu/eggplant/basil dish with brown rice.  My food was had good flavor, but it was a bit heavy on the oil, sauce, and salt (probably because of too much sauce).  Seems a decent late-night option.
author: Michelle T.

description: nice place, very friendly people, good food, price is ok too. And just like Crystal L said, they gave us hot tea immediately after we sat down. I ordered their Pad Ghar Pouw (spelling?!) and it is tasty. Generous portion (for me) . Definitely will return to try other dishes
author: Maria H.

description:
i came here on valentines day for a late lunch and have been coming here ever since!! me and my friend stumbled upon this restaurant.. we were actually looking for marnee thai and we thought that chabaa had taken over or something.. anyways.. im so glad we decided to give this place a try because the food is good and its cheap and i'd eat here over marnee anyday

i love the duck fried and pad thai here.. and leave room for dessert because you have to try the fried banana with coconut ice cream.. they close at 1am so its also good for late night dining
author: JUDY L.

description: Pretty good thai food and some fantastic thai food. The Tom Kar Gai was fantastic, and I never imagined it would be so huge, more than enough for 2 people for just $6. They may want to rethink how they name some of these dishes, like the Gae Tue Lord. It was pretty good, but made me feel kinda funny to eat it!
author: Irene F.

description:
My friends and I came here as we were in the neighborhood and someone wanted fried banana. We went in and asked if it was OK to order just dessert and initially they were fine with it, but soon after they came for us to take the order the attitude kicked in.
Although the attitude was not the worst part of all it was their dessert, we order the mango sticky rice which was decent but I definitely had much better somewhere else. I usually like it when the rice is warm and sticky while the mango is cold and fresh, but we got a room temp rice and room temp mango.
We also order the fried banana with Thai ice tea ice cream, which was incredibly disgusting. The banana was clearly fried a while ago and they just poped in the microwave to warm it up because the batter was mushy and the banana was almost liquidfy.  The Thai ice tea ice cream was clearly water down cause it was full of ice crystal and crunchy ice cream is just not  "good eats"
Obviously my review does not reflect their food but as for their dessert please just walk across the street for some frozen yogurt at Tutti Melon.
author: Andres K.

description: I stopped here for lunch a few years ago, after walking Bay to Breakers, and I remembered liking the place a lot. The place was cozy and the staff was friendly. The food was what you would expect from a reasonable Thai restaurant; they had the usual dishes, made fresh, in reasonable portions.
author: Barn M.

description: I always get the egg rolls and the chicken with fried rice deal. I love thai iced tea and this place has the best.
author: Dina M.
