description: Excellent food, excellent service, and great prices.   What more can you ask for?  Gra Prow fried rice w/ egg on top is my fave!  Also good is the beef stew noodle soup.
author: Allen L.

description:
my best Thai restaurant at the moment. 
it is rare for me to give a business five stars. 
in case you wondering, why ? 
because Chabaa is the only one who open until 1 am from monday-sunday without driving more than 10 minutes. 
because chabaa has such a broad selection that i can choose from.
because chabaa has hoi-jor and FBI ! ( a good one too ! )
because chabaa deliver to my house.. 
because chabaa give me a whole new perspective of how Thai restaurant supposed to be (*-*)
author: sherly A.

description: Hmmmm....I still dream about the tom-yum noodle soup I ordered. I love tom-yum Thai noodle soup and I've sampled many in the Bay Area and in Thailand and I've found this restaurant to make a to-die for combination of flavors. I was surprised at the light coloration of the broth and worried about its flavor, but it had just the right amount of tanginess and spice along with perfectly cooked vermicelli noodles. I would eat there all the time except its quite a distance from where I live but it won't stop me from returning in the near future.
author: Royce L.

description:
I dig the glowing green awning and the curry red, green and yellow color scheme of the interior. Our party of five had the
- Appetizer Combo plate: the most interesting tasting appetizer in the combo was the Thai Fish cake with the chopped green beans.
- Papaya Salad: Tasty spicy salad of shredded green beans, tomatoes, peanuts, and lettuce. It ain't huge like an American salad.
- Tom Yum Hot and Sour Soup: I liked it a lot better than Chinese Hot and Sour Soup because it doesn't taste vinegary; lime is the most powerful flavor in the soup.
- Pad Gra Pow: Ground chicken sauteed with bell pepper, chile and sweet basil. I wished it was little more basily, but everyone enjoyed it.
-Brown rice (we got it on the side. Most entrees say "blah, blah" over rice, but if you want to eat "family style" they can serve the rice separately.
- Panaeng Yellow Curry (done vegetarian style): Was all right, but I thought I tasted a gingery aftertaste.
- Pad Kee Mao: Chow fun with Chinese brocolli (cut in flat sheets, instead of just big stalks) with meat and lots of savory gravy. OK.
- Pecan Pie: It was the special dessert of the day. Supposedly a "famous" recipe. Someone in my party commented how light and not oversweet it was. They had just had some Pecan Pie in K'Ville and this was better. 
Service was very good; water and tea was being refilled at an acceptable rate. Waitress took time to explain stuff and was pretty nice....especially for an Asian restaurant.

Parking is usually bad on Irving, but weekday nights aren't bad at all. We went on Wed. at 7:30. 
Also free delivery (5pm - 9:30pm, min. $15)
author: Stan P.

description: This place is excellent. If Marnee Thai is too busy (which it almost ALWAYS is, I mean it is good, no doubt, but it's not THAT good) walk about a half a block up the street and go to Chabaa instead. In fact, since the portions here are bigger, the staff is friendly, and the pace less hurried and frantic, I'd say go here instead of Marnee Thai anytime. I had the green curry and it was fantastic. Not to mention huge. I almost couldn't finish it. I highly recommend this place.
author: Ryan J.

description: Given the atmosphere and prices, I'd give this place a 4.5. It took me a long time to order because there were so many choices on the menu, and everything seemed really good. Anyway, I had a fun lunch on a hot day here; it was like I was in Thailand or something. Well, maybe not, but I had a nice time and didn't complain about the bill after.
author: Alex Y.

description: This place is great. Especially for Thai folks. I'm Thai and I love real spicy food so I come here often and they never disappoint me. Although the food is pretty expensive considering the little amount they give, I love that I can order some Thai dishes that are not on the menu. And they make it super good. Ordering to go is always great. Somehow I feel like I get more food when I order it to go! :D
author: Sweet J.

description: Staff is friendly... restaurant is well kept... service is fast... Love all the food I've tried so far, but the duck fried rice always a fav of mine.. a bonus for me is afterwards, I cross the street for some Quickly! Most def on my repeat list!
author: Carli A.

description: I like the service at this place, the food is... as I like to say, dee-licious! And the chicks that work there are cute. Never hurts to have good looking daughters to help out at the restaurant. So as they say, tip generously. :)
author: Simon L.

description: When you want some simple yet authentic thai cuisine... this is the place to go.  I've tasted almost everything on the menu at least once... but i just love the curries.  They're full of tastiness and it leaves you craving more when you get to the bottome of the dish.  Pineapple fried rice is awesome.  Not too pricey as well.  Well worth it.
author: Kevin L.

description: Love this place! We went there last weekend for a late dinner and we had the spicy chicken wings, the duck, and a seafood dish. The food came out hot and quickly. I am definitely coming back to try the other dishes. Chabaa is open late...YAY!
author: Nikki N.

description:
Standard Thai food at standard prices with standard service and ambiance. The crab fried rice was original and pretty good. It's open late.

I have nothing else to say. It was just okay.
author: Jackie C.

description: This is a cute thai place with plenty of seating.  They work pretty fast so when you order your food, it comes out nice and hot so you arent waiting forever.   I ordered their fried chicken over fried rice dish and it was a good size and tasted really yummy.  I look forward to trying this place again and this time ordering something new.
author: Melody M.

description: I usually frequent Marnee Thai for two reasons, the food selection is wider at Marnee and it's closer from where I work. Yeah, the extra block isn't worh it when you only have an hour lunch. However, the times that I've been to Chabaa, I've enjoyed the food so they definitely deserve the four star rating. I enjoyed the various soups and the hoi jor (bean curd cakes with some kind of pork in it). The taste is surprisingly close to King of Thai's and I'm probably there more than I'm at Marnee Thai. The one thing that Chabaa has over Marnee is the servers. The servers at Chabaa are attractive and very friendly.
author: Christopher T.

description: I went here randomly one day with some friends. The food is good, typical Thai cuisine pretty much. Whats special about this place though, is mainly the decor. It's a pretty chill atmosphere, great place to take friends and chat, clean and comfy. Prices are okay, not cheap, but not overpriced. I would definitely go again to try the other items on the menu, since all I had was some pad thai.
author: Katrina C.

description:
The problem with Thai food is every place tastes the same.  Therefore I don't go to any of them anymore unless someone picks it and since I'm such a nice guy I fake a smile and say "OK".   Well someone picked this place a few months ago.  I went.  There were 6 of us so we had a bunch of dishes.  Corn fritters, curry dish, vegi dishes- they were all good.  Then we went to order the mango with sticky rice for dinner and the waitress told us the mangos suck so don't order.  I was blown away!  The restaurant turned down a sale to preserve their quality.  

Later on I convinced myself the place wasn't that good and I just had low expectations going in.  This past weekend me and the lovely lady made another trip and once again it was damn good.  Larb = boomin', red curry = kickin', tofu dish I can't pronounce = righteous.  Its clear this place is a cut above the rest. 

Bottom line is the Thai food is better than anyplace even close to their price range.  Bonus points for being open late, delivering to the sunset area, and a nice decor. 

The five star waits for the Thai place that can make a curry dish as good as the one I had in Thailand.
author: Joe M.

description: Good sum tum ( papaya salad), if you can't stand the spice, make sure you choose the 3 stars or below, but if you like it hot 4 stars and up if  you dare! good  food and great service. I'll be BACK!!!
author: Daniel W.

description: If you live in the Sunset and want some Thai this is a great place to get it. It is better than Marnee Thai just down the street and a little cheaper. It has a cute vibe and GREAT food. Try the Thom Yum soup. Interesting flavors that you just don't find very often.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Ask for spicy pad thai . It is DELICIOUS !! Sure , it might be kind of pricey at around $8 .. but hey , they give you a really big porpotion !! Best pad thai I've ever had !! Just for that alone , I give it four stars and forgive them for their poor-made curry . Do not , I repeat - DO NOT order the curry . It is ridiciously yucky . It is so watered down and lacks so much flavor . The rice was cold and hard too . I never really sat down here to eat because I always get take out but I will be sure to do so next time .. I like the atmosphere of this place . Btw , the candy they have at the counter is nasty . Don't think you will like it unless you like sour plums .
author: Eileen L.

description: Why hello upgraded+++ King of Thai. I'm sure if any of you have been to King of Thai and then mosied on over to Chabaa, you'd notice the difference in decor, cute thai tea cups, and silverware. I'm not bashing on King of Thai or anything because I go to that place a lot, but for some reason the food tastes better to me at Chabaa. Not to mention that the price for food is pretty much the same at both places. The pad thai tasted a little weird here, but the dish i usually get: rice with pork and garlic is super delicious.
author: Cris L.

description: I have tried many thai restaurants in my life and this is one of my favorites. When my wife and I decide we want to eat thai we always head here. We have been going to this place for years since they opened shortly after buying the previous thai restaurant that was there, they always know what my wife and i want to order before we say it. The service is always great with a smile and sometimes a joke or two. My personal favorites are the chicken satay, garlic fried chicken wings my usual the yellow curry with chicken. My wifes all time favorite is the Papaya Salad and of course the great tasting thai ice tea.
author: Masa M.

description: Two of us had lunch here yesterday. No wait, very good service (guess we didn't have the grumpy waittress) and the food was solid. Between us we had the green curry with chicken, red curry with duck (very well cooked duck, not dry like at some other Thai restaurants), sticky rice and an order of corn cakes to start. Added bonus, the tea they served, a chai-mint taste, I think, was really good.
author: Roger S.

description: Oh yeah. This place rocks.  The food is great.  I especially like the fish cake appetizer.  Go there too often i think.  Good variety of dishes.  Can't wait to go back when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: D Y.

description: Chabaa is a hidden little restaurant on a busy street. I always pass by it and never gave it much concern. But, when you do visit the restaurant, it has a really nice environment with high ceilings. the ambiance is very nice and enjoyable. The portions are in moderate and fairly priced. We chose a pineapple fried rice and the pad thai. Both were very delicious and filling. I only gave it 4 stars because I feel like it's nothing special. Very similar to King of Thai and nothing really exotic. But, if you're down for some typical thai food, this is the place to go - very delicious and reasonably priced.
author: Bridge H.

description: This is the best place to eat late night in the sunset. Everything I have ever eaten is amazing and they know me by name. Stop by and order anything, you won't be disappointed...
author: Michael L.

description: This is a Thai restaurant I like to go to since it's near home.  I rank it above King of Thai for quality and the price is similar to King of Thai, which means this place is better than King of Thai for the same prices.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
i come here for thai food, either dine in or to go. after going to many thai restaurants this place is good compare to the other places . they open late and delivers too. i like their food!! 

i usually come here with friends and boyfriend for lunch/dinner. they have friendly services (altho i have no clue what are they talking about, but they seem to smile a lot!) lol i will come back when i'm feeding for some thai food, definitely!
author: Valerie N.

description: refused to deliver here although we are near-by. rude on the phone, didn't even listen to complete address before saying it was "too far" and hanging up
author: Michael D.

description:
good memories with chabaa =)

I would always come here after my night classes. Open till 1am!
Nice interior, relaxing contemporary lighting.

Friends are happy eating here because they think the waitresses are cute. Waiters, waitresses are all younger, friendly. Tea is good, nice black cups =)

Some favorites of mine and others

the pumpkin curry
fried chicken over fried rice

the sour noodles (forgot the name)

I heard of Marnee and many other places. I tried them but I still
love chabaa!
author: Serena F.

description: Standard... Not too special! we ordered to have delivered, they forgot half of our order and when they brought it it was cold! no good flavor, Thai is supposed to be spicy and out of the 7 things we ordered nothing had a zing to it! i dunno! kind of dissappointed.. but was ok! staff was nice! acnt comment on decor wasnt there..
author: Cindy T.

description: I like the food.  I like it so much I've gone back multiple times.  But here's the thing... I will no longer go here.  The staff (or at least one gal in particular) is rude to the point of unbelievable.  I've gotten her twice, and I'm just not going to go there again.  First time in my life I've never tipped.  I ordered my usual dish last time.  She brought something else.  I pointed out that was not what I ordered.  She would not let it go - kept insisting I had ordered it.  She was determined to get me to admit what she figured was my mistake.  When I finally pointed out that she was prone to errors herself - my beverage was also wrong, as was my daughters, she finally (kinda) let it go.  At that point, I was done and just left without eating the food.  So as much as I like this spot, I'm not going back.
author: LIsa L.

description:
i found this place on city search when i was looking for a place to eat in my neighborhood after 11pm. 

the waitstaff was very friendly, the atmosphere was lovely and very comfortable. the menu had very reasonable prices, and a good selection. the green curry was delicious, as was the panang curry and the peanut sauce. i also tasted the pad thai which was very good, and the crab fried rice, which wouldn't be one of my choices, but it was good if you like large quantities of rice.

i would recommend this place to anyone, especially if you are looking to eat late.
author: Renee L.

description: Right Portion, Right Price. But my roast duck noodle soup ($5.95) tasted a little lackluster. The menu indicated Chinese herb had nowhere to be found.
author: D'Andy C.

description: I love this place!  It has become my 'local thai restaurant' hands down.  The food is delicious, the waitresses (didn't see any waiters) are very friendly and the service is fast.  The waitresses are a little inattentive, even when it is slow which can be annoying.  On the flip side they leave you alone instead of rushing you out the door like so many other restaurants.  I am the type that likes to be left alone to read my book (if I'm there by myself) so that is a big plus.
author: April T.

description: Love the decor when compared to neighboring restaurants. Really clean inside, moderately busy for a Thursday night. Was also easy to find parking after 7pm. Had their eggplant dish with beef that was quite flavorful. Maybe a bit too much for the amount of rice provided, but I do love to eat rice, friend had their pad thai which was similar to everywhere else I've had it. Typical taste on the deserts and drinks when it comes to other Thai restaurants. Didn't try and kick me and my friend out after we were done, so that was a nice plus.
author: Anthony W.

description: I've been to many Thai restaurants around San Francisco, but Chabaa is the only one that I keep coming back to.  Everything from their service to their friendly atmosphere is something I know I can expect when I walk through their doors. I can also expect their delicious food to come at a fair and affordable price. Definitely check out Chabaa.
author: Andy T.

description:
Love Chabaa more for its delivery service and tom yum noodles than the sit-down service or the rest of the menu (it's all good but just not my go-to choice).

The tom yum noodles are a weekly habit, with its just-enough spiciness and meat accouterments.  

The papaya salad is also a good choice.  It is tart, crunchy, sweet and spicy in every bite.

Quick delivery service!
author: Jessi T.

description: I have fond memories of eating at Chabaa with my mother who passed away a couple of years ago. The Chabaa staff knew nothing of her condition. Back then, the staff remembered us as customers and even remembered what my mother liked. The food was fresh and yummy,  reasonably priced, and the service was great. I seem to recall wanting to eat every morsel, leaving nothing behind. My mom really enjoyed their calamari salad that was always delicious. We had the eggplant, which was another one of my mom's favorite dishes. It's good to see that Chabaa has done well enough to expand to a second restaurant. Thanks Chabaa for contributing to nice memories of lunching with my mom and for treating us so well.
author: Akiki A.

description: Yea!  Chabaa avoided the dreaded SVLS (second visit letdown syndrome).  Ditto earlier comments, with added variation of papaya salad, which was pretty good.  Tried red curry prawns instead of combo seafood to see if the paucity of ingredients feature could be circumvented.  Downside: 4 prawns (four, VI, 3 +1).  Upside: they were damned good, and the sauce was again so delicious and thick that the following night I just poured in about 20 thawed frozen prawns in the leftover liquid and had a religious experience.  Green curry chicken and pad kee mao as fabulous as the first time.  4 & 1/2 solid stars again!
author: Ultiminio P.

description:
although quite comparable in the eyes of many to the chain restaurant , "king of thai", i find chabaa to be better overall. chabaa offers its diners a warm and welcoming atmosphere through its decore and friendly waitresses. the quality of the food is top notch although the portions are somewhat on the small side. the prices arent that bad so complaining about portion size isnt that big of a gripe since you do get what you pay for. 

the one thing i love about chabaa (and no, its not their hot/cute waitresses although that definitely is a plus) is that theyre open late and serve alcohol. not to sound like an absolute drunkard thats in need of an AA meeting, but that combination is ideal for a late night outting with the guys.
author: jason k.

description: I'd say this thai place is pretty authentic. Very traditional--their pad thai and thai fried rice is how it should be. So whenever I want that real thai flavor, I come here.
author: Monica D.

description: Started by refugees from the King of Thai chain of restaurants and noodles houses, this small place has a nice atmosphere combined with excellent food. My girlfriend and I went there on opening night, and have kept going back ever sense. The fact that they have very reasonable prices and deliver makes it all the better. The menu has a nice variety that one would expect from a Thai restaurant, but the dishes generally have more than one would expect. They will even deliver to the door when I stop by with my dog for take out.
author: Matt F.

description: I like how they arrange their plates like a puzzle and they have really good Pad Prig King... my new favorite
author: Sara G.

description:
Chabaa is one of my favorite Thai Restaurants...

Compared to most Thai Restaurants in the Sunset District, this restaurant is definitely on the tastier side and 1ups restaurants like King Of Thai any day (not saying it's a bad restaurant). The food is at a reasonable price portion-to-dollar wise and I do go back once every month or so. 

Personal favorite dishes include the beef noodle stew, pad thai, chicken over rice, and for you sweet tooths pineapple fried rice (be careful if you don't like raisins).

Overall a good restaurant lunch or dinner. 4.5/5
author: Kevin C.

description:
To be honest, I haven't tried many thai restaurants before, so I'm not sure what is considered "authentic" and what is not qualified as such. However I have eaten at Chabaa more than a few times, and I usually order pad thai, Soup, or SOup Noodles. the Crunchy Seafood noodles is also one of my faves (reminiscent of a chinese style noodle too)...always consistently made and never gives you a short amount of seafood. Great service, beautiful waitresses, and great thai iced tea!!!!

Yummy stick rice coconut milk dessert too. 

Definitely come and try it out...I can't ever imagine someone not having a good if not great time here...and the service so far has always been great. YUmmy..Wish I can go right now. but it's 4:30 AM. 

They should just open 24 hours. I'll be there...watch.
author: Maria W.

description: still love this place... and still eat it at least once a week.. although I branched out and tried a couple other things.. not a huge fan of their soups though.. so skip those.. but everything else is good.
author: Lili L.

description: This is my go-to place for Thai food in the City - it's worth a trip to the inner sunset.  The price is right, and the food is pretty solid.  Nothing fancy, but that's the beauty of it.  The Thai curries are good, and I also like the Pad See Ewe and Prik Khing.  The staff is very friendly as well, which is always a plus.  The fact that they're open until 1:30 AM pushes them into the 5-star category for me.
author: Alan C.

description: Menu is not cheap at all.  Go to King of Thai instead or the thai place next door.  Small food portion that will make you starve.  Ordered the crab fried rice and couldn't taste any crab flavor, all it was salt and rice.  I could've done that at home.  Cannot think of what was good about this place.
author: YELP U.

description: Chicken wings appetizer wasn't worth it, as Jonas T. writes (San Tung is better anyway), but the thai fried rice was pretty tasty. Just the right amount of saltiness in it (do they use fish sauce in it or just a really light soy sauce?). The pad thai however, was forgettable. The noodle soups that some other tables ordered looked good. I would try one of those if I came here again.
author: Crystal L.

description: mmmmmmmmm, hot, fresh, delicious, open late, and best of all, delivery.
author: Joanne T.

description: One star because they use MSG . Why? Why does a Thai restaurant use MSG? It's so unnecessary! Thai spices are so flavorful - no MSG is needed to "enhance" the flavor!  So I can't eat there... because MSG makes me extremely ill, even in small amounts, even if they say they can leave it out of my food... one contaminated spoon stirs the dish and I will have a reaction. It's so sad... I used to take it for granted that Thai food was SAFE... that they had no need or use for MSG... it's a very sad day for me.
author: Bret W.

description: they have great customer service, i love the food, its a decent price. used to come here almost once a week, then go across the street for pho, or tapioca... dang! hella asiann! HAHA love their rown rice with chicken and eggplant, i always get that-the curry is good too! went for my birthday too!
author: Jessica C.

description: this place was a great cure for a hangover sunday. the fried chicken over fried rice is super delish! i think it might be some of the best friend rice i have ever eaten in my life! it was very fresh and full of garlic! we also ordered the flat noodles with beef, red pepper, and basil and it was bomb. very polite service, delivery after 5pm daily. i will definitely become a regular here and cant wait to try other dishes!
author: M K.

description:
Went there because my friends and I were hungry at 11pm and it's still open. The food was okay. Not good, but not bad either. My roast duck noodle soup was too salty. The same noodle soup from King of Thai was a little too salty to me, too. But that was only a little, this was overly salty. But none of my friends said anything about their food so it could be just me and not the food.

The worst part of that meal was the service. We were served by a heavily powdered lady who was nice enough to warn us that all the flat rice noodle was out before we placed any ordered. And then it came the wrong bowl of noodle soup. But it's okay, as long as the powder on her face didn't fall into the soup. Then it came the bug in my soup. That little creature had been sitting at the bottom of the bowl until I was more than half way through with the noodle. Then it came right in the spoon floating on the soup when I was trying to scoop some roast duck out. Of course it wasn't the heavily powdered lady's fault that the bug was there. But then when my friend showed the bug, which was already on a piece of tissue paper by then, to the heavily powdered lady, instead of apologizing to us, she began to lecture us on how common it was to find bugs in vegetables! "It's from the vegetable...blah blah blah......" To prevent her lecture from damaging my meal further, I told her that I already know that the bug was from the vegetables (we could see the green inside the creature). Smashing the already dead bug like it's alive, the heavily powdered lady raised her voice. In a defense she said that she could "void" my item in a tone I was really afraid the powder on her face would fall off like old paint from a wall.

I left the restaurant very scared that other customers will get the same service from the same waitress. If it's not the lady, it will get three stars, for the fact that it opens late and my friends didn't complain about their food. All in all, King of Thai, with better food and service, is only a few minutes away.
author: Bias W.

description: i've been going to Chabaa Thai for awhile now, and the food is consistently good. love their pad thai. i used to get takeout from Marnee Thai just down the street but soon realized i was paying a few dollars more each time for the same quality food as Chabaa, so now I just go to Chabaa. food always comes out quick and yummy!
author: Jill L.

description: I love Chabaa! The interior and atmosphere is pretty nice and relaxing. The waitresses are friendly, but it takes a while for them to bring the dishes out. I'm pretty impatient and always starving? :( However, the taste makes up for the slowness. I like the fried chicken with fried rice.
author: Tina C.

description: if you're looking for quality food when most places have closed for the night, go here - they're open til 1am during the week and even later on the weekends, i think. get the roasted duck fried rice and/or the pad see ew, and for an appetizer, try the fried chicken wings. and i'm not saying you shouldn't eat here during normal meal times, because you should. i'm just sayin, it's hard to find good food late at night that isn't pizza and sh*t. that's all. i cant remember having better thai food in the city. but then again, who said i know anything about thai food, or food in general. i just think it tastes good.
author: Kevin C.

description: Chabaa graciously donated some food for Mr. Hyphen 2008 (www.hyphenmagazine.com) - it was delicious, and *completely* gone by the end of the event. Just ask any Hyphen magazine staff member for recs to this place. =)
author: Huang P.

description: This place is average. Their food is not especially good or bad... it's real cheap tho.. the noodle soups are about $6 and their rice plates are $7. I've always really liked their thai green curry.. I tried their tom yum noodle soup.. I was kinda disappointed.. My sis had the roast duck fried rice and it was average... she said "it's so average, I don't have words for it."
author: Mari K.

description: Awfull... There is nothing Thai about this place..It's not even edible Chinese food,which is what it actually is!  I ordered the Cashew chicken.. It had been carmelized and burnt in a pot all day or longer. It was old and tastless..Rock bottom ingredients..a lot of MSG; this food needs it... The cashews were cold and stale,thrown in afterwords.I doubt the chef has ever even eaten Thai food.... I did not eat much..... I hope I don't get sick.. A small glass of cheap house cab is $6.75..So much for inexpensive.... I will warn all my friends...... Awfull
author: patrick d.

description: i LOVE this place... this place has the best pad thai ever! we ordered pad thai, red curry, and tom yum soup with shrimp.  The tom yum soup is delish..i also really llke the decor in the place, and the relaxing, ambience...I have been here a couple of times, and i think it is a great place! The service is good. i also like the dessert,, the mangos with sweet rice...yumm!!
author: perla w.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants! First off, you'll always feel welcomed by the staff there. The atmosphere is simple and clean. Food is great. I highly recommend the duck fried rice and the green curry. However, the portion are slightly lacking if you're a big eater, but for most part, I leave with a full belly. Pricing is decent. Late night hours for the nocturnal. Hey, did I mention the green curry is excellent??!
author: misa d.

description: Got takeout last night for the first time, it sucked ! I ordered the Pad Gra Pow, the beef was ground beef which was never stated on the menu, it consisted of what seemed like hoisin sauce with a tiny bit of chlli, a meagre scattering of basil, 2 small strips of red pepper and 3 strips of green pepper. Seemed like they threw it together and not a care was put into it. I could have made it 20 times better myself. Should have grabbed a falafel sandwich next door instead. They won't get my business again.
author: J l.

description: i had take out from here last night, and it was pretty good.  i had the seafood rice noodle soup, and it hit the spot on a cold night.  they forgot our order of veggie pad thai when they delivered the food, however, but they quickly came back and brought it for us.  if i am in the area again and have a thai craving, i will come back.  portions here are hefty.
author: Helen T.

description: i came here randomnly on a last minute find for food for takeout before my sister's piano 30 minute lesson was over a few blocks away.  quickly looked up and down irving for a place open.  dee-lish! i got the praram chicken, cashew chicken, cucumber salad, and some fried rice that came with seafood.  all very good.  i wasn't expecting much out of this place at first since i've been kinda eh with the other asian places on irving. this place is an exception.  i liked how the food was fresh tasting and not greasy or anything.  and good portions too.  the waitstaff are extremely nice and charming as they make you feel at home. total sweethearts as they offered me tea while i waited for my food. very yummy thai food! and the fact they're open til 1 am makes me love this place more!
author: ally o.

description: everything tasted like water!! i ordered the beef stew it has no taste to it what so ever and my boyfriend ordered a fried rice that taste like plain steamed rice!! maybe it was just that night that the chief left early or something but the other nights i came was okay.
author: jophine c.

description: if the food only matched the beautiful surroundings or the gracious service ... disappointment with no expectations ,,,, first presentation, not a strength, as we eat with our eyes, execution, not a strength as standard fare was lacking in flavor and texture, and finally thai cuisine was more chinese if anything ... change chefs and soon, what a wasted space ...
author: tim y.

description: i was definitely satisfied with chabaa. parking was fairly easy, decor and cleanliness were a plus and the service & food were on point. the fried shrimp & pork dumplings were delicious! the sauce was the highlight of this dish - it was sweet & sour, with a hint of honey. if they sold it in stores, i'd be first in line... the pineapple fried rice was perfect. it had the right combo of sweet & salt and the ingredients were fresh. i also ordered a noodle dish - an egg & ground beef over flat noodles. it was different from what i usually order, but not disappointing. prices are affordable too - can't wait to go here again!!
author: Joyce G.

description: nice thai restaurant.. ate there with my friends.. great for sharing...  on the menu there are pics of the food so u can see.. for thai food lover try this restaurant... n tell me what u think..
author: Lily T.

description: My favorite Thai in the city.  I love the pineapple fried rice and phad thai.  They make a great phad kee mao (spicy noodles).  Great taste and good sized portions.  Had almost everything the menu and it was all very good.  They deliver locally and when I lived in the area I could get delivery within about 20 minutes until 10pm.  Now I will drive out of the way across town just to get my favories.  Mr. Anderson and Fifi love you guys!  kob-khun-khrap
author: Ture A.

description: Now that we moved to Santa Barbara, we are totally going to miss Chabaa in the Outer Sunset!!!! This is my favorite Thai restaurant ever. We had my birthday there for the past two years, and also family reunions! They are so nice and helpful when you have the chaos of a big group dining. Food is fantastic, and you can't beat their prices. Staff is great, they even started carrying decaf tea as an option because I can't have caffeine late at night! Now that is great customer service!
author: Jessica F.

description: ordered from this place the other night. got tofu & veggie red curry, pad thai, and vegetarian egg rolls. food was decent. the pad thai was a little lukewarm and clumpy though - but that's probably due to the fact that it took them forever to deliver the food! surprisingly, since the place is right around the corner from my gf''s flat. those are my only complaints about this place.
author: James J.

description: my favorite thai place in the city. i actually drive to/bus it to chabba from 30+ minutes away because i love it so much. i love the great ambiance the super friendly waitresses and the delicious food. highly recommended. great for dates ;)
author: Kismet S.

description: decent thai food that's actually spicy for reasonable prices. they do serve wine even if it's not on the menu ($6.75 a glass -  a bit pricey). i had their red curry w/ roast duck and it was yummy. plus it's open til 1am! in the sunset! that's practically unheard of...
author: Angi C.

description: great food very nice people and good price. only problem was my order got messed up and i wasn't having a great day, but it was still very good. good for small groups of friends but can be very busy
author: T L.

description: I've come here a few times with my friends and haven't yet been disappointed. The service is nice and we've been served pretty fast (but we were usually only one of two tables or so there.) Their spicy wings appetizer is pretty good and there's lots of sauce to go around. I'd probably pass on the appetizer combo next time, but it was nice for it's appetizing purposes.  Pad thai is nothing outta the ordinary.  The pineapple fried rice is gooood but last time I had it it was too salty. Fried banana with ice cream wasn't too cracken.. pretty much what everyone else has been saying about it. Sweet sticky rice with mango wasn't too bad. But I think it is mango season right now? Even though parking sucks here, I'll be back. It's worth the $1.50 MUNI expense!
author: Sheri L.

description: WOW!! What a great surprise! I ordered from here the first time last night and was so pleased.  Definitely try the fried corn cakes!!! The yellow curry was lovely.  I will be ordering from them again soon!!!
author: Bryna K.

description: This is a good place to eat if you're feeling hungry.  The decor is pretty nice, if you're into that type of thing.  Service is fast and friendly and the prices are beyond reasonable.  I eaten here enough times to have faith enough to trust the chefs' judgement and cooking habits, so I wouldnt' be afraid to order anything on the menu.  Delicious!
author: Brian L.

description: I love this place.  I live so close I can either walk there or have them deliver it in under 10 minutes!  They are always very friendly and the chicken noodle soup is delicious.  It's reasonably priced and the portions are generous. It's not super fancy but it's nice and clean.  I've eaten in the restaurant too and the atmosphere is nice.
author: Karli W.

description: Chabba is my favorite Thai place in the sunset.  I love the atmosphere, the service is great, and the food is even better.  My favorite item is appetizer #7, it's ground fish and shrimp stuffed into a bean curd paper and fried served with plum sauces.  The noodles, curry, and meat dishes are fantastic and much less greasy than other places I've tried.  Defiantly try Chabba out if you like Thai.
author: Becky T.

description: I go here when Maree Thai is packed. This place has good food too. The staff is friendly and the thai ice tea is good too.
author: bob k.

description: I love this restarurant!!!!! My favorite is the Rad Naa. In fact, this is my favorite Thai restaruant! Trust me, if you want good, reasonable Thai food, go to this place.
author: Thao C.

description: They're open very late which is rare in San Francisco. I normally get panang curry and sticky rice with mango. In addition to friendly servers, the prices are inexpensive.
author: a b.

description: How does this place have 4 stars?  I've been here several times now out of convenience, which it is because it is open til about 1am, and the service has always been okay, nothing special.  I order to go sometimes and it comes out quickly, so this place isn't a total 1-star restaurant.  But, the quality of food, based on the few dishes I've had, is definitely nothing special, to put it nicely.  I just ordered pad thai again because I was starving, and I'm VERY disappointed.  It's just a big pile of noodles!  Barely any egg and tofu here and there... a couple of shredded carrots and little bamboo shoot thingies (I'm sorry I forget what they're called) and this is supposed to shrimp pad thai but it only has three shrimps - VERY DISAPPOINTING!!  The shrimps are very plain, as is all the meat in every dish I've had.  I believe it was just boiled and tossed in.  NO FLAVOR.  This is not shrimp pad thai it is really a big pile of noodles that doesn't taste great.  I haven't had to go far to have exponentially better thai food.  Not sure I'm coming back.  I mean, being cheap and skimpy really pisses me off.  Okay I'm over it.
author: D M.

description: this place is so friendly and cute!  it's well lit, clean and color coordinated!  the waitresses are also nice.  the food is good, although not extraordinary and the portions are decent.  we've consistently ordered the noodle and curry dishes and they always come out yummy.
author: Raz R.

description: ordered some takeout from there last nite because I was too sick to drive to marnee (they don't deliver). not going back. the food was crap. don't even want to get into it but it's not worth your money. I'm sticking w/ the good places like marnee and osha. there's nothing worse than bad thai! and chabaa is bad thai....
author: Carol C.

description: really good cheap thai food thats right around the corner.  the tom yum soup is some of the best in the city.  its great for a weeknight cheap dinner for two (around 20 dollars).  dont miss out on the spice rack by the way :)
author: matt j.

description: really good.  nice staff, great food.  better than marnee
author: annabel l.
